This is due to menstrual blood being blocked, causing dampness in the organs, and lack of flow resulting in discomfort and nausea. When blood and channels are obstructed, the limbs feel heavy; when wind is involved, it leads to dizziness.

When such signs are present, it is advisable to take several doses of Banxia Fuling Decoction, followed by Fuling Pills with light water to facilitate appetite. Once strength and vitality increase, the mother will be healthy, and the fetus will be well-nourished. There are dozens of remedies for treating obstruction throughout history; regardless of whether the condition stems from deficiency, excess, cold, or heat, those who are gravely ill can find life through this method, which is too numerous to list.[7p]

　　　　　养胎

　　旧说凡受胎三月，逐物变化，禀质未定，故妊娠三月，欲得观犀象猛兽珠玉宝物，欲得见贤人君子盛德大师，视礼乐钟鼓俎豆军旅陈设，焚烧名香，口诵诗书古今箴诫，居处简静，割不正不食，席不正不坐，弹琴瑟，调心神，和情性，节嗜欲，庶事清净，生子皆良长寿，忠孝仁义，聪慧无疾，斯盖文王胎教者也。　　儿在胎日月未满，阴阳未备，脏腑骨节皆未成足，故自初迄于将产，饮食居处，皆有禁忌。　　妊娠食骡肉，产难。[8p]

Nurturing the Fetus

According to ancient teachings, during the first three months of pregnancy, the fetus is undergoing changes and its qualities have yet to stabilize. Therefore, during these three months, one should aspire to see rare and precious items such as rhinoceroses, elephants, ferocious beasts, jewels, and treasures. One should wish to encounter wise and virtuous individuals, masters of great virtue, and observe proper rituals, music, and military arrangements. Incense should be burned, and one should recite poetry and classical wisdom, both ancient and modern, for guidance. The living space should be simple and quiet; one should avoid improper food and seating arrangements. Activities such as playing the zither should be employed to regulate the mind, harmonize emotions, and temper desires. By maintaining a tranquil life, the child will generally be healthy, long-lived, loyal, filial, benevolent, righteous, wise, and free of ailments. This can be attributed to the prenatal education imparted by King Wen.

When the child is still in the womb and the months are not complete, the balance of yin and yang is not yet attained, and the organs, bones, and joints have not fully developed. Thus, from conception until just before delivery, there are various dietary and living restrictions. Consuming mule meat during pregnancy can lead to difficult childbirth.[8p]

　　妊娠食兔肉犬肉，令子无音声并缺唇。　　妊娠食鸡子及干鲤鱼，令子多疮。
　　妊娠食葚并鸭子，令子倒出心寒。
　　妊娠食雀肉并豆酱，令子满面多(黑干)(黑曾)黑子。　　妊娠食雀肉饮酒，令子心淫情乱，不畏羞耻。　　妊娠食冰浆，绝胎。
　　妊娠勿向非常地大小便，必半产杀人。
　　　　　徐之才逐月养胎方

　　妊娠一月名始胚，饮食精熟，酸美受御，宜食大麦，毋食腥辛，是谓才正。　　妊娠一月，足厥阴脉养，不可针灸其经。足厥阴内属于肝，肝主筋及血。一月之时，血行否濇，不为力事，寝必安静，无令恐畏。　　妊娠一月，阴阳新合为胎，寒多为痛，热多卒惊，举重腰痛，腹满胞急，卒有所下，当预安之，宜服乌雌鸡汤。　　妊娠二月名始膏，无食辛燥，居必静处，男子勿劳，百节皆痛，是为胎始结。[9p]

During pregnancy, eating rabbit and dog meat causes the child to be mute and have a cleft lip.
Eating eggs and dried carp during pregnancy leads to the child having many sores.
Eating mulberries and duck during pregnancy causes the child to feel a cold heart.
Eating sparrow meat and fermented soybeans during pregnancy results in the child having dark spots on the face.
Eating sparrow meat and drinking alcohol during pregnancy leads to the child having lustful emotions and shamelessness.
Consuming ice during pregnancy results in miscarriage.
Pregnant women should not relieve themselves in unusual places, as it may cause harm to half the fetus.

During the first month of pregnancy, known as the beginning of the embryo, the diet should be light and nutritious, favoring sour and sweet foods; barley is recommended, and strong flavors should be avoided, which is called proper nourishment.
In the first month of pregnancy, the foot Jueyin pulse must be nurtured, and acupuncture should not be performed on its channels. The foot Jueyin pertains to the liver, which governs tendons and blood. At this time, blood flow should not be stagnant, strenuous activities should be avoided, and resting should be calm without fear.
In the first month of pregnancy, the union of yin and yang forms the fetus; excess cold causes pain, while excess heat leads to sudden fright. Lifting heavy objects causes lower back pain, and a full abdomen may result in urgency. These should be addressed with calming measures, and black hen soup is recommended.
In the second month of pregnancy, known as the beginning of the fat formation, spicy and dry foods should not be consumed; women should stay in tranquil places, men should not exert themselves, and all joints may ache, indicating the early development of the fetus.[9p]

　　妊娠二月，足少阳脉养，不可针灸其经。足少阳内属于胆，主精。二月之时，儿精成于胞里，当慎护之，勿惊动也。　　妊娠二月，始阴阳踞经，有寒多坏不成，有热即萎悴，中风寒，有所动摇，心满脐下悬急，腰背强痛，卒有所下，乍寒乍热，宜服艾叶汤。　　妊娠三月名始胎，当此之时，未有定仪，见物而化，欲生男者操弓矢，欲生女者弄珠玑。欲子美好，数视璧玉；欲子贤良，端坐清虚。是谓外象而内感者也。　　妊娠三月，手心主脉养，不可针灸其经。
手心主内属于心，无悲哀思虑惊动。　　妊娠三月为定形，有寒大便青，有热小便难，不赤即黄，卒惊恐忧，愁嗔怒喜顿仆，动于经脉，腹满绕脐痛或腰背痛，卒有所下，宜雄鸡汤。　　妊娠四月，始受水精以成血脉，食宜稻粳，羹宜鱼雁，是谓盛血气，以通耳目而行经络。　　妊娠四月，手少阳脉养，不可针灸其经。手少阳内输三焦，四月之时，儿六腑顺成，当静形体，和心志，节饮食。[10p]

In the second month of pregnancy, the Lesser Yang Pulse of the foot is nourished, and one must not needle or apply moxibustion to its meridian. The Lesser Yang of the foot is associated with the gallbladder and governs essence. During this month, the essence of the child is formed in the womb, and one must take care to avoid disturbances.

In the second month of pregnancy, the interaction of yin and yang begins, and excess cold can cause complications, while excess heat may lead to decay. Cold wind may cause fluctuations, resulting in fullness in the heart and urgency below the navel, along with lower back and hip pain. If there are sudden episodes of chills and fever, one should take a mugwort leaf decoction.

In the third month of pregnancy, known as the beginning of the fetus, there is yet no fixed form. When encountering objects, the fetus may change, and if desiring a boy, one should practice archery, whereas to conceive a girl, one should play with pearls. To wish for a beautiful child, one should frequently gaze at jade; to wish for a virtuous child, one should sit quietly in a clear and empty space. This reflects external appearances and inner feelings.

In the third month of pregnancy, the Heart Pulse of the hand is nourished, and one must not needle or apply moxibustion to its meridian. The Heart governs internal functions, and one should avoid sadness, excessive thought, and disturbances.

By the third month, the shape is determined. If there is cold, the stool may be blue; if there is heat, urination may be difficult, either not red or yellow. Sudden fear and worry can lead to emotional instability, triggering changes in the meridians, causing fullness or pain around the navel or lower back. If there are sudden episodes of distress, one should take a rooster decoction.

In the fourth month, the essence of water begins to form blood vessels. One should eat rice and congee, and the soup should contain fish or wild goose, which nourishes blood and facilitates the ears and eyes and the flow of meridians.

In the fourth month, the Lesser Yang Pulse of the hand is nourished, and one must not needle or apply moxibustion to its meridian. The Lesser Yang of the hand connects to the Sanjiao (Triple Warmer), and during this month, the child's six viscera begin to develop. One should maintain a calm form, harmonize the mind, and regulate diet.[10p]

　　妊娠四月，有寒，心下温温欲呕，胸膈满不欲食，有热小便难，数数如淋状，脐下苦急，卒风寒，颈项强痛，寒热，或惊动身躯，腰背腹痛，往来有时，胎上迫胸，心烦不得安，卒有所下，宜菊花汤。　　妊娠五月，始受火精以成其气，卧必晏起，沐浴浣衣，深其居处，厚其衣服，朝吸天光以避寒殃，其食稻麦，其羹牛羊，和以茱萸，调以五味，是谓养气以定五脏。　　妊娠五月，足太阴脉养，不可针灸其经。足太阴内输于脾，五月之时，儿四肢皆成，无大饥，无甚饱，无食干操，无自炙热，无大劳倦。[11p]

In the fourth month of pregnancy, there is chilliness, a warm sensation under the heart with a desire to vomit, fullness in the chest and diaphragm with no appetite, heat with difficulty in urination, frequent and painful like a drip, urgently painful beneath the navel, sudden onset of wind and cold, pain and stiffness in the neck, alternating chills and fever, or disturbances in the body, pain in the lower back and abdomen occurring occasionally, pressure from the fetus on the chest, agitation and inability to find peace, and sudden descent of something. One should use chrysanthemum soup.

In the fifth month of pregnancy, one begins to receive the essence of fire to nurture its energy. It is essential to rise late from sleep, bathe and wash clothes, deepen the living environment, and wear thick clothing. In the morning, absorb the sunlight to ward off cold calamities. One should eat rice and wheat, and consume soup made from cattle and sheep, seasoned with gardenia and balanced with the five flavors, which is said to nurture energy and stabilize the five organs.

During the fifth month of pregnancy, nourishing the foot Taiyin meridian is crucial; acupuncture should not be performed along this meridian. The foot Taiyin connects to the spleen, and at this time in May, the limbs of the baby are fully formed. There should be no great hunger, no excessive fullness, no dry foods, no self-heat generated, and no extreme labor and fatigue.[11p]

　　妊娠五月，有热苦头眩心乱呕吐，有寒苦腹满痛小硬数，卒有恐怖，四肢疼痛寒热，胎动无常处，腹痛闷顿欲仆，卒有所下，阿胶汤主之。　　妊娠六月，始受金精以成其筋，身欲微劳，无得静处，出游于野，数观走犬及视走马，食宜鸷鸟猛兽之肉，是谓变腠理纫筋，以养其力，以坚其膂。　　妊娠六月，足阳明脉养，不可针灸其经。足阳明内属于胃，主其口目。六月之时，儿口目皆成，调五味，食甘美，无太饱。[12p]

In the fifth month of pregnancy, if there is heat manifesting as a bitter headache, dizziness, and chaotic heart with vomiting; or if there is cold leading to a bitter, full abdomen with painful, hard, and frequent discomfort, along with sudden fear, pain in the limbs with alternating cold and heat, irregular fetal movement, abdominal pain causing dizziness and a desire to collapse, and sudden discharges, then a decoction of Ejiao (colla corii asini) should be administered.

In the sixth month of pregnancy, one begins to absorb essential elements to strengthen the muscles. The body may feel slightly fatigued, and one should avoid quietude; instead, they should go out into the fields, observe running dogs and horses. Diet should consist of the meat of predatory birds and fierce beasts, as this is said to transform the skin and strengthen the muscles, thereby nurturing strength and solidifying the body.

In the sixth month of pregnancy, the foot yangming meridian nourishes; acupuncture should not be performed on its pathway. The foot yangming corresponds to the stomach, which governs the mouth and eyes. By this sixth month, the child’s mouth and eyes are fully developed; flavors should be balanced, with emphasis on sweet and delicious foods, while avoiding excessive fullness.[12p]

　　妊娠六月，卒有所动不安，寒热往来，腹内胀满，身体肿，惊怖忽有所下，腹痛如欲产，手足烦疼，宜服麦门冬汤。　　妊娠七月，始受木精以成其骨，劳身摇肢，无使定止，动作屈伸，以运血气，居处必燥，饮食避寒，常食稻粳以密腠理，是谓养骨而坚齿。　　妊娠七月，手太阴脉养，不可针灸其经。手太阴内属于肺，主皮毛。七月之时，儿皮毛已成，无大言，无号哭，无薄衣，无洗浴，无寒饮。　　妊娠七月，忽惊恐摇动，腹痛，卒有所下，手足厥冷，脉若微寒烦热，腹满短气，常苦颈项及腰背强，葱白汤主之。[13p]

During the sixth month of pregnancy, there are disturbances and unease, with alternating cold and heat, abdominal distension, body swelling, sudden fright, and a sensation of impending labor accompanied by abdominal pain, and discomfort in the hands and feet. One should take a decoction of Ophiopogon.

In the seventh month of pregnancy, the essence of wood begins to form the bones. One must avoid overexertion, and should engage in movements that flex and stretch to circulate blood and qi. The living environment must be dry, and one should avoid cold foods and regularly consume glutinous rice to strengthen the skin and teeth.

In the seventh month, the hand Taiyin meridian nourishes the body, and acupuncture should not be applied to this channel. The hand Taiyin is associated with the lungs, which govern the skin and hair. By the seventh month, the child's skin and hair have formed, so there should be no loud shouting, no crying, no thin clothing, no baths, and no cold beverages.

In the seventh month, if sudden fright occurs, abdominal pain arises, and there is a sensation of something descending, along with coldness in the hands and feet, with a pulse feeling slightly cold and restless, and distension in the abdomen with shortness of breath, often accompanied by neck and back tension, one should use a scallion white soup to treat it.[13p]

　　妊娠八月，始受土精以成肤革，和心静息，无使气极，是谓密腠理而光泽颜色。　　妊娠八月，手阳明脉养，不可针灸其经。手阳明内属于大肠，主九窍。八月之时，儿九窍皆成，无食燥物，无辄失食，无怒大起。　　妊娠八月，中风寒有所犯触，身体尽痛，乍寒乍热，动不安，常苦头眩，痛绕脐下寒，时时小便白如米汁，或青或黄，或使寒栗，腰背苦冷而痛，目(目巟)(目巟)，芍药汤主之。　　妊娠九月，始受石精以成皮毛，六腑百节，莫不毕备，饮醴食甘，缓带自持而待之，是谓养毛发，致才力。[14p]

In the eighth month of pregnancy, the essence of earth begins to form skin and flesh. The heart should be calm and resting, and the vital energy must not be excessive. This is called the delicate pores, producing luster and color.

In the eighth month of pregnancy, the hand's yangming channel nourishes; needling and moxibustion on this channel is not allowed. The hand's yangming is connected internally to the large intestine, controlling the nine orifices. By this month, all nine orifices of the infant are complete. Avoid dry foods, do not miss meals, and do not let anger rise excessively.

In the eighth month of pregnancy, if one suffers from cold wind and is harmed, the body will feel pain, alternating between cold and hot, and one will be restless, often suffering from dizziness, with pain around the lower abdomen indicating cold. Urine may be as white as rice water, sometimes blue or yellow, perhaps causing chills, and the back and waist may be cold and painful; this is treated with Shaoyao Decoction.

In the ninth month of pregnancy, the essence of stone begins to form skin and hair. All six bowels and joints are fully developed. Enjoy sweet drinks and tasty food, and maintain a gentle pace as you await the arrival; this is called nourishing the hair and cultivating strength.[14p]

　　妊娠九月，足少阴脉养，不可针灸其经。足少阴内属于臂，肾主续缕。九月之时。儿脉续缕皆成，无处湿冷，无着炙衣。　　妊娠九月，若卒得下痢，腹满悬急，胎上冲心。腰背痛不可转侧，短气，宜半夏汤。　　妊娠十月，五脏俱备，六腑齐通，纳天地气于丹田，故使辟节人神皆备，但俟时而生。　　姙娠一月始胎，二月始膏，三月始胞，四月形体成，五月能动，六月筋骨立，七月毛发生，八月脏腑具，九月谷气入胃，十月诸神备，日满即产矣。宜服滑胎药。八月即服丹参膏养胎，临月服，令滑而易产。[15p]

During pregnancy, in the ninth month, the kidney's lesser yin meridian is nurtured, and one should not use acupuncture or moxibustion on its channels. The lesser yin internally pertains to the arms, and the kidneys are responsible for continuity. By the ninth month, the child's veins are fully formed; there should be no moisture or coldness, nor should one wear heavy clothing.

In the ninth month of pregnancy, if one suddenly experiences diarrhea with a full and urgent abdomen, the fetus may press against the heart. If there are pains in the lower back that prevent turning, and shortness of breath, one should take Banxia Decoction.

In the tenth month of pregnancy, all five organs are complete, and the six intestines are unblocked, absorbing the air of heaven and earth into the elixir field, hence the essence of both human and divine beings is ready, simply awaiting the right time for birth.

Pregnancy starts in the first month with the formation of the fetus, develops into essence in the second month, forms the womb in the third month, shapes the body in the fourth month, begins to move in the fifth month, establishes the muscles and bones in the sixth month, grows hair in the seventh month, has all internal organs complete in the eighth month, has grain essence entering the stomach in the ninth month, and all spirits are ready in the tenth month, leading to delivery when the time is right. It is advisable to take miscarriage-preventing medicine. In the eighth month, one should take Danshen extract to nurture the fetus, and in the final month, prepare for an easy delivery.[15p]

　　　　　脉法

　　左手尺中浮大者男，右手尺中沉细者女。若来而断绝者，月水不利。
　　　　活人书 【宋　朱肱】

　　　　　妊娠伤寒用药方法

　　妊妇伤寒，仲景无治法，用药宜有避忌，不可与寻常妇人一概治之。　　伤寒安胎，宜阿胶散或白朮散。
　　伤寒憎寒发热，当发其汗，宜葱白汤。　　伤寒或中时行，洒淅作寒，振栗而悸，或加哕者，宜苏木汤。　　伤寒头痛，嘿嘿不欲饮食，胁下痛，呕逆痰气，宜黄龙疡。　　伤暑头痛，恶寒，身热躁闷，四肢疼痛，背项拘急，唇口干燥，宜柴胡石膏汤。　　伤寒四日至六日已来，加心腹胀，上气，渴不止，食饮不多，腰疼体重者，宜枳实散。　　伤寒头目旋疼，壮热心躁，宜旋覆花汤。　　伤寒壮热，呕逆头疼，不思饮食，胎气不安者，宜麦门冬汤。　　妊妇发斑，变为黑色，宜栀子大青汤。　　壮热头疼，心烦呕吐，不下食，宜芦根汤。　　伤寒头疼壮热，宜栀子五物汤。[16p]

Pulse Diagnosis

The floating and large pulse on the left wrist indicates a male, while the sinking and fine pulse on the right wrist indicates a female. If there is a sudden interruption, it indicates unfavorable conditions regarding the moon and water.

— From "Book of Living Humans" by Zhu Gong, Song Dynasty

Treatment Methods for Febrile Illness in Pregnant Women

For a pregnant woman suffering from febrile illness, there is no standard treatment prescribed by Zhongjing. Medication should be used with caution and should not be applied as it would be for ordinary women. For febrile illness while pregnant, it is advisable to use Ejiao powder or Baizhu powder.

If there are symptoms of fever and aversion to cold, one should induce sweating using scallion white soup. If febrile illness presents with chills, trembling, and palpitations, one should use Sonmu soup. For headache due to febrile illness accompanied by loss of appetite, pain in the flanks, and nausea, Huanglong powder is recommended.

In cases of heat-related headache, aversion to cold, high temperature causing restlessness, pain in limbs, stiffness in the back and neck, and dry lips, Chaihu Shigao soup should be used. When febrile illness persists for four to six days, with additional symptoms like abdominal distension, shortness of breath, unquenchable thirst, little food intake, and lower back pain, Zhisuan powder is appropriate.

For headache with dizziness from febrile illness, along with high fever and anxiety, Xuanfu flower soup is recommended. If there is severe fever, vomiting, headache, and restless fetal energy, Maimendong soup should be used. If a pregnant woman develops a rash that turns black, Zhizhi Dayqing soup is indicated.

For severe headache and high fever, accompanied by irritability and vomiting with no food intake, Lu Gen soup is recommended. If the fever and headache persist, Zhi Zi Wu Wu soup is advisable.[16p]

　　伤寒头痛，肢节痛壮热，宜前胡七物汤。　　妊妇七月，伤寒壮热，赤斑变黑，溺血，宜升麻六物汤。发热烦闷，宜葛根一物汤。　　热病，宜葱白豉汤。

　　　　妇人良方 【宋　陈自明】

　　　　　总论

　　《巢氏病源》论：妊娠一月名胚胎，足厥阴脉养之。二月名始膏，足少阳脉养之。三月名始胎，手心主脉养之。当此之时，血不流行，形象始化，未有定仪，因感而变。欲子端正庄严，常口谈正言，身行正事；欲生男，宜佩弦执弓矢；欲生女，宜佩韦施环佩；欲子美好，宜佩白玉；欲子贤能，宜看诗书。是谓外象而内感者也。四月始受水精以成其血脉，手少阳脉养之。五月始受火精以成其气，足太阴脉养之。六月始受金精以成其筋，足阳明脉养之。[17p]

In cases of cold damage with headache, limb and joint pain, and strong fever, it is advisable to use Qihu Qiwu Decoction. For pregnant women in the seventh month experiencing cold damage with strong fever, red spots turning black, and blood in the urine, it is suitable to use Shengma Liuwu Decoction. For fever and agitation, Ge Gen Yiwutang Decoction is recommended. In cases of heat illness, it is appropriate to use Congbai Chi Decoction.

Women’s Good Formulas - Chen Ziming from the Song Dynasty

General Discussion

According to "Chao's Sources of Disease": In the first month of pregnancy, it is called embryo, nourished by the Foot Jueyin Meridian. In the second month, it is called beginning of fat, nourished by the Foot Shaoyang Meridian. In the third month, it is called beginning of fetus, nourished by the Hand Shenyin Meridian. At this time, blood does not circulate, the form begins to take shape, and there is no established pattern, thus it reacts to environmental influences. If desiring a proper and dignified child, one should often speak proper words and engage in proper conduct; if wanting to have a boy, it is advisable to wear a bow and arrow; if wanting a girl, one should wear ornamental accessories; to have a beautiful child, one should wear white jade; to have a wise and capable child, one should read poetry and books. This is called external appearance influencing internal response. In the fourth month, the essence of water is received to form blood vessels, nourished by the Hand Shaoyang Meridian. In the fifth month, the essence of fire is received to form Qi, nourished by the Foot Taiyin Meridian. In the sixth month, the essence of metal is received to form tendons, nourished by the Foot Yangming Meridian.[17p]

七月始受木精以成其骨，手太阴脉养之。八月始受土精以成肤革，手阳明脉养之。九月始受石精以成毛发，足少阴脉养之。十月五脏六腑关节，人神皆备。此其大略也。又五脏论有称耆婆者论：一月如珠露；二月如桃花；三月男女分；四月形象具；五月筋骨成；六月毛发生；七月游其魂，儿能动左手；八月游其魄，儿能动右手；九月三转身；十月受气足。更有《颅顖经》云：一月为胎胞精血凝也。二月为胎形成胚也。三月阳神为三魂，四月阴灵为七魄，五月五行分五脏也。六月六律，定六腑也。七月精开窍，通光明也。[18p]

In July, the essence of wood begins to form the bones, nourished by the hand of the Taiyin channel. In August, the essence of earth begins to form the skin and flesh, nourished by the hand of the Yangming channel. In September, the essence of stone begins to form the hair, nourished by the foot of the Shaoyin channel. In October, the five organs, six bowels, and joints are all complete, with both spirit and divinity present. This is a general overview. Additionally, the discussion on the five organs mentions a term "Qi Po": In January, resembling dew on pearls; in February, like peach blossoms; in March, the division of genders; in April, the complete form appears; in May, the tendons and bones are formed; in June, the hair begins to grow; in July, the soul roams, and the child can move the left hand; in August, the spirit roams, and the child can move the right hand; in September, the three turns of the body; in October, the qi is fully received. Moreover, the "Lü Shen Jing" states: In January, it is the coagulation of the essence and blood of the fetal sac; in February, the fetal formation as an embryo; in March, the yang spirit becomes the three souls; in April, the yin spirit becomes the seven phantoms; in May, the five elements differentiate into the five organs; in June, the six laws are established for the six bowels; in July, the essence opens the orifices, connecting to brightness.[18p]

八月元神具，降真灵也。九月宫室罗布已定，生人也。十月受气足，万象成也。今推究数说，如五脏论者类皆浅鄙，妄托其名。至于三藏佛书，且涉怪诞，漫不可考。今按《颅顖经》三卷云中古巫方所撰。其巢氏论妊娠至三月始胎之时，欲谈正言，行正事，佩弦韦，执弓矢，施环佩，佩白玉，读诗书之类，岂非胎教之理乎？尝试推巢氏所论云，妊娠脉养之理，若厥阴肝脉也，足少阳胆脉也，为一脏腑之经，余皆如此。且四时之令，必始于春木，故十二经之养始于肝，所以养胎在一月二月。[19p]

In August, the original spirit is complete, and the true spirit descends. In September, the structures of the palace are established, and human life begins. In October, the energies are fully received, and all phenomena are formed. Now, if we delve into numerical theories, those resembling the discussion of the five viscera are all shallow and vulgar, wrongly attributing their names. As for the Tripitaka Buddhist texts, they are often bizarre and unfathomable. Now, referencing the "Luhuan Sutra," which consists of three volumes, it states that ancient shamans composed it. The discussion of the Nestorian school asserts that pregnancy begins with the formation of the fetus in the third month; this leads to discussions of legitimate words and actions, wearing corded belts, holding bows and arrows, and adorning oneself with rings and white jade, which is akin to the principles of胎教 (fetal education). It is advisable to consider the Nestorian school's assertion about the nourishment principles of pregnancy, which relate to the Jueyin Liver Meridian and the Shaoyang Gallbladder Meridian, indicating one internal organ's channels. The seasonal influences naturally commence in spring with wood, thus the nourishment of the twelve meridians begins with the liver, suggesting that fetal nourishment occurs in the first and second months.[19p]

手心主心胞络脉也，手少阳三焦脉也，属火而夏旺，所以养胎在三月四月。手少阴手太阳，乃心脉也，以君主之官无为而尊也。足太阴脾脉也，足阳明胃脉也，属土而旺长夏，所以养胎在五月六月。手太阴肺脉也，手阳明大肠脉也，属金而旺秋，所以养胎在七月八月。足少阴肾脉也，属水而旺冬，所以养胎在九月。又况母之肾脏系于胎，是母之真气，子之所赖也。至十月，儿于母腹之中，受足诸脏气脉所养，然后待时而生。此论奥微而有至理，世更有明之者，亦未有过于巢氏之论矣。余因述其说。[20p]

The palm corresponds to the heart, and the Hand Shaoyang Sanjiao meridian, associated with fire, thrives in summer, hence nurturing the fetus in March and April. The Hand Taiyin and Hand Yangming correspond to the heart meridian, representing the sovereign's authority, ungrasped yet revered. The Foot Taiyin corresponds to the spleen, and the Foot Yangming corresponds to the stomach, associated with earth that flourishes in late summer, thus nurturing the fetus in May and June. The Hand Taiyin corresponds to the lung, and the Hand Yangming corresponds to the large intestine, associated with metal that thrives in autumn, hence nurturing the fetus in July and August. The Foot Shaoyin corresponds to the kidney, associated with water that flourishes in winter, thus nurturing the fetus in September. Moreover, the mother's kidney is linked to the fetus, representing the mother’s true essence that the child relies on. By the tenth month, the child in the mother’s womb receives nourishment from all the vital energies of the organs before awaiting the right time to be born. This discussion is profound and contains essential truths; in the world, there are clearer explanations, yet none surpass the theories of the Nest Clan. Thus, I present this discourse.[20p]

　　　　　论胎教

　　胎教产图之书，不可谓之迂而不加信，然亦不可狎犯之。方今俚俗之家，与不正之属，将息避忌，略不加意。或药毒不消，或产于风露，无产厄而子母均安者，亦幸有之。若保胎之法，须多方豫养，方无后患。如邻家有所兴修，亦或犯其胎气，令儿破形殒命。如刀犯者形必伤，泥犯者窍必塞，打击者色青黯，系缚者筋拘挛。如此等验，有如指掌，不可不慎也。[21p]

On Prenatal Education

Books on prenatal education cannot be dismissed as irrelevant or without merit, yet they should not be treated lightly. Nowadays, in homes of common folk and among those of improper nature, there is little care for avoidance of taboos, leading to negligence. It is fortunate if one does not suffer from harmful substances or is not affected by wind and dew, resulting in both mother and child remaining safe. However, to ensure a healthy pregnancy, one must take various precautions to prevent future issues. For instance, if a neighbor undertakes construction work, it may disturb the prenatal energy, potentially harming the child. Just as injuries can occur from sharp objects, impurities from mud can obstruct passages, physical impacts can cause discoloration, and bindings can lead to muscle constraints. Such phenomena are evident and must not be disregarded.[21p]

　　　　　孕元立本章

　　有泰初，有泰始。混沌一判，既见气矣，故曰泰初；既立形矣，故曰泰始。气初形始，天地相因，生生化化，品物彰矣。故曰：大哉干元，万物资始！至哉坤元，万物资生！有生之初，虽阳予之正，育而充之，必阴为之主。因形移易，日改月化，坤道之代终也。谓之妊，阳既受始，阴壬之也，壬子谓之妊。谓之胞，己为正阳，阴包之也。谓之胚，未成为器，犹云坯也。谓之胎，既食于母，为口以也。若娠则以时动也，若怀则以身依之也。天之德，地之气，阴阳之至和，相与流薄于一体，唯能顺时数，谨人事，勿动而伤，则育之道得矣。观四序之运，生长收藏，代出万物，仪则咸备，而天地之气，未始或亏者，盖阴阳相养以相济也。
　　　　　验胎法

　　妇人经脉不行，已经三月，欲验有胎，川芎生为末，空心浓煎艾汤调下二钱，腹内微动则有胎也。[22p]

Chapter on the Original Conception

In the beginning of great beginnings, there was the Tai Chu, and in the commencement of great initiation, there was the Tai Shi. When chaos was first differentiated, the essence became evident; thus it is called Tai Chu. Once forms were established, it was designated Tai Shi. When the essence initially took shape, heaven and earth were interdependent, creating and transforming, manifesting all things. Hence it is said: Great is the source, as everything takes its beginnings! Profound is the nurturing earth, for all things draw life from it! At the onset of birth, though the positive aspect of Yang is predominant, nurturing and fulfilling, it is essential to understand that Yin is of greater significance. Due to the transformation of forms, days shift and months change, marking the end of the cycle governed by the earth’s way. This is called conception; when Yang has commenced, it is upheld by Yin, known as Renzi. This is referred to as the womb; with the self being the positive Yang, enveloped by Yin. This is called the embryo; it has not yet formed into a vessel, still referred to as clay. This is called the fetus; it has already fed on its mother, for sustenance. If pregnancy manifests, it stirs at the proper times; if it is but a carrying, the body relies upon it. The virtue of heaven, the essence of earth, and the extreme harmony of Yin and Yang flow together as one body; one must follow the seasonal rhythms, be mindful of human affairs, and refrain from actions that could inflict harm, thereby mastering the path of nurturing. Observing the cycles of the four seasons - growth, storage, and emergence - all myriad forms manifest, harmoniously fitting the measures, while the essence of heaven and earth has never been lacking; indeed, Yin and Yang support and complement one another.

Method for Examining Pregnancy

If a woman’s meridians do not flow, and it has been three months, wishing to verify if there is a fetus, take Chuanxiong and grind it into powder, then mix two qian with a strong decoction of mugwort and take it. If there is a slight movement within the abdomen, then there is a fetus.[22p]

　　　　　胎杀避忌胎前将护法

　　一受孕之后，切宜避忌胎杀所游。如经云：刀犯者形必伤，泥犯者窍必塞，打击者色青黯，系缚者筋拘挛。甚至母殒，祸如反掌。　　月游胎杀　立春在房床，惊蛰在户 【单扇，】 清明在门 【双扇，】 立夏在灶，芒种在母身，小暑在灶，立秋在碓【按京本云在正北方子云，】 白露在厨前，寒露在门，立冬在户及厨，大雪在垆及灶，小寒在房母身。　　十干日游胎杀　甲己日占门，乙庚日占碓磨，丙辛日占井灶，丁壬日占厨廨，戊癸日占米仓。　　十二支日游胎杀　子丑日占中堂，寅卯辰酉日占灶，巳午日占门，未申日占篱下，戌亥日占房。　　六甲旬游胎杀　甲子旬游窻碓，甲戌旬游正厅，甲申旬游中庭，甲午旬游房内，甲辰旬游房中，甲寅旬游二门。　　太史局日游胎杀　每遇癸巳甲午乙未丙申丁酉五日，在房内北。　　庚子辛丑壬寅，在房内南。[23p]

Avoiding Taboos Related to Fetal Termination and Protecting the Fetus Before Conception

Once pregnant, one must diligently avoid the taboos associated with fetal termination. As the classics state: those affected by knives will surely suffer harm, those who encounter mud will have their orifices blocked, those who experience strikes will turn pale and dark, and those who are tied will have their muscles strained and cramped. This may even lead to the mother's demise; disaster can strike like a snap of the fingers.

Monthly Observances of Fetal Termination
Beginning of spring should be in the bedroom, the awakening of insects at the door (single window), Qingming at the gates (double doors), the beginning of summer at the stove, grain planting on the mother’s body, slight heat at the stove, the beginning of autumn at the millstone (as some texts state, it is due north), White Dew should be in front of the kitchen, Cold Dew at the door, the start of winter at the door and in the kitchen, heavy snow at the stove and hearth, and slight cold in the mother’s room.

Daily Observances of Fetal Termination by the Ten Heavenly Stems
On days of Jia and Ji, one should occupy the door; on Yi and Geng days, the mill; on Bing and Xin days, the well and stove; on Ding and Ren days, the kitchen and storeroom; on Wu and Gui days, the rice granary.

Daily Observances of Fetal Termination by the Twelve Earthly Branches
On Zi and Chou days, occupy the main hall; on Yin, Mao, Chen, and You days, occupy the stove; on Si and Wu days, occupy the door; on Wei and Shen days, occupy under the fence; on Xu and Hai days, occupy the room.

Ten Heavenly Stems and the Fortnightly Observances of Fetal Termination
During the Jia-Zi period, occupy the windows and mill; during the Jia-Xu period, occupy the main hall; during the Jia-Shen period, occupy the courtyard; during the Jia-Wu period, occupy inside the house; during the Jia-Chen period, occupy within the house; during the Jia-Yin period, occupy the two doors.

Observances from the Grand Historian's Bureau
Every time one encounters Gui-Si, Jia-Wu, Yi-Wei, Bing-Shen, Ding-You five days, be in the northern part of the house.
For Geng-Zi, Xin-Chou, Ren-Yin, be in the southern part of the house.[23p]

　　癸卯一日，在房内西。
　　甲辰乙巳丙午丁未四日，在房内东。　　六成六己日，在房内中。余日在外无占。　　凡游在房内，不宜于方位上，安床帐及扫舍，皆凶。　　又有小儿杀及本年三杀，及产母身黄定命，皆不可犯。凡妊娠之后，将此贴于房内，常照见之，切不可穿凿修掘，移钉系篱壁重物展压之类。犯之，重则胎死腹中，母亦不利；轻则子受其殃，成人之后，必定破形，拳挛跛缩喑痖。犯之极验。
　　　　　食忌

　　一受孕之后，切宜忌不可食之物，非惟有感动胎气之戒，然于物理亦有厌忌者。设或不能戒忌，非特延月难产，亦能令儿破形损母，可不戒哉。　　食鸡肉糯米合食，令子生寸白虫。食羊肝，令子生多厄。食鲤鱼脍及鸡子，令儿成疳生疮。食犬肉，令子无声音。食兔肉，令子唇缺。食鳖，令子项短及损胎。食螃蟹，令子横生。豆酱合藿香，食之堕胎。食生姜，令子多指生疮。食虾蟆鳝鱼，令儿喑痖。食驴马肉，延月难产。[24p]

On the first day of the Guiliao month, I was in the room facing west.

On the fourth day of the Jiachen, Yisi, Bingwu, and Dingwei months, I was in the room facing east. On the sixth of the Jixi day, I was in the central part of the room. Other days were without occupation.

For all activities inside the house, it is not advisable to be in certain positions; setting up beds and curtains and cleaning the space, all bring misfortune. Moreover, there are dangers for small children and the three fatal dangers of the year; maternal health is affected by certain fateful decisions, and these should not be violated. After conception, it is crucial to keep this notice visible in the room and strictly avoid activities such as digging, moving nails, or placing heavy objects against the walls. Violating these can result in severe consequences: either a miscarriage or harm to the mother; if less severe, it may lead to deformities in the child, such as shrinkage or muteness. Violating these warnings yields significant effects.

Dietary Restrictions

After conception, it is imperative to avoid certain foods, not only for the sake of the fetus but also due to their physical properties. If one cannot adhere to these restrictions, it may not only prolong labor but could also harm the mother and deform the child.

Consuming chicken meat and glutinous rice together can cause white worms in the child. Eating lamb liver can bring misfortune to the child. Eating carp sashimi and eggs can result in sores. Dog meat can render the child voiceless. Rabbit meat can cause cleft lips. Eating turtle can lead to a short neck and fetal harm. Crabs can cause abnormal births. Soybean paste with shiso can induce miscarriage. Ginger can lead to ulcers on the child's fingers. Consuming frog, eel, or snake can make the child mute. Eating donkey or horse meat can prolong labor and make delivery difficult.[24p]

　　　　　孕妇药忌

　　蚖螌水蛭地胆虫，乌头附子配天雄。(艹蹢)(艹躅)野葛蝼蛄类，乌喙侧子及蝱虫。牛黄水银并巴豆，大战蛇蜕及蜈蚣。牛膝藜芦并薏苡，金石锡粉及雌雄。牙硝芒硝牡丹桂，蜥蜴飞生及(上庶下虫)虫。代赭蚱蝉腻粉麝，芫花薇蓹草三棱。槐子牵牛并皂角，桃仁蛴螬和茅根。粮根硇砂与干漆，亭长波流菵草中。瞿麦(艹闾)茹蟹爪甲，猬皮赤箭赤头红。马刀石蚕衣鱼等，半夏南星通草同。干姜蒜鸡及鸡子，驴肉兔肉不须供。切须妇人产前忌，此歌宜记在心胸。　　 【按方书：大黄、硫黄、桃仁、红花、槐花、虎掌、狼牙、荛花、生鼠、溲疏、木鳖、苏木、甘遂，俱忌。】[25p]

Prohibited Medicines for Pregnant Women

Leeches, toads, and earthworms, aconite and fuzi paired with tianxiong. Wild kudzu, mole crickets, huanghua and various insects. Cattle bile, mercury, and dazi, as well as snake skin and centipedes. Cow’s knee and reed, along with coix. Metal powders, tin, and both male and female substances. Yashao, mangxiao, and peony with osmanthus, lizards breeding and insects. Daitian, grasshoppers, fat powder, musk, yanhua, and weeds with three edges. Sophora seeds, morning glory, and soap pods, peach kernels, larvae, and reed roots. Grain roots, burneal sand, and lacquer, perch and waveflow in fields of gentian. Qumai and sheanzhuru, crab claws and shells, weasel skin with arrows and the red-headed ones. Horse knives, stone, silk, fish, etc., and banxia and nanxing mingled with coix. Dried ginger, garlic, chickens and eggs, donkey meat and rabbit meat should not be offered. Pregnant women must strictly abstain from these, this song should be kept in mind.

Note: According to medicinal texts, rhubarb, sulfur, peach kernels, safflower, sophora flower, tiger's claw, wolf teeth, wildflower, field mouse, sorrel, houttuynia, and euphorbia are all forbidden.[25p]

　　　　　恶阻

　　妊娠恶阻病，《产宝》谓之子病，《巢氏病源》谓之恶阻。由胃气怯弱，中脘停痰，脉息和顺，但肢体沉重，头眩择食，惟嗜酸咸，甚者寒热呕吐，胸膈烦满，半夏茯苓丸主之。　　 【注　前证若中脘停痰，用二陈汤加枳壳。若饮食停滞，用六君子加枳壳。若脾胃虚弱，用异功散。若胃气不足，用人参橘皮汤。兼气恼加枳壳。胸胁痞闷，再加苏梗。胁痛，再加柴胡。若饮食少思，用六君子加紫苏、枳壳。头运体倦，用六君子汤。若脾胃虚弱，呕吐不食，用半夏茯苓汤。盖半夏乃健脾气化痰滞之主药也。[26p]

Nausea and Vomiting in Pregnancy

Nausea and vomiting in pregnancy is referred to as a fetal illness in "The Treasure of Childbirth," and termed "nausea and vomiting" in "The Sources of the Chao Family." This condition arises from weak stomach qi, phlegm stagnant in the middle burner, with a pulse that is harmonious and steady. However, the limbs feel heavy, the head becomes dizzy, and there is a selective craving for sour and salty foods. In severe cases, there may be cold, heat, vomiting, and a feeling of fullness in the chest and diaphragm. The main treatment is the Banxia Fuling Pill.

Note: If the symptoms include phlegm stagnation in the middle burner, use Erchen Decoction with Zhike. If there is food stagnation, use Liu Junzi Decoction with Zhike. If the spleen and stomach are weak, use Yigong Powder. If the stomach qi is insufficient, use Ren Shen and Chen Pi Decoction. For accompanying emotional distress, add Zhike. If there is chest and hypochondriac oppression, add Sugeng. For hypochondriac pain, add Chaihu. If there is little appetite and excessive thinking, use Liu Junzi Decoction with Zisu and Zhike. For dizziness and fatigue, use Liu Junzi Decoction. If the spleen and stomach are weak with vomiting and lack of appetite, use Banxia Fuling Decoction, as Banxia is the chief herb for strengthening the spleen and transforming phlegm stagnation.[26p]

脾胃虚弱而呕吐，或痰涎壅滞，饮食少思，胎不安，必用茯苓半夏汤倍加白朮。然半夏、白朮、茯苓、陈皮、砂仁，善能安胎气健脾胃，余常用验矣。】　　 【按《大全》恶阻证有轻重，轻者不服药亦无妨，重者须以药疗之。《千金方》以半夏茯苓汤、茯苓丸，专治阻病。然此二药，比来少有服者，以半夏有动胎之性，盖胎初结虑其易散，此不可不谨也。仲景《伤寒论》有用黄龙汤者，小柴胡汤中去半夏是也。此盖为妊娠而设。王子亨则有白朮散，《局方》则有人参丁香散，杨振则有人参橘皮汤，齐十朋则有醒脾饮子，皆不用半夏，用之多效。】[27p]

If one has a weak spleen and stomach leading to vomiting, or if phlegm and fluids are obstructed, with little appetite and an unsettled fetus, one must use modified Fuling Banxia Decoction with increased Baizhu. Banxia, Baizhu, Fuling, Chenpi, and Sharen are effective at calming the fetus and strengthening the spleen and stomach, and I have often used them effectively.

According to the "Complete Compendium," there are varying severities of obstructive conditions; mild cases do not require medicine, but severe cases must be treated with medication. The "Thousand Gold Prescriptions" uses the Banxia Fuling Decoction and Fuling Pill specifically to treat these obstructive diseases. However, these two prescriptions have been rarely used lately, since Banxia has the nature of provoking the fetus. For a fetus that is just beginning to settle, there is a concern that it could easily disperse; this must be approached with caution. In "Discussion of Cold Damage," Zhang Zhongjing mentions using Huanglong Decoction, which is Baizhu Decoction without Banxia. This is likely meant for pregnancy.

Wang Ziheng has a Baizhu Powder, "Jufang" has a Ginseng and Clove Powder, Yang Zhen has a Ginseng and Tangerine Peel Decoction, and Qi Shipeng offers a Xingspi Drink—none of these use Banxia, and they all have multiple effects.[27p]

　　　　　胎动不安

　　夫人以胃气壮实，冲任荣和，则胎得所，如鱼处渊。若气血虚弱，无以滋养，其胎终不能成也，宜下之以免其祸。　　 【注　前证宜用妊娠腰腹背痛方论主之。其胎果不能安者，方可议下，慎之慎之！】　　妊娠胎动，或饮食起居，或冲任风寒，或跌仆击触，或 怒伤肝木，或脾气虚弱，当各推其因而治之。若因母病而胎动，但治其母。若因胎动而母病，唯当安其胎。轻者转动不安，重者必致伤坠。若面赤舌青是儿死也；面青舌赤吐沫是母死也；唇口色青两边沬出是子母俱死也。[28p]

Unsettled Fetal Movements

When a woman has a strong and robust stomach Qi, along with harmonious Chong and Ren, the fetus can settle properly, like a fish in deep water. However, if the Qi and blood are weak and unable to nourish, the fetus ultimately cannot develop, and it is advisable to induce labor to avoid disaster.

(Note: For earlier symptoms, one should use methods addressing back pain during pregnancy. If the fetus cannot be settled, only then should one consider inducing labor, doing so with utmost caution!)

Fetal movements during pregnancy can be influenced by various factors: diet and daily activities, exposure to wind and cold affecting Chong and Ren, accidental falls or impacts, anger harming the liver, or a weakness of spleen Qi. Each cause should be identified and treated accordingly. If the fetal movements are caused by the mother's illness, one should treat the mother. Conversely, if the fetal movements lead to the mother's illness, the focus should solely be on stabilizing the fetus.

In mild cases, there may be unsettled movements, while severe cases could result in miscarriage. If the face is red and the tongue is blue, it indicates fetal death; if the face is blue and the tongue is red with froth at the mouth, it signals maternal death; if both lips and mouth are blue with froth coming out on both sides, it indicates the death of both mother and child.[28p]

察而治之。　　 【注　前证胎气郁滞者，用紫苏饮。脾气虚弱者，六君子汤加苏壳。郁结伤脾者，归脾汤加柴栀。郁怒伤肝脾者，四七汤加芎归。怒动肝火者，加味小柴胡汤。若胎已死，急用平胃散加(石卜)硝腐化之。按大全妊娠胎动不安者，由冲任经虚受胎不实也，亦有饮酒房室过度损动不安者，有悮击触而胎动者，有喜怒气宇不舒伤于心肝触动血脉者，有信医宜服暖补反为药所害者，有因母病而胎动者，但治母病，其胎自安。有胎不坚固，动及母疾，但当安胎，其母自愈。】[29p]

Observe and manage accordingly.

[Note: For cases where fetal qi is stagnant, use a perilla drink. For those with weak spleen qi, use the Six Gentlemen Decoction with added perilla seed. For stagnation harming the spleen, use the Return to the Spleen Decoction with added coptis. For anger affecting both liver and spleen, use the Four-Seven Decoction with added angelica and chuanxiong. If liver fire is provoked by anger, add a modified Xiao Chai Hu Decoction. If the fetus is already deceased, urgently use Ping Wei Powder with (stone salt) to dissolve. According to the comprehensive texts, unsettled fetal movement during pregnancy is due to deficiency in the Chong and Ren meridians leading to improper conception; it may also stem from excessive drinking and intercourse causing instability, or impact from external force causing fetal movement. Emotional disturbances like joy or anger affecting the heart and liver may also disturb the blood vessels. Additionally, over-reliance on medicinal warmth and tonics could harm instead. If maternal illness affects fetal movement, treating the maternal condition will naturally stabilize the fetus. When the fetus is not firmly anchored and movement affects the mother’s health, simply securing the fetus will also heal the mother.][29p]

　　　　　漏胎下血

　　妊娠经水时下，此由冲任气虚，不能约制。盖心小肠二经相为表里，上为乳汁，下为月水，故妊娠经水壅之以养胎，畜之以为乳。若经水时下，名曰胞漏，血尽则毙矣。　　 【注　前证若因风热，用防风黄芩丸。若因血热，用加味逍遥散。若因血虚，用二黄散。若因血去太多，用八珍汤；未应，补中益气汤。若因肝火，用柴胡山栀散。若因脾火，用加味归脾汤。若因事下血作痛，用八珍汤加阿胶、熟艾。若因脾胃虚弱，用补中益气汤加五味子。若因脾胃虚陷，用前汤倍用升麻、柴胡。[30p]

Leaking Blood from the Fetus

When menstruation occurs during pregnancy, it is due to the deficiency of the Chong and Ren channels, which cannot maintain proper regulation. The heart and small intestine channels are interrelated; the former governs breast milk, while the latter governs menstrual blood. Therefore, during menstruation, the blood is obstructed to nourish the fetus and provide milk. If menstruation occurs, it is called "fetal leakage," and if the blood is completely lost, it leads to death.

Note: If the condition is due to wind-heat, use Fang Feng Huang Qin Wan. If due to blood-heat, use Jia Wei Xiao Yao San. If due to blood deficiency, use Er Huang San. If due to excessive blood loss, use Ba Zhen Tang; if ineffectual, use Bu Zhong Yi Qi Tang. If due to liver fire, use Chai Hu Shan Zhi San. If due to spleen fire, use Jia Wei Gui Pi Tang. If the bleeding is painful, use Ba Zhen Tang with added Ejiao and cooked Ai Ye. If due to weak spleen and stomach, use Bu Zhong Yi Qi Tang with Wu Wei Zi added. If due to sinking of the spleen and stomach, use the previous formula with increased Sheng Ma and Chai Hu.[30p]

若晡热内热，宜用逍遥散。】　　 【按《大全》：夫姙娠漏胎者，谓妊娠数月而经水时下也。此由冲任脉虚，不能约制手大阳少阴之经血故也。冲任之脉，为经络之海，起于胞内，手太阳小肠脉也，手少阴心脉也，是二经为表里，上为乳汁，下为月水。有妊之人，经水所以断者，壅之养胎，畜之以为乳汁也。冲任气虚，则胞内泄，不能制其经血，故月事时下，亦名胞漏，血尽则人毙矣。又有因劳役喜怒，哀乐不节，饮食生冷，触冒风寒，遂致胎动。若母有宿疾，子脏为风冷所乘，气血失度，使胎不安，故令下血也。[31p]

If there is internal heat in the afternoon heat, one should use the Xiaoyao Powder. According to the "Great Compendium": The term 'miscarriage' refers to a situation where menstruation occurs during pregnancy after several months. This is due to the deficiency of the Conception and Penetrating vessels, which cannot control the blood of the Yangming and Shaoyin channels. The Conception and Penetrating vessels are considered the sea of the meridians, originating from inside the womb. The Hand Taiyang Small Intestine channel and the Hand Shaoyin Heart channel are its interior and exterior, and they are related to milk production above and menstrual blood below. In pregnant individuals, menstruation ceases because of the obstruction necessary to nurture the fetus and provide nourishment for milk. When the energy in the Conception and Penetrating vessels is deficient, the internal womb leaks and cannot contain the menstrual blood, resulting in its flow during the monthly cycle, also known as 'womb leakage'; if the blood is entirely lost, it leads to death. Additionally, factors such as overexertion, excessive emotions, irregularity in diet, consumption of cold foods, and exposure to wind and cold can lead to fetal movements. If the mother has a chronic illness, the fetus may be affected by wind and cold, resulting in imbalances in Qi and blood, and causing instability in the pregnancy, which can lead to bleeding.[31p]

曾有以孕妇月信不绝而胎不损，问产科熊宗古。答曰：妇人血盛气衰，其人必肥，既娠之后，月信常来而胎不动。若据晚进观之，便以为漏胎。若作漏胎治之，则胎必堕。若不作漏胎治，则其胎未必堕。今推宗古之言，诚有旨也。巢氏云：妇人经闭不利，别无所苦者，是谓有子，以其经血蓄之以养胎，拥之为乳汁也。有子之后，畜以养胎矣，岂可复能散动耶？所以然者，有姙而月信每至，是亦未必因血盛也。若谓妇人荣经有风，则经血喜动，以其风胜则可也。既荣经为风所胜，则所来者非养胎之血。[32p]

There was once a case where a pregnant woman continued to have her monthly cycle without harm to the fetus, and someone consulted the obstetrician Xiong Zonggu. He replied: When a woman's blood is abundant and her vital energy is weak, she tends to be plump. After conception, if her monthly cycle continues without disturbance to the fetus, one might mistakenly consider this as a case of miscarriage. If treated as a miscarriage, the fetus is sure to be lost. However, if no treatment for miscarriage is applied, the fetus may still survive. Based on Zonggu's words, there is indeed wisdom. The Chao family states that when a woman experiences absence of menstruation without other afflictions, it is said that she is with child, as her menstrual blood is retained to nourish the fetus and to produce milk. After conception, the resources are used to nourish the fetus; how can they still disperse and be in motion? Therefore, if a pregnant woman regularly experiences her monthly cycle, it does not necessarily mean it is due to abundant blood. If we say that a woman’s menstruation is affected by wind, then her menstrual blood may be inclined to move because the wind is strong. But if the menstruation is overwhelmed by wind, the forthcoming blood is not the nurturing blood for the fetus.[32p]

以此辨之，若作漏胎治之，必服保养补胎之药，且胎不损。强以药滋之，乃所谓实实虚虚也，其胎终堕宜矣。若医者，如荣经有风之理，专以一药治风，经信可止或不服药，胎亦无恙。然而有胎本不固而因房室不节，先漏而后堕者，须作漏胎治之，此又不可不审也。】　　妊娠下血，因冷热不调，七情失宜，气血不和所致。若伤于胎，则痛而下血，甚则胎堕矣。　　 【注　前证若因气怒，用小柴胡汤。若因风热，用一味防风丸。若因血热，用一味子芩丸。若因脾气虚弱，用六君子汤。若因中气下陷，用补中益气汤。若气血盛而下血者，乃因儿小饮少也，不必服药。】[33p]

To distinguish this, if one treats a threatened miscarriage, they must take restorative medicine to support the fetus, so the fetus is not harmed. If one forcefully uses medicine to nourish it, what is known as substantial and insubstantial will occur, and the fetus will surely be lost. If the physician treats it as if there is a wind in the channels, relying solely on one medicine for wind, it may be proper to stop or not take medicine, and the fetus will also remain unharmed. However, if the fetus is inherently unstable due to lack of restraint in intimate relations, leading to initial bleeding followed by miscarriage, one must treat the threatened miscarriage, and this must be carefully considered.

Bleeding during pregnancy is caused by an imbalance of hot and cold, emotional disturbances, and disharmony of qi and blood. If it harms the fetus, there will be pain and bleeding, and in severe cases, it may lead to miscarriage.

Notes: If the indication is due to anger, use Xiao Chai Hu Decoction. If due to wind-heat, use a single ingredient Fang Feng pill. If due to blood heat, use a single ingredient Ziqin pill. If due to weakness of spleen qi, use Liu Junzi Decoction. If due to sinking of middle qi, use Bu Zhong Yi Qi Decoction. If there is strong qi and blood with bleeding, it is due to the child being small and drinking little, and no medicine is necessary.[33p]

　　　　　惊胎坠扑

　　妊娠惊胎者，乃怀妊将满，胎神已具，遂扑伤胎，甚至下血不醒。若欲验其子母安否，当参胎动不安方论治之。　　 【注　前证若因怒跌仆，或手足抽搐，用钓藤汤。若因气滞，用紫苏饮。若因脾胃气虚，用六君子加苏梗。若郁结伤脾，用归脾汤。若郁怒伤肝脾，用四七汤加芎、归。若去血过多，用佛手散；如不应，胶艾汤。气血虚，八珍加胶、艾。】[34p]

Shock and Miscarriage

Shock during pregnancy occurs when the expectant mother is near term, the fetal spirit is fully present, but a shock injures the fetus, even leading to bleeding and unconsciousness. To assess the well-being of both the mother and child, one should consider the irregularity of fetal movement and treat accordingly.

Note: If the condition is due to anger, falling, or limb spasms, use Diaoteng Decoction. If caused by Qi stagnation, use Zisu Drink. If due to spleen and stomach Qi deficiency, use Six Gentlemen Decoction with added perilla stem. If it is an emotional disturbance that injures the spleen, use Gui Pi Decoction. If frustration and anger harm both Liver and Spleen, use Si Qi Decoction with added Chuanxiong and Gui. If there is excessive bleeding, use Fo Shou Powder; if that doesn't work, use Jiao Ai Decoction. For Qi and blood deficiency, use Ba Zhen Decoction with added gelatin and mugwort.[34p]

　　　　　胎气上逼

　　妊娠将养如法，则血气调和，胎得其所，而产亦易。否则胎动气逆，临产亦难，甚至危矣。　　 【注　前证若气逆胎上，用紫苏饮；饮食不甘，兼以四君子。若内热晡热，兼以逍遥散。若胃火所致，用四君、黄芩、枳壳、柴、栀。若脾郁所致，用归脾汤加柴、栀、枳壳。】
　　　　　数欲堕胎

　　夫胎乃阳施阴化，荣卫调和，经养完全，十月而产。若血气虚损，不能养胎，所以数堕也。凡妊妇腰痛多堕胎。　　 【注　按丹溪云：血气虚乏，不能荣养，其胎则堕。譬如枝枯则果落，藤萎则花坠。又云：堕于内热而虚者，于理为多。盖孕至三月上属相火，所以易堕。不然，何以黄芩、熟艾、阿胶等为安胎之妙如此也。大抵治法须审某月属某经，育养而药之。】[35p]

Fetal Qi Ascending

If pregnancy is nurtured according to the proper methods, then the blood and Qi harmonize, the fetus is in its proper place, and childbirth is easy. Otherwise, if the fetal movement causes Qi to reverse, childbirth becomes difficult and may even be perilous.

Note: If there are symptoms of Qi reversal with the fetus high, use perilla drink; if appetite is poor, combine it with Four Gentlemen Decoction. If there is internal heat with afternoon heat, combine with Xiao Yao San. If due to stomach fire, use Four Gentlemen, Huang Qin, Zhi Ke, Chai Hu, and Zhi Zi. If caused by spleen stagnation, use Gui Pi Tang with added Chai Hu, Zhi Zi, and Zhi Ke.

Frequent Miscarriage

The fetus is formed by Yang acting on Yin, requiring harmony of nourishment and defense to flourish, resulting in a delivery after ten months. If the blood and Qi are weak, they cannot nourish the fetus, leading to frequent miscarriages. Pregnant women who experience back pain are more likely to miscarry.

Note: According to Danxi, when blood and Qi are deficient and cannot nourish the fetus, it leads to miscarriage. It is like a withered branch causing the fruit to fall, or a wilted vine causing the flowers to drop. He also notes that miscarriages are more common due to internal heat and deficiency, especially during the first three months when it is associated with Yang fire, making miscarriage easier. If not, how can Huang Qin,熟艾 (mugwort), and Ejiao (ass hide glue) be so effective in preventing miscarriage? Generally, treatment methods must be carefully aligned with the months and associated meridians for nurturing and medication.[35p]

　　　　　胎不长

　　夫妊娠不长者，因有宿疾，或因失调，以致脏腑衰损，气血虚弱而胎不长也。当治其宿疾，益其气血，则胎自长矣。　　 【注　前证更当察某经络，审其所因而治之。】
　　　　　未足月欲产

　　妊娠未足月而痛如欲产，或应产而难，或为子烦，用知母一味，蜜丸桐子大，粥饮服之；或槐子、蒲黄等分为丸，酒服；或蒲黄水调钱许，并效。　　 【注　小产重于大产。盖大产如瓜熟自脱，小产如生采断其根蒂。岂不重哉！而人轻忽，死于是者多矣。大抵治法宜补形气，生新血，去瘀血为主。若未足月痛而从产，用芎归补中汤，倍加知母止之。产而血不止，人参黄芪汤补之。产而心腹痛，当归川芎汤主之。元气弱而欲产，八珍汤固之。出血过多而发热，圣愈汤治之。若汗不止或昏愦喘咳，急用独参汤。[36p]

Fetal Growth Issues

In cases where fetal growth is insufficient during pregnancy, it may be due to pre-existing ailments or disharmony, leading to weakened organs and insufficient qi and blood, thus hindering fetal development. Treating the underlying ailments and nourishing qi and blood will result in natural growth of the fetus. 【Note: One should further examine specific meridians to determine the cause and treat accordingly.】

Premature Labor Symptoms

If pregnancy is not yet full term but there are pains resembling labor, or if labor is difficult or the child is distressed, one may use Zhimu (Anemone) as the sole ingredient, forming it into pills the size of a tung seed to be taken with porridge; or mix equal parts of Huai seed and Puhuang (Catkins) into pills to be taken with wine; or mix Puhuang with water in a coin-sized amount and apply similarly. 【Note: Miscarriage is more serious than full-term delivery. A full-term delivery is like a ripe fruit falling naturally, while a miscarriage is like breaking a root before it has a chance to grow. Is this not serious? Yet many disregard it, resulting in many deaths. Generally, the treatment should focus on nourishing physical strength and qi, generating new blood, and removing stagnant blood as the priority. If pain occurs before full term and mimics labor, use Xuanguishen and Guizhong Decoction, increasing the amount of Zhimu to soothe the pain. If there is excessive bleeding after labor, use Ren Shen (Ginseng) and Huang Qi (Astragalus) decoction for nourishment. If there is pain in the heart and abdomen post-delivery, use Danggui Chuanxiong Decoction. If the vital energy is weak and there is a desire to give birth, use Ba Zhen Tang (Eight Treasure Decoction) to stabilize it. For excessive bleeding accompanied by fever, use Shengyu Decoction. If sweating does not stop or there are symptoms like confusion, gasping, or coughing, urgently apply Dushen Decoction.**[36p]

若发热烦躁，或肉瞤筋惕，用八珍汤。大渴面赤，脉洪而虚者，用当归补血汤。身热面赤，脉沉而微者，用四君、姜、附以回其阳可也。东垣云：昼发热而夜安静，是阳气自旺于阳分也。昼安静而夜发热躁，是阳气下陷于阴中也。如昼夜俱发热者，是重阳无阴也。当竣补其阴。王太仆云：如大寒而甚热之不热，是无火也。热来复去，昼见夜伏，夜发昼止，时节而动，是无火也。如大热而甚寒之不寒，是无水也。热动复止，倏忽往来，时动时止，是无水也。若阳气自旺者，补中益气汤。阳气陷于阴者，四物二连汤。重阳无阴者，四物汤。无火者八味丸。无水者六味丸。】[37p]

If there is fever and irritability, or if there are muscle spasms, use the Eight Treasure Decoction. If there is great thirst and a red face, with a pulse that is surging yet weak, use the Angelica Blood Nourishing Decoction. If there is body heat and a red face, with a pulse that is deep yet faint, use the Four Gentlemen Decoction with ginger and aconite to restore the yang. Dongyuan states: if there is fever during the day and calm at night, it means the yang energy is flourishing. If there is calm during the day and feverish irritability at night, it means the yang energy is descending into the yin. If there is fever both day and night, it signifies an excess of yang without yin; one should nourish the yin. Wang Taifu states: if there is great cold yet fever persists, it indicates a lack of fire. If heat comes and goes, presenting during the day and retreating at night, with night heat halting by day, it demonstrates a lack of fire. If there is great heat yet extreme cold persists, it indicates a lack of water. If heat moves and stops suddenly, shifting in and out at times, this also indicates a lack of water. If the yang energy is flourishing, use the Middle Benefit Qi Decoction. If the yang energy is trapped in the yin, use the Four Herbs and Two Licorice Decoction. If there is an excess of yang without yin, use the Four Herbs Decoction. If there is no fire, use the Eight Flavor Pill. If there is no water, use the Six Flavor Pill.[37p]

　　　　　子烦

　　妊娠苦烦闷者，以四月受少阴君火以养精，六月受少阳相火以养气，若母心惊胆寒，多有是证。《产宝》云是心肺虚热，或痰积于胸。若三月而烦者，但热而已。若痰饮而烦者，吐涎恶食。大凡停痰积饮，寒热搏吐，甚则胎动不安。　　 【注　前证若因内热用竹叶汤，气滞用紫苏饮，痰滞用二陈、白朮、黄芩、枳壳，气郁用分气饮加川芎，脾气虚弱用六君、紫苏、山栀。】[38p]

Child Distress

For those who experience anxiety and distress during pregnancy, in the fourth month, one should receive the fire of the lesser yin to nourish essence; in the sixth month, the fire of the lesser yang to nourish qi. If the mother feels frightened and anxious, this often indicates such symptoms. "The Birth Treasure" states it is due to the heart and lungs being deficient and overheated, or phlegm accumulating in the chest. If the distress occurs in the third month, it is merely heat. If phlegm and fluid cause distress, there may be vomiting of saliva and aversion to food. Generally, when phlegm and fluid accumulate, and cold and heat clash causing vomiting, it can lead to fetal movements becoming unstable.

[Note: For the aforementioned symptoms due to internal heat, use bamboo leaf decoction; for qi stagnation, use perilla drink; for phlegm stagnation, use Er Chen (Two Aged) decoction with bai zhu (white atractylodes), huang qin (scutellaria), and zhi ke (bitter orange); for qi depression, use fen qi drink with chuan xiong (sichuan lovage); for spleen qi deficiency, use Six Gentlemen decoction with perilla and gardenia.][38p]

　　　　　鬼胎

　　夫人脏腑调和，则血气充实，精神健旺，风邪鬼魅，不能干之。若荣卫虚损，精神衰弱，妖魅之类乘之，内入于脏，亦如怀妊之状，故曰鬼胎也。　　 【注　前证若因七情脾肺亏损，气血虚弱，行失常道，冲任乖违而致之者，乃元气不足，病气有余也。若见经侯不调，就行调补，庶无是证。治法以补元气为主而佐以雄黄丸之类行散之。若脾经郁结气逆者，用加味归脾汤调补之。若脾虚血不足者，用六君、芎、归培养之。肝火血耗者，用加味逍遥散滋抑之。肝脾郁怒者，用加味归脾、逍遥二药兼服。肾肝虚弱者，用六味地黄丸。】[39p]

Ghost Fetus

When a woman's organs are in harmony, her blood and qi are abundant, and her spirit is strong, then wind and evil spirits cannot harm her. If the protective energy (wei) is weak and her spirit is diminished, then supernatural beings can invade her organs, resembling the state of pregnancy; thus, it is called a ghost fetus.

Note: If this condition arises due to the seven emotions causing deficiency in the spleen and lungs, leading to weak qi and blood, deviating from its normal path, then it is a matter of insufficient original qi and excess pathogenic qi. If there are irregularities in the pulse, adjustments should be made to restore balance, avoiding this condition. The treatment method focuses primarily on replenishing original qi, supplemented by dispersing agents like arsenic pills. If there is stagnation in the spleen meridian leading to reversed qi, modify the Gui Pi Decoction for supplementation. If there is spleen deficiency and insufficient blood, use Six Gentlemen Decoction with Chuanxiong and Angelica to nourish it. If liver fire consumes the blood, use an enhanced version of Xiaoyao Powder to nourish and suppress it. If there is liver and spleen stagnation due to anger, take the modified Gui Pi and Xiaoyao medicines together. If both kidney and liver are weak, use Six-Ingredient Pill with Rehmannia.[39p]

　　　　　小便不通

　　夫妊娠小便不通，为小肠有热，传于脬而不通耳。若兼心肺气滞，则致喘急。陈无择云：妊娠胎满逼胞，多致小便不利。若心肾气虚，清浊相干，而为诸淋。若胞系了戾，小便不通，名曰转胞。若胎满尿出，名曰遗尿。　　 【注　按丹溪先生云：转脬小便闭，多因胎妇虚弱，忧闷性躁，食厚味，古方用滑利疏导药，鲜效。若脬为胎所压而不通，但升举其胎，胞系疏而小便自行。若脐腹作胀，而小便淋闭，此脾胃气虚，胎压尿脬，四物、二陈、参、朮，空心服后，探吐数次自安。窃谓前证亦有脾肺气虚，不能下输膀胱者；亦有气热郁结膀胱，津液不利者，亦有金为火烁，脾土湿热甚而不利者，更当详审施治。】[40p]

Difficulty in Urination

When a woman is pregnant and experiences difficulty in urination, it is caused by heat in the small intestine that obstructs the bladder. If there is also stagnation of qi in the heart and lungs, it may lead to shortness of breath. Chen Wuzhe states that when the fetus is large and pressing on the bladder, it often results in difficulty in urination. If there is deficiency of qi in the heart and kidneys, the clear and turbid fluids may collide, leading to various forms of dysuria. If the fetus is improperly positioned, leading to obstruction in urination, it is called "transformed bladder." If the fetus is large enough to obstruct the outflow of urine, it is called "enuresis."

According to Danxi, difficulty in urination due to the bladder being pressed often stems from the weakness of the pregnant woman, who may be anxious and easily agitated, potentially consuming rich foods. Traditional remedies using lubricating and guiding herbs have shown limited effectiveness. If the bladder is merely being pressed by the fetus and cannot expel urine, simply elevating the fetus may allow the bladder to become unobstructed and enable urination. If there is distention in the abdominal area, with obstruction to urination, this indicates a deficiency of spleen and stomach qi, with the fetus pressing on the bladder. The Four Substances, Two Chen, ginseng, and atractylodes can be taken in an empty stomach; vomiting several times may bring relief. I suggest that the prior condition may also indicate deficiency of spleen and lung qi, unable to descend to the bladder; there may also be stagnation of heat in the bladder preventing the proper flow of fluids, or excessive damp-heat in the spleen and earth contributing to the obstruction. Further careful inquiry and treatment should be administered.[40p]

　　　　　子淋

　　妊娠小便淋者，乃肾与膀胱虚热不能制水。然妊妇胞系于肾，肾间虚热而成斯证，甚者心烦闷乱，名曰子淋也。　　【注　前证若颈项筋挛，语濇痰甚，用羚羊角散。若小便濇少淋沥，用安荣散。若肝经湿热，用龙胆泻肝汤。若肝经虚热，用加味逍遥散。腿足转筋而小便不利，急用八味丸，缓则不救。若服燥剂而小便频数或不利，用生地黄、茯苓、牛膝、黄蘗、知母、芎、归、甘草。若频数而色黄。用四物加黄蘗、知母、五味子、麦门冬、元参。若肺气虚而短少，用补中益气汤加山药、麦门冬。若阴挺痿痹而频数，用地黄丸。若热结膀胱而不利，用五淋散。若脾肺燥不能化生，宜黄芩清肺饮。若膀胱阴虚，阳无所生，用滋肾丸。若膀胱阳虚，阴无所化，用肾气丸。】　　【按《三因》论曰：治产前淋秘，当安胎为主。如其冷热膏石气等为治，量其虚实，寻究其所因而用药，则不失机要矣。】[41p]

Zi Lin

In cases of pregnancy where there is frequent urination known as "Lin," it is caused by the deficiency-heat of the kidneys and bladder that fails to control water. The pregnant woman’s womb is linked to the kidneys, and when there is deficiency-heat in the kidneys, this condition arises. In severe cases, there may be irritability and confusion, termed "Zi Lin."

Note: If there is a painful cramp in the neck and an expectoration of phlegm, use Ling Yang Jiao San. If urination is scant and dripping, use An Rong San. If there is damp-heat in the liver channel, use Long Dan Jie Gan Tang. If there is deficient-heat in the liver channel, use Jia Wei Xiao Yao San. If there are cramps in the legs and feet and urination is not smooth, urgently use Ba Wei Wan; if delayed, it may be beyond saving. If dry medications lead to frequent or difficult urination, use Sheng Di Huang, Fu Ling, Niu Xi, Huang Bo, Zhi Mu, Xiong, Gui, and Gan Cao. If urination is frequent and the urine is yellow, use Si Wu with Huang Bo, Zhi Mu, Wu Wei Zi, Mai Men Dong, and Yuan Shen. If there is deficiency of lung qi causing reduced urination, use Bu Zhong Yi Qi Tang with Shan Yao and Mai Men Dong. If there is a weakness in the yin, with frequent urination, use Di Huang Wan. If heat stagnates in the bladder causing difficulty, use Wu Lin San. If the spleen and lungs are dry and unable to generate fluids, Huang Qin Qing Fei Yin is advisable. If the bladder yin is deficient with no yang production, use Zi Shen Wan. If the bladder yang is deficient with no transformation of yin, use Shen Qi Wan.

Comment: According to the "Three Causes" discussion: The treatment for pre-labor Lin should primarily stabilize the fetus. Whether treating with hot or cold, or based on symptoms like stones or gas, one should assess the deficiencies and strengths, investigate the causes, and select medications accordingly to ensure the right approach.[41p]

　　　　　胎水肿满

　　《产乳集》云：妊娠三月，足肿至腿，出水，饮食不甘，似水肿状，谓之子气，至分娩方消者，此脾胃气虚，或冲任经有血风。《名医录》云：宋少主与徐文伯微行学针法，文伯见一妊娠足肿，脉之。少主曰：此女形也。文伯曰：此男胎也，在左而黑。遂用针，胎下果然。亦有脾虚水气流溢。或因泻痢脏腑虚寒，或因疟疾饮水，脾虚湿渍，或因水渍于胞，不能分利，皆致腿足肚腹肿证也。　　【注　前证若胸满腹胀，小便不通，遍身浮肿，用鲤鱼汤。脾胃虚弱，佐以四君子。[42p]

Edema from Fetal Water

The "Collection on Lactation" states: At three months of pregnancy, if the feet swell to the legs, with water retention, loss of appetite, and a condition resembling edema, this is referred to as "fetal qi." It does not dissipate until childbirth, indicating a deficiency in the spleen and stomach, or possibly blood wind in the Chong and Ren vessels. The "Record of Famous Physicians" mentions that the Song Crown Prince discreetly learned needling techniques from Xu Wenbo. When Wenbo observed a pregnant woman with swollen feet and felt her pulse, the Crown Prince remarked: "This is a female form." Wenbo replied: "This is a male fetus, located on the left and dark." He then used acupuncture, and the fetus was indeed expelled. There can also be spleen deficiency causing excess water. This may arise from diarrhea leading to cold in the organs, or from malaria causing water retention, leading to spleen deficiency and damp accumulation, or water stagnating in the womb, unable to be discharged, all resulting in swelling of the legs, feet, and abdomen.

[Note: For previous symptoms such as chest fullness, abdominal distension, difficulty in urination, and generalized edema, use carp soup. For spleen and stomach deficiency, assist with the Four Gentlemen decoction.][42p]

若面目虚浮，肢体如水气，用全生白朮散；如未应，用六君子汤。脾虚湿热，下部作肿，用补中益气加茯苓。若饮食失宜，呕吐泄泻，用六君子汤。若腿足发肿，喘闷不安，或指缝出水，用天仙藤散；脾胃虚弱，兼四君子汤；如未应，用补中益气汤。若脾肺气滞，用加味归脾汤，佐以加味逍遥散。】　　【按《产宝》：夫妊娠肿满，由脏气本弱，因产重虚，土不克水，血散入四肢，遂致腹胀，手足面目皆浮肿，小便秘濇。陈无择云：凡妇人宿有风寒冷湿，妊娠喜脚肿，俗呼为皱脚。[43p]

If the face is hollow and the body feels like vapor, use the full dosage of Bai Zhu San; if there is no response, use Liu Jun Zi Tang. If there is spleen deficiency with damp-heat and swelling in the lower body, use Bu Zhong Yi Qi Tang with added Fu Ling. If there are dietary issues leading to vomiting and diarrhea, use Liu Jun Zi Tang. If the legs and feet swell, accompanied by shortness of breath and restlessness, or if water seeps from between the fingers, use Tian Xian Teng San; for spleen and stomach weakness, you can also use Si Jun Zi Tang; if ineffective, use Bu Zhong Yi Qi Tang. If there is Qi stagnation in the spleen and lungs, use Jia Wei Gui Pi Tang, complemented with Jia Wei Xiao Yao San.

According to "Chan Bao": Swelling during pregnancy is due to weak visceral Qi and excessive burden from pregnancy, where the earth does not control water, and blood disperses into the limbs, leading to abdominal distention and swelling in the hands, feet, and face, along with urinary retention. Chen Wu Ze remarks: Women with chronic wind, cold, and dampness often experience swollen feet during pregnancy, commonly known as "wrinkled feet."[43p]

亦有通身肿满，心腹急胀，名曰胎水。凡妊娠经血壅闭以养胎，若忽然虚肿，乃胎中挟水，水血相搏，脾胃恶湿，主身之肌肉，湿渍气弱则肌肉虚，水气流溢，故令身肿满也。然其由有自：或因泄泻下痢，脏腑虚滑，耗损脾胃；或因寒热疟疾，烦渴，引饮太过，湿渍脾胃，皆能使头面或手足浮肿也。然水渍于胞，儿未成形，则胎多损坏，及其临产，日觉微肿，乃胞脏水少血多，水出于外，故现微肿则易生也。宿有寒气，因寒冷所触，故能令腹胀肿满也。[44p]

There is also a condition where the body becomes entirely swollen, with a feeling of tightness in the heart and abdomen, known as "pregnancy water." During pregnancy, when blood is obstructed to nourish the fetus, if there suddenly appears swelling, it is due to water accumulating within the fetus, causing water and blood to clash. The spleen and stomach are affected by dampness; when dampness weakens the energy, it leads to muscle weakness, resulting in the body becoming swollen. The causes can be various: it may arise from diarrhea or dysentery, affecting the internal organs and depleting the spleen and stomach; or it may stem from coldness, heat, or malaria, along with excessive thirst and drinking, which dampens the spleen and stomach, leading to swelling of the face or limbs. If there is water in the womb and the fetus is not yet fully formed, it may cause damage. As labor approaches, a slight swelling may be felt, indicating that there is little water and more blood in the womb, allowing for easier delivery. If there is lingering cold energy, it can cause abdominal swelling and fullness due to exposure to cold.[44p]

】　　【按《产乳集》论云：三月成胎之后，两足自脚面渐肿腿膝以来，行步艰辛，以致喘闷，脚指间有黄水出，直至分娩方消。此由妇人素有风气，或冲任经有血风，未可妄投汤药。亦恐大段甚者，虑将产之际费力，有不测之忧，故不可不治于未产之前也。古方论中少有言者，惟《名医录》有妊娠足肿之说。若巢氏《病源》中但有子烦之论，《千金》并《产宝》方亦略言之。刘禹钖《续传广信方》以为妊娠有水气而成胎，《太平圣惠》亦言之，皆非也。元丰中，淮南陈景初，名医也，独有方论治此病，方名初谓之香附散，李伯时易名曰天仙藤散也。】[45p]

According to the "Collection on Lactation," it is said that after three months of gestation, when the fetus is formed, the legs and knees gradually swell starting from the feet. Walking becomes difficult, leading to shortness of breath, and yellow fluid appears between the toes, which only subsides upon childbirth. This is attributed to the woman having a constitution prone to wind, or issues with the Chong and Ren meridians involving blood wind, thus indiscriminate use of herbal medicine is not advisable. It is also feared that excessive strain near the time of delivery could pose unforeseen risks, so it is imperative to treat the condition before childbirth. Few ancient texts mention this; "Records of Famous Physicians" refers to swelling in the feet during pregnancy. However, "Chao's Source of Illness" only discusses childhood troubles, while "Thousand Gold" and "Treasures of Childbirth" briefly touch on the issue. Liu Yuhuang in "Continuation of Transmission of Medical Knowledge" considers that water vapor contributes to fetal development during pregnancy, and "Taiping Shenghui" states similarly, both of which are not correct. In the Yuanfeng era, Chen Jingchu from Huainan, a renowned physician, uniquely provided a formula for treating this condition, initially called Xiangfu Powder, later renamed by Li Boshi as Tiānxian Tendrils Powder.[45p]

　　　　　腹内钟鸣

　　治孕妇腹内钟鸣，用鼠窟中土为末，入麝香，酒调下二钱，立愈；或黄连浓煎汁，母常呷之。　　【注　按《产宝》云：小儿在腹中哭，其治法亦用空房中鼠穴土或黄连浓煎饮之即止，想即是证。又云：脐带上疙瘩，儿含口中因妊妇登高举臂，脱出儿口，以此作声，令妊妇曲腰就地如拾物，仍入儿口即止。然黄连性寒，麝香开窍，当酌量用之。】[46p]

Borborygmi in the Pregnant Woman's Abdomen

To treat the borborygmi in a pregnant woman’s abdomen, take powdered soil from a mouse's burrow, mix it with musk, and adjust it with wine, administering two qian; it will resolve immediately. Alternatively, a strong decoction of barberry can be given to the mother to sip regularly.

Note: According to "Chan Bao," if the child cries in the womb, the same treatments of soil from a mouse's burrow or strong barberry decoction will suffice, as these are remedies suggested for the condition. It also mentions that a lump on the umbilical cord occurs when the child’s mouth is agape because the pregnant woman stretches or lifts her arms, causing the child to vocalize. In such cases, the mother should bend down as if to pick something up, allowing the child to return to the mouth, which will stop the sound. However, as barberry is cold in nature and musk opens the orifices, their usage should be measured accordingly.[46p]

　　　　　脏燥悲伤

　　许学士云：一妇无故数次悲泣，是为脏燥，用大枣汤而愈。又程虎卿内妊娠五月，惨切悲伤，亦投大枣汤而愈。　　【注　前证或因寒水攻心，或肺有风邪者，治当审察。】
　　　　　脉例

　　王子亨云：若妊娠其脉三部俱滑大而疾，在左则男，在右则女。经云：阴搏阳别谓之有子。搏者近也，阴脉逼近于下，阳脉则出于上，阳中见阳，乃知阳施阴化，法当有子。又：少阴脉动甚者妊子也。手少阴属心，足少阴属肾，心主血，肾主精，精血交会投识于其间，则有娠。又三部脉浮沉正等无病者，有妊也。左手尺脉浮洪者，为男胎也；右手尺部浮洪者，为女胎也。两手尺部俱洪者为两男，俱沉实者为两女。又云：中指一跳一止者，一月胎；二跳二止者，二月胎也。[47p]

Dampness and Sadness

Scholar Xu said: If a woman weeps for no reason multiple times, it is called dampness and sadness; treating her with a jujube soup will bring recovery. Also, Cheng Huqing, five months into her pregnancy, experienced severe sadness and was cured by the jujube soup. [Note: The preceding condition may be due to cold water attacking the heart, or evil wind in the lungs; treatment should be carefully considered.]

Pulse Examples

Wang Ziheng said: In pregnancy, if the pulse in all three positions is slippery, large, and rapid, then if it is stronger on the left, it indicates a male child; if stronger on the right, it indicates a female child. The classics state: "Yin engulfs yang, indicating the presence of a child." The engulfs refers to nearness, as the yin pulse approaches below and the yang pulse emerges above; observing yang within yang confirms that the yang produces the transformation of yin, suggesting the presence of a child. Furthermore, when the shaoyin pulse is very active, it indicates pregnancy. The hand shaoyin belongs to the heart, and the foot shaoyin belongs to the kidneys; the heart governs blood and the kidneys govern essence. When essence and blood intertwine, conception occurs. Additionally, if the three positions of the pulse are equally floating and sinking without disease, it also indicates pregnancy. A floating and exuberant pulse at the left wrist indicates a male fetus; at the right wrist, a female fetus. If both wrists show a floating and exuberant pulse, it indicates two males; if both are sinking and solid, it indicates two females. Additionally, if the middle finger has one throb and one stillness, it indicates a one-month fetus; two throbs and two stillnesses indicate a two-month fetus.[47p]

　　　　　诊妇人有妊歌

　　肝为血兮肺为气，血为荣兮气为卫。阴阳配偶不参差，两脏通和皆类例。血衰气旺定无妊，血旺气衰应有体。　　【注　肝藏血为荣，属阴；肺主气为卫，属阳。阴阳配偶者，是夫妇匹配，偶合媾精，乃有子也。若血少气盛则无娠孕，若血盛气少则有孕也。张世贤曰：肝藏血，肺主气，血属阴为荣而行脉中，气属阳为卫而行脉外，气升血亦升，气降血亦降，阴阳配偶，无一毫之参差，三阴三阳，举皆两脏通和而类其例焉。《素问》曰：金木者生杀之本始。[48p]

Diagnosis of Women with Pregnancy Songs

The liver accounts for blood, the lungs for qi; blood represents nourishment, qi represents defense. When yin and yang are harmoniously paired, the organs are interconnected as a standard. If blood is deficient and qi is abundant, there will be no pregnancy; if blood is abundant and qi is deficient, pregnancy will occur.

[Note: The liver stores blood and is associated with yin; the lungs govern qi and are associated with yang. The harmonious pairing of yin and yang refers to the matching of husband and wife, leading to conception. If blood is low and qi is strong, there will be no pregnancy; if blood is strong and qi is low, pregnancy is likely. Zhang Shixian stated: The liver stores blood, the lungs govern qi; blood belongs to yin and flows within the vessels, while qi belongs to yang and flows outside the vessels. Qi rises, blood rises; qi descends, blood descends; in the harmonious pairing of yin and yang, there are no discrepancies. The Three Yin and Three Yang work together, ensuring that both organs are in harmony and conform to their patterns. The "Suwen" states: Gold and wood are the fundamental beginnings of life and death.][48p]

木多而生，金多而杀。】　　寸微关滑尺带数，流利往来并雀啄。小儿之脉已见形，数月怀躭犹未觉。　　 【注　寸脉微，关脉滑，尺脉带数及流利雀啄，皆是经脉闭塞不行而成胎也。已上之脉，皆是血多气少之脉，是怀小儿之脉已见形状也。】　　左疾为男右为女，流利相通速来去。两手关脉大相应，已形亦在前通语。　　 【注　左手脉疾为怀男，右手脉疾为怀女。及两脉流行滑利相通，疾速来去，或两手关脉洪大相应，是其胎已有形状也。】　　左脉带纵两个男，右手带横一双女。[49p]

"Wood is abundant and gives life; metal is abundant and brings death. The pulse at the cun is fine, at the guan is slippery, and at the chi is scattered and flowing, moving like the pecking of a sparrow. The pulse of a child is already visible, while the mother is still unaware after several months of pregnancy.

[Note: The fine pulse at the cun, slippery pulse at the guan, and the scattered, flowing pulse at the chi indicate that the meridians are blocked and have not functioned, resulting in pregnancy. These pulses suggest abundance of blood and deficiency of qi, indicating the shape of a child is already apparent.]

A swift left pulse indicates a boy; a quick right pulse indicates a girl, both flowing smoothly and swiftly. The pulses in both hands correspond greatly; the shape is already in the front and can be verbally expressed.

[Note: A swift pulse in the left hand indicates a boy, while a swift pulse in the right hand indicates a girl. Furthermore, if the pulses are flowing and swift and correspond greatly, it confirms that the fetus already has a shape.]

The left pulse indicates two boys; the right hand indicates one pair of girls."[49p]

　　 【注　纵者夫行乘妻，水行乘火，金行乘木，即鬼贼脉也，名曰纵。见在左手则怀两个男儿也。横者妻乘夫也，是火行乘水，木行乘金，即所胜脉也，名曰横。见于右手，则怀一双女儿也。】　　左手脉逆生三男，右手脉顺还三女。　　 【注　逆者子乘母也，是水行乘金，火行乘木，即己生脉也，名曰逆。见于左手。则怀三个男也。顺者母乘子也，是金行乘水，木行乘火，即生己之脉也，名曰顺。见于右手，则怀三个女儿也。】　　寸关尺部皆相应，一男一女分形证。[50p]

Note: The "Zong" indicates that the husband rides on the wife, water rides on fire, and metal rides on wood; this is the pulse of the ghostly bandits, known as "Zong." If found in the left hand, it indicates the expectation of two sons. The "Heng" indicates that the wife rides on the husband, with fire riding on water and wood riding on metal; this is the pulse of victory, known as "Heng." If found in the right hand, it indicates the expectation of a pair of daughters.

The left hand's pulse predicts three sons, while the right hand's pulse predicts three daughters. Note: The "Ni" indicates that the son rides on the mother, with water riding on metal and fire riding on wood; this is the pulse of self-birth, known as "Ni." If found in the left hand, it predicts three sons. The "Shun" indicates that the mother rides on the son, with metal riding on water and wood riding on fire; this is the pulse of giving birth to self, known as "Shun." If found in the right hand, it predicts three daughters.

The pulses at the inch, the gate, and the cubit are all interconnected; one son and one daughter correspond to distinct shapes.[50p]

　　 【注　寸关尺部脉大小迟疾相应者，是怀一男一女形证之脉也。谓关前为阳，关后为阴，阴阳脉相应，故怀一男一女也。】　　有时子死母身存，或即母亡存子命。往来三部通流利，滑数相参皆替替。阳实阴虚脉得明，遍满胸膛皆逆气。　　 【注　若寸关尺三部通行流利，皆替替有力而滑数，是皆阳实阴虚之脉，主妊妇逆气遍满胸膛而不顺也。】　　左手太阳浮大男，右手太阴沉细女。　　 【注　左手寸口为太阳，其脉浮大则是怀男子。右手寸口为太阴，其脉沉细为怀女也。】　　诸阳为男诸阴女，指下分明常记取。[51p]

The notes state that the pulse characteristics at the cun, guan, and chi positions correspond to the pregnancy of one boy and one girl. It is said that the guan position represents yang (male) and the after guan represents yin (female), hence the corresponding pulses indicate the presence of both a boy and a girl.

Sometimes a child may die while the mother lives, or the mother may pass away while the child survives. When the three positions of the pulse flow smoothly and interchangeably, with a slippery and rapid rhythm, it indicates that the yang is full and the yin is deficient, causing a rebellious qi that fills the chest.

If all three pulse positions are flowing smoothly and interchangeably with strength and a slippery rhythm, it indicates a yang fullness and yin deficiency, suggesting that a pregnant woman experiences rebellious qi throughout the chest, leading to discomfort.

In the left hand, the sun pulse is large and floating for a boy; in the right hand, the yin pulse is small and sinking for a girl. The left hand's cun position represents the sun, where a large floating pulse indicates a boy, while the right hand's cun position represents the yin, where a sinking fine pulse indicates a girl.

All yang represent boys, and all yin represent girls; this distinction is clear and should be remembered.[51p]

　　 【注　诸阳脉，即大疾数滑实之类是也，当怀男子。诸阴脉，即沉细之类是也，当怀女子。】　　三部沉正等无绝，尺内不止真胎妇。　　 【注　寸关尺三部脉浮沉正直齐等，举按无断绝，及尺内举按不止住者，真的怀胎妇也。】　　夫乘妻兮纵气雾，妻乘夫兮横气助。　　 【注　纵者，夫乘妻也，水行乘火，金行乘木，即鬼贼脉也。纵气雾，雾者露也，又上下也，谓夫之阳气，乘妻之阴气，二气上下相逐，如雾润结子也。横者妻乘夫也，火行乘水，木行乘金，即所胜脉也。[52p]

The notes state: "The 'yang pulses' refer to the characteristics of major illnesses that are numerous, smooth, and firm, indicating a pregnancy with a male. The 'yin pulses' refer to those that are deep and fine, indicating a pregnancy with a female."

It further explains that the three sections of the pulse (cun, guan, and chi) should be neither absent nor irregular, and within the chi section, if the pulse is palpable continuously, it signifies a true pregnancy.

The text discusses the dynamics between husband and wife: "When the husband embraces the wife, it is like the flow of air and fog; when the wife embraces the husband, it represents the horizontal flow of energy."

The explanation continues that the 'vertical' dynamic refers to the husband embracing the wife, with water overcoming fire and metal overcoming wood, symbolizing the pulses of control by the ghostly thief. The 'fog' aspect refers to moisture and the interaction of upper and lower energies—indicating the husband's yang energy encompassing the wife's yin energy, akin to fog nourishing and producing offspring. The 'horizontal' dynamic depicts the wife embracing the husband, with fire overcoming water and wood overcoming metal, symbolizing the pulses of domination.[52p]

横气助，谓两旁横气相佐助也。】　　子乘母兮逆气参，母乘子兮顺气护。　　 【注　逆者，子乘母也，水行乘金，火行乘木，即己生脉也。逆气参，谓子气犯母气相乘，逆行之气相参合也。金行乘水，木行乘火，即生己之脉，是母气乘于子气为顺，气相护卫也。凡胎聚纵横逆顺四气以荣养，方以成形也。】　　小儿日足胎成聚，身热脉乱无所苦。　　 【注　妇人怀小儿五个月，是以数足胎成就而结聚也。必母身体壮热，当见脉息燥乱，非病苦之证，谓五月胎已成，受火精以成气，故身热脉乱，是无病也。[53p]

The horizontal energy assists, meaning the lateral energies support each other. When the child rides on the mother, it is in opposition; when the mother rides on the child, it is in harmony.

(Note: The opposition refers to the child riding the mother, where water influences metal and fire influences wood, corresponding to generating one's own pulse. The opposing energies refer to the child’s energy clashing with the mother’s energy, creating a counteracting flow. In the harmonious state, metal influences water and wood influences fire, corresponding to the generation of one's own pulse, wherein the mother's energy takes precedence over the child's energy, supporting each other. In general, the embryo grows by means of the four energies of opposition and harmony to nourish and solidify its form.)

As for an infant during the final stages of gestation, when the body is heated and the pulse is chaotic, there are no signs of distress.

(Note: When a woman is five months pregnant, this is when the count begins to see the embryo well-formed and coalescing. The mother's body must be robust and warm, and at this point, the pulse will be dry and disordered, which is not a sign of illness. This indicates that the fetus has been formed by receiving the essence of fire to develop energy, hence the warmth and pulse irregularity indicate wellness rather than sickness.)[53p]

】　　汗出不食吐逆时，精神结备其中住。　　【注　谓妊胎受五行精气以成形，禀二经以荣其母，怀妊至五月，其胎虽成，其气未备，故胎气未安，上冲心胸，则汗出不食，吐逆，名曰恶阻，俗呼选饭，惟思酸辛之味以调胎气也。按池氏曰：妇人初系胞，乃天一生水，二月受火之气，其妊妇身热脉乱，汗出不食，吐逆恶阻。三月受木之气，精神结备，在其中住，气和以荣其子，子气以润其母，而二气荣润，其子安住。】　　滑疾不散三月胎，但疾不散五月母。　　 【注　妊娠三月名始胎，此是未有定仪，心胞脉养之故。[54p]
