This statement is indeed credible. There are instances where a person has their essence released first leading to the birth of a male, and released later leading to a female, so why is that? Dongyuan says: If the menstruation has just ceased for one or two days, and the blood sea begins to clear, then a conception will lead to a male; if four or five days later, when the blood vessels are already vigorous, conception will lead to a female. After six or seven days, even if there is a union, it will not lead to conception. This statement is also credible, as there are cases where a person conceives a female shortly after menstruation ceases, and conceives a male after a prolonged interruption.[94p]

亦有四五日以前交合无孕、八九日以后交合有孕者，独何欤？俞子木撰《广嗣要略》，着方立图谓：实阳能入虚阴，实阴不能受阳，即东垣之故见也。又谓微阳不能射阴，弱阴不能摄阳。信斯言也，世有尩羸之夫，怯弱之妇，屡屡受胎，虽欲止之而不能止者；亦有血气方刚，精力过人，顾乃艰于育嗣而莫之救者，独何欤？朱丹溪论治专以妇人经水为主，然富贵之家，侍妾已多，其中宁无月水当期者乎？有已经前夫频频生育，而娶此以图其易者，顾亦不能得胎，更遣与他人，转盼生男矣，岂不能受孕于此而能受孕于彼乎？愚以为父母之生子，如天地之生物，《易》曰坤道，其顺乎承天而时行。[95p]

There are instances where one has intercourse four or five days prior with no conception, yet experiences conception eight or nine days later; what could be the reason for this? Yu Zi Mu, in his work "Essentials of Conception," asserts that the strong Yang can enter the receptive Yin, while the strong Yin cannot receive Yang, as explained by the views of the Eastern Garden. He further states that a slight Yang cannot penetrate the Yin, and a weak Yin cannot grasp the Yang.

This is indeed believable; there are men who are frail and women who are timid, often becoming pregnant repeatedly, despite their desires to prevent it, while others, endowed with robust vitality and outstanding essence, struggle significantly to conceive, with no remedy available for them. What could be the reason for this?

Zhu Danxi emphasizes that treatment should focus primarily on a woman's menstrual cycle. However, in wealthy families with many concubines, surely some of them must have menstruation during the appropriate time? There are also cases where a woman has already borne children frequently with a previous husband, yet marrying another in hopes of ease, but still fails to conceive; instead, she sends the child to another man, hoping for a male heir. Can it be that she cannot conceive with one yet can with another?

I believe that the birth of children from parents is akin to the birth of beings in the universe, as the "I Ching" states, the receptive (Kun) way follows heaven and operates according to the timing.[95p]

夫知地之生物，不过顺承乎天，则知母之生子，亦不过顺承乎父而已。知母之顺承乎父，则种子者果以妇人为主乎？以男子为主乎？然所谓主于男子者，不拘老少，不拘强弱，不拘康宁病患，不拘精易泄难泄，只以交感之时，百脉齐到为善耳。交感而百脉齐到，虽老虽弱，虽病患虽易泄，方可以成胎。交感而百脉参差，虽少虽强，虽康宁，虽难泄，亦难以成胎矣。妇人所构之血，固由于百脉合聚，较之男子之精，不能无轻重之分也。[96p]

The knowledge of the earth's creation of life is merely a matter of following the will of heaven; thus, a mother giving birth to a child also merely follows the father. If the mother follows the father, regarding the seed, is it primarily valued by women or by men? Indeed, when we speak of value being attributed to men, it does not depend on age, strength, health, or ease of retention. It only requires that when the time of union occurs, the hundred channels are in harmony, which is optimal. When there is harmony in the hundred channels at the time of union, even if one is old or weak, ill or easy to leak, conception can still occur. Conversely, when there is discord in the hundred channels, even if one is young or strong, healthy or difficult to leak, conception becomes challenging. The blood produced by women does derive from the harmonious gathering of the hundred channels; compared to a man's essence, there is inevitably a distinction in importance.[96p]

孔子曰：大哉干元，万物资始；至哉坤元，万物资生。岂无意乎？若男女之辨，又不以精血先后为拘，不以经尽几日为拘，不以夜半前后交感为拘，不以父强母弱、母强父弱为拘，只以精血各由百脉之齐到者别胜负耳。是故精之百脉齐到，有以胜乎血，则成男矣；血之百脉齐到，有以胜乎精，则成女矣。至有既孕而小产者，有产而不育者。有育而不寿者，有寿而黄耆无疆者，则亦有精血之坚脆分为修短耳。世人不察其精血之坚脆，已定乎禀受之初，乃以小产专责之母，以不育专付之儿，以寿夭专诿之数，不亦谬乎！
　　　　　气弱用气六合论

　　河间云：气虚弱，起则无力，恇然而倒，如厚朴、陈皮，谓之气六合。夫厚朴、陈皮，泄气之药也。气不足而用泄气之药可乎？当以参、朮易之。
　　　　　半产
[97p]

Confucius said: Great is the principle of the cosmos, from which all things begin; profound is the principle of the earth, from which all things are born. Is there no intention in this? The distinction between male and female is not restricted by the timing of conception or by the state of the parents, whether the father is strong and the mother weak, or the mother is strong and the father weak. It is determined solely by the proper flow of essence and blood through the hundred channels. Thus, when the essence flows through the channels and overpowers the blood, a male is formed; when the blood flows through the channels and overpowers the essence, a female is formed. Additionally, there are those who conceive but suffer miscarriage, those who give birth yet remain childless, those who nurture yet do not live long, and those who live long but have no offspring. This illustrates the variability of essence and blood in terms of strength and fragility. People in the world do not see how the strength and fragility of essence and blood, which are determined from the very beginning, lead them to wrongly assign blame for miscarriage to the mother, infertility to the son, and mortality to fate. Is this not a mistake?

Regarding weak energy, it is theorized that when energy is deficient, one is weak and may collapse, akin to thick-skinned plants such as magnolia and dried tangerine peel, known as energy-leaking remedies. Is it appropriate to use energy-leaking medicines when energy is lacking? One should instead employ ginseng or atractylodes.[97p]

　　《便产须知》云：小产不可轻视，将养十倍于正产可也。又云：半产即肌肉腐烂，补其虚损，生其肌肉，益其气血，去其风邪，养其脏气，将养过于正产十倍，无不平复，宜审之！
　　　　　肚痈

　　大凡孕妇病肚痈者，与寻常治法迥异，内用紫苏饮安胎，勿轻与他药。若临月则儿与脓俱下；若尚远则脓自大腑出；若初萌只服药可消；若痈在外面，其证必热，惟可用中和药收功，亦须审轻重用之，恐有误也。
　　　　广嗣纪要 【明　万全】

　　　　　转女为男法

　　夫妇构精，阴阳分形，阳精胜者为男，阴血胜者为女，固已别矣，岂能转移之耶？虽三月男女分形，阳精胜者为男，阴血胜者为女，盖一月、二月之间精血混合，男女之形未彰，至于三月阴阳始判，震巽之索斯定，故曰男女分也。谓初受之气，于兹始定，非谓阴阳男女初无定体，必待三月而后分，故可以转移变化之耳。古人留是法者，必有所试，阴阳变化之妙，不可得而知焉。[98p]

"The Guide to Childbirth" states: One should not take a miscarriage lightly; the care required is ten times that of a full-term pregnancy. It also mentions that in a partial delivery, the flesh may rot, so one must replenish its deficiencies, promote the growth of flesh, enhance qi and blood, dispel wind and evil, and nourish the vital energy—this care should exceed that of a normal delivery by tenfold; everything will eventually stabilize, and it should be approached with caution!

Regarding abdominal abscess in pregnant women, the treatment is quite different from ordinary methods. One should use a perilla infusion to calm the fetus and refrain from giving other medicines lightly. If it is near term, both the child and pus may be expelled; if it is still some time away, the pus will come from the large intestine; if it is just beginning, medication can help dissipate it; if the abscess is external, the symptoms will definitely be hot. Only central, balancing medications should be used for resolution, and one must carefully consider the severity to avoid mistakes.

Regarding the method to change a girl into a boy, when a couple conceives, the differentiation of yin and yang occurs. If the yang essence prevails, it results in a boy; if the yin blood prevails, it results in a girl; thus they are inherently distinct—how can they be transferred? Although by the third month the male and female forms are differentiated, with the yang essence prevailing for boys and the yin blood for girls, during the first two months the essences are mixed, and the characteristics of male and female have not yet manifested. By the third month, the distinctions of yin and yang begin to become clear, and therefore it is said they are separate. This initial reception of essence determines the outcome; it does not mean that the forms of yin and yang were initially unclear. Ancient practitioners who left this method must have conducted tests; the subtleties of yin and yang transformations are beyond full comprehension.[98p]

　　　　　堕胎

　　孕而多堕者，男子贪淫情纵，女子好欲性偏，兼以好食辛酸热物，暴损冲任，故有堕胎之患。其膏梁与藜藿妇人不伺，欲之多寡故也。有一等妇人，有胎似乎无胎，痰气疼痛发热，医者不明脉理，妄施耗气退热之剂，不知胎气宜养，病气宜攻，若有胎反用攻药，岂不误欤？故养胎者血也，护胎者气也。或有妇人小产太多，及至中年，设法服药保全，但欲心不绝，其性情不改，百凡上气逆损冲任，因而殒命者有之。故昔人有言，飞禽抱卵，走兽怀胎，物类尚能保全产育，人为万物之灵，反不反此，何也？
　　　　　子悬

　　五脏系皆通于心，而心通五脏系也。故胞门子户，上通心系，胎气和则安静而不动，胎气不和则伸缩转动，牵拽其系而心痛，如物悬坠之状，名曰子悬。
　　　　　子烦

　　子烦之证，皆属于热，有虚有实，更宜分十二经养胎之月，各随其脏气治之。此吾家传之秘，群书未载。[99p]

Abortion

Those who suffer from frequent miscarriages during pregnancy are influenced by men’s indulgence and women’s desires, combined with a preference for spicy and hot foods, which damage the body’s balance, leading to the risk of miscarriage. Women who indulge without regard for their condition often have varying degrees of desire. There are some women who appear pregnant but are not; they experience symptoms like phlegm, pain, and fever. If a physician fails to understand the pulse and misapplies depletive and antipyretic remedies, unaware that fetal energy should be nurtured while disease energy should be countered, it would be a grave mistake to use aggressive medications for those who are pregnant. Hence, nourishing the fetus relies on blood, while protecting it depends on vital energy. Some women have too many miscarriages, and upon reaching middle age, they try to find ways to take medications to maintain their pregnancies, yet if their desires do not cease and their temperament remains unchanged, it leads to respiratory issues that harm the body, which may result in death. Therefore, ancient scholars noted that birds incubate eggs, and mammals carry young—if even creatures can protect their progeny, how can humans, as the pinnacle of creation, fail to do so?

Suspension of the Fetus

The five organs are all connected to the heart, and the heart connects back to the five organs. Thus, the gates of the womb connect to the heart. When fetal energy is harmonious, it remains calm and unmoving; when it is not harmonious, it stretches and moves, pulling on its connections, causing heart pain, resembling the condition of something suspended and falling, termed “suspension of the fetus.”

Fetal Distress

The symptoms of fetal distress are all related to heat, which can be either deficient or excess. It is necessary to differentiate the twelve meridians to nourish the fetus during the months, treating each according to its organ's condition. This is a secret passed down in my family and is not documented in various texts.[99p]

　　　　　子肿

　　妊娠七八月后两脚肿者，未可医治，至产后其肿自消。如两脚肿甚者，宜白朮、茯苓、防己、木瓜主之。
　　　　　伤寒

　　妊娠伤寒，专以清热安胎为生，或汗或下，各宜随其五脏表里所见脉证主治，勿犯胎气。故在表发汗，以香苏散为主方；半表里则和解之，以黄龙为主方；在里则下之，以三黄解毒汤为主方。此吾家传之秘，活人甚多。如古方六合汤，虽分治详明，犹不及此切当。
　　　　　预防难产

　　妇人之怀胎，有膏粱藜藿劳逸苦乐之殊，岂必人人有难产之厄哉？自湖阳公主后始有瘦胎之论，前此有寤生者，岂无法耶？即今之娠妇，未有尽服求胎药者。盖生育者妇人之常，非病故不用药耳。惟素有难产之苦者，不得不讲求其方，以为保生之计。其束胎之方，用各不同，如枳壳瘦胎散，及用滑石方，气实多痰者宜用之。达生散、束胎丸，气虚少有热者宜用之。若不审其虚实，不若不服之善也。[100p]

Swelling of the Feet

If a woman’s feet swell after seven or eight months of pregnancy, it cannot be treated, as the swelling will naturally subside after childbirth. If the swelling is severe, it is advisable to use a prescription of Atractylodes, Poria, Stephania, and Pseudocarpium.

Typhoid Fever

When a pregnant woman has typhoid fever, the focus should be on clearing heat and stabilizing the fetus for the sake of life. Treatments such as sweating or purging should align with the pulse and symptoms relating to the five organs without disturbing the fetus. Therefore, for exterior symptoms with sweating, the main prescription should be Xiang Su San; for half exterior and half interior, it should be Huang Long; for interior symptoms, it should be San Huang Jie Du Tang. This is a family secret of mine, and it has helped many people. Even though the ancient formula Liu He Tang has specific guidelines for treatment, it is still not as effective as this.

Prevention of Difficult Labor

Women during pregnancy experience various conditions that differ in richness, labor, joy, and suffering. Is it necessary that everyone faces the misfortune of difficult labor? The discussion of thin fetuses began after Princess Hu Yang, but before that, there were cases of spontaneous birth; was there no way for that? Even today, pregnant women often do not fully rely on medicines seeking for a good delivery. After all, childbirth is a normal aspect of womanhood and does not require medication as if one were ill. However, those with a history of difficult labor must seek remedies as a plan to safeguard their lives. The methods for supporting a fetus differ; for those with phlegm due to excess qi, Zhi Ke Shou Tai San and talc are suitable. For those with qi deficiency and slight heat, Da Sheng San and Shu Tai Wan are appropriate. If one does not carefully assess their deficiency or excess, it is better to abstain from taking any medicine.[100p]

　　　　妇人秘科 【明　万全】

　　　　　胎前赋

　　震风之喜有征，妊娠之脉必确。尺数关滑而寸盛，阳搏阴别而雀跃。精神虽倦兮，桃腮更妍；饮食初恶兮，天癸不落。无妨恶阻之害，所慎漏胎之浊。热要清兮，脾不可弱。热弗清兮而胎动不安，脾若虚兮而胎危易堕。惟以安胎为本，其余杂证治末。斯先哲之格言，宜后人之守约。　　子悬急痛而勿疑，子癎卒倒而可愕。子满胎肥而气壅，子疟脾虚而气弱。子烦子淋兮，胎热所为；子肿子气兮，胎水所作。子嗽子痢兮，病转剧而胎损；伤寒伤食兮，痰苦多而成恶。常惨常笑兮，肺气结而非祟；暴哑不语兮，心血虚而勿药。胎若肥而瘦胎速进，脉怕微而诊脉休错。　　胚胎之后，禁忌不可再犯；临产之前，戒慎乃为要约。预备药物，审择稳婆。禁哗去疑兮，恐产母之心动；居安守静兮，令产母之气和。儿身未转兮，坐草不宜太早；胞浆既破兮，使力未可太过。[101p]

On Pregnancy Before Conception

The joy of the tremorous wind has its signs, and the pulse of pregnancy must be precise. The measures are slippery at the inch, but abundant at the length; the yang strikes the yin and brings excitement. Although the spirit is weary, the peach-like cheeks are more beautiful; although food is initially distasteful, the heavenly essence does not fall. There is no harm in evil obstructions, yet one must beware of the impurities that cause miscarriage. Heat must be cleared, and the spleen cannot be weak. If heat is not cleared, the fetus will be restless; if the spleen is deficient, the fetus is prone to falling. The foundation is ensuring the stability of the fetus; other mixed conditions are secondary treatments. These are the maxims of the ancients, to be adhered to by future generations.

If the child hangs too low causing urgent pain, do not doubt. If the child suddenly has convulsions, it is indeed alarming. If the child is full and the fetus is fat, there may be excessive qi; if the child suffers from chills and the spleen is weak, there may be insufficient qi. If there is agitation or painful urination, it is due to heat in the fetus; if there is swelling or gas, it is caused by water from the fetus. If there is coughing or dysentery, the illness worsens and harms the fetus; whether due to cold or food disorders, phlegm becomes bitter and harmful. If constantly mournful or laughing, the lung's qi is stagnated, not a calamity; if one becomes suddenly mute, the heart's blood is deficient and no medication is needed. If the fetus is heavy yet thin, the rapid progress should be closely monitored, and the pulse must not be misdiagnosed.

After the embryo forms, prohibitions must not be violated; before labor, caution is essential. Prepare medicines and select a capable midwife carefully. Avoid noisy doubts, as they may disturb a mother’s heart; maintain calm and quiet, allowing the mother’s qi to harmonize. If the child's body has not turned, it is not advisable to sit on the grass too early; once the amniotic fluid has broken, excessive force should also be avoided.[101p]

或逆或横兮，在稳婆之妙手；若迟若留兮，系催生之圣药。　　医药之系匪轻，母子之命所托。差之毫厘，甚于水火。胎衣未下兮，取之有道；恶露未尽兮，去之勿过。血迷血运兮，死生存乎呼吸；血胀血痛兮，攻击戒乎挥霍。但以补虚为主，莫因他病而讹。药喜甘温兮，切忌苦寒；脉宜和缓兮，最嫌洪数。　　恶阻各归于脏腑，诸病若似于障魔。头旋而常见黑花兮，乙木之病；声哑而乍见鬼神兮，丁火之疴。脐下痛而或淋或秘兮，沟渎塞于污淤；腹中痛而或胀或肿兮，仓廪积乎陈莝。息逆而喘嗽不宁兮，因犯素天之气；腰疼而俯仰不利兮，乃冲元海之波。烦热兮责其无血而阴虚，羸怯兮知其蓐劳而气弱。能详察夫证候，斯可议乎方药。　　安胎胡连兮，在妊娠为最宜；瘦胎达生兮、视形证而休错。黑神去恶血而可取胎衣，十全补虚羸而能除阴火。吐露灵府之珠玑，掣开医门之锁钥。[102p]

Whether upside down or sideways, it relies on the midwife's skilled hands; whether slow or delayed, it hinges on the sacred medicine for childbirth. The stakes of medicine are not light; they hold the fates of mother and child. A slight error can be worse than water and fire. Before the placenta is expelled, it must be handled properly; if lochia has not completely discharged, do not rush to remove it. Blood disorders bring life and death to breath; blood swelling and pain warn against recklessness. Focus primarily on replenishing deficiencies, and do not misinterpret other ailments. The medicine should be pleasantly warm and sweet; bitter and cold must be avoided. Pulses ought to be gentle; rapid and forceful are most undesirable.

Obstructions each pertain to the organs, and various illnesses resemble demonic hindrances. Dizziness as if seeing black flowers indicates illness of the liver; hoarseness as if encountering spirits signifies a condition of fire. Pain below the navel with urination issues indicates stagnation; abdominal pain with bloating signals accumulation. Hard breathing and incessant coughing arise from offending the pure air; lower back pain with difficulty in movement affects the sea of source energy. Restlessness points to deficiency of blood and yin; weakness suggests exhaustion leading to weak qi.

To accurately discern the symptoms is to deliberate on methods and remedies. For stabilizing the fetus, Hu Lian is most suitable in pregnancy; a weak fetus may develop, but observe shape and symptoms to avoid errors. Black spirits expel evil blood and can assist with placental expulsion; the Ten Full restores deficiencies and clears yin fire. Unveil the treasures of the spiritual cavity, unlocking the key to the practice of medicine.[102p]

　　　　　养胎

　　妇人受胎之后，最宜调饮食，淡滋味，避寒暑，常得清纯和平之气以养其胎，则胎元完固，生子无疾。今为妇者，喜啖辛酸煎炒肥甘生冷之物，不知禁口，所以脾胃受伤，胎则易堕，寒热交杂，子亦多疾。况多食酸则伤肝，多食苦则伤心，多食甘则伤脾，多食辛则伤肺。多食咸则伤肾，随其食物伤其脏气，血气筋骨，失其所养，子病自此生矣。　　受胎之后，喜怒哀乐，莫敢不慎。[103p]

Nurturing the Fetus

After a woman conceives, it is most important to regulate her diet, favoring light and bland flavors, avoiding cold and hot climates, and constantly obtaining pure and peaceful qi to nurture the fetus. This ensures a strong and stable fetal essence, leading to a healthy birth. Nowadays, women tend to indulge in spicy, sour, fried, fatty, sweet, and cold foods, unaware they should restrain their appetites. This harms the spleen and stomach, making it easier for the fetus to miscarry, as the mingling of cold and heat leads to many ailments in the child. Moreover, excessive sourness harms the liver, excess bitterness harms the heart, too much sweetness harms the spleen, and excess spiciness harms the lungs. An overabundance of salt can harm the kidneys, as the foods consumed can injure the vital organs and affect blood, qi, muscles, and bones, leading to the child's diseases. After conception, one must exercise great caution regarding feelings of joy, anger, sorrow, and happiness.[103p]

盖过喜则伤心而气散，怒则伤肝而气上，思则伤脾而气郁，忧则伤肺而气结，恐则伤肾而气下。母气既伤，子气应之，未有不伤者也。其母伤则胎易堕，其子伤则脏气不和，病斯多矣。盲聋喑哑，痴呆癫癎，皆禀受不正之故也。　　妇人受胎之后，凡行立坐卧，俱不宜久，久则筋骨肌肤受伤，子在腹中，气通于母，必有伤者。【如恣情交合，子生下，头上有白膜，滞腻如胶，俗呼戴白生者，其亦子母相通之一验矣。】 妇人怀胎，睡卧之处，要人护从，不可独寝，邪气易侵；虚险之处，不可往来，恐其堕跌。[104p]

Excessive joy can harm the heart and disperse energy; anger can injure the liver and raise energy upward; prolonged thinking can damage the spleen and cause energy stagnation; worry can hurt the lungs and lead to energy blockage; fear can affect the kidneys and lower energy. When maternal energy is harmed, the child’s energy corresponds to it, and there is none without injury. If the mother is harmed, miscarriage may easily occur; if the child is harmed, the internal energies will be uncoordinated, leading to many illnesses. Blindness, deafness, muteness, insanity, and seizures are all due to improper reception of energies.

After a woman conceives, she should not remain in one position for too long while standing, sitting, or lying down, as prolonged actions can harm her muscles and bones; the child in her womb shares energy with the mother, and there will surely be injury. If one engages in excessive passion during intercourse and the child is born with a white membrane on the head, sticky like glue, it is commonly referred to as being born with a "white cap," which is indeed a sign of the connection between mother and child. When a woman is pregnant, her sleeping area should be protected by someone; she should not sleep alone, as evil energies can easily invade; she should avoid dangerous places, fearing she might fall or get hurt.[104p]

　　　　　子满

　　孕妇至七八个月，其胎长大，腹大胀满，逼迫子户，坐卧不安，谓之子满，束胎饮主之。
　　　　　外科诸病

　　妊娠咽喉痛者，东垣凉膈散加牛旁子炒杵碎一钱。　　妊娠口舌生疮者，东垣凉膈散主之。　　孕妇多有病乳痈者，托里解毒汤主之。　　孕妇背上生疮毒者，此阳明经也，本方去青皮，加升麻、葛根各一钱。　　孕妇胸前两颊生疮毒者，此少阳经也。本方去白芷加柴胡，胆草、栀子。　　孕妇肩髆腋下生疮毒者，太阴经也，本方去青皮加陈皮，桔梗、桑白皮、天冬各一钱。　　孕妇胯内阴旁生疮毒者，厥阴经也，本方去白芷倍加青皮。　　孕妇手足掌内生疮毒者，少阴经也，本方去白芷、青皮、天花粉，加黄连、黄蘗、木通各一钱。
　　　　景岳全书 【明　张介宾】

　　　　　男女论[105p]

Child Fullness

When a pregnant woman reaches seven or eight months, the fetus grows large, the abdomen becomes distended, pressing against the childbirth channel, causing discomfort when sitting or lying down. This condition is called 'child fullness,' and is treated with the Binding the Fetus Decoction.

External Diseases

For a pregnant woman suffering from a sore throat, use the Eastern Garden Cool Diaphragm Powder with one qian of roasted beef seed ground fine. For mouth and tongue ulcers during pregnancy, the Eastern Garden Cool Diaphragm Powder is the primary treatment. Pregnant women often develop breast abscesses; in that case, the Exorcise Toxin Decoction is indicated. If sores or toxins appear on the back, this is related to the Yangming channel. Modify the original formula by removing the green peel and adding one qian each of Cimicifuga and Kudzu root. If sores or toxins appear on the cheeks or chest, this is related to the Shaoyang channel. Modify the original formula by removing the Angelica dahurica and adding Chai Hu, Dan Cao, and Gardenia fruit. For sores or toxins under the shoulder and axilla, which involve the Taiyin channel, remove the green peel from the original formula and add one qian each of dried tangerine peel, Platycodon, mulberry bark, and Asparagus root. For sores or toxins near the inner thighs and genitals, which pertain to the Jueyin channel, remove the Angelica dahurica and double the green peel. For sores or toxins on the palms and soles, concerning the Shaoyin channel, modify the original formula by removing Angelica dahurica, green peel, and Chinese yam powder, and adding one qian each of Huang Lian, Huang Bo, and Mu Tong.

Jingyue's Complete Book

(Ming Dynasty, Zhang Jieben)

Discussions of Men and Women[105p]

　　胎有男女则成有迟速，体有阴阳则怀有向背。男动在三月，阳性早也；女动在五月，阴性迟也。女胎背母而怀，故母之腹软；男胎面母而怀，故母之腹硬。此皆得理之谈，所当察也。
　　　　　安胎总论

　　凡妊娠胎气不安者，证本非一，治亦不同。盖胎气不安，必有所因，或虚或实，或寒或热，皆能为胎气之病，去其所病，便是安胎之法。故安胎之方，不可执，亦不可泥其月数，但当随证随经，因其病而药之，乃为至善。若谓白朮、黄芩乃安胎之圣药，执而用之，鲜不误矣。　　胎气有寒而不安者，其证或吞酸吐酸，或呕恶胀满，或喜热畏凉。或下寒泄泻，或脉多沉细，或绝无火证而胎有不安者，皆属阳虚寒证，但温其中而胎自安矣。宜用温胃饮、理阴煎之类，加减主之。亦当以平素之脏气，察其何如？酌而用之。　　胎气有热而不安者，其证必多烦热，或渴或躁，或上下不清，或漏血溺赤，或六脉滑数等证，宜凉胎饮、保阴煎之类主之。[106p]

When there is a fetus of both genders, there will be distinctions in the timing of its development; when there are both yin and yang, the orientation of the fetus can vary. A male fetus moves at three months, as yang is early; a female fetus moves at five months, as yin is late. A female fetus is positioned with its back to the mother, which is why the mother’s abdomen is soft; a male fetus is positioned facing the mother, resulting in a hard abdomen. This is all based on reason and should be observed.

In general, if the fetal energy during pregnancy is unstable, the causes are not the same, and the treatment should also differ. The instability of fetal energy must have a cause, whether it be deficiency or excess, cold or heat; all can lead to issues with the fetal energy. Eliminating the source of the problem is the method for stabilizing the pregnancy. Therefore, the methods for stabilizing pregnancy should not be rigid, nor should they be limited to specific months; rather, they should be adapted according to the symptoms and conditions presented, treating the ailment with appropriate remedies, which is the best approach. If one considers baizhu and huangqin to be the ultimate remedies for stabilizing pregnancy and insists on using them, it is rarely without error.

If the fetal energy is unstable due to cold, symptoms may include sour regurgitation, nausea and fullness, preference for warmth, and aversion to coolness. Symptoms may also include cold diarrhea, a pulse that is deep and thin, or no heat signs at all while the fetus is unstable, which all denote a deficiency of yang and cold symptoms. To remedy this, one should warm the interior to stabilize the fetus. It is advisable to use warming stomach drinks or formulas that regulate yin, adding or subtracting ingredients as needed. One should also consider the usual condition of the internal organs when deciding on treatment.

If the fetal energy is unstable due to heat, the symptoms will likely include much restlessness and heat, thirst, or agitation, unclear sensations above and below, blood leakage or red urine, or a slippery and rapid pulse among other signs. For these cases, one should primarily use cooling fetal drinks or formulas that nourish yin.[106p]

但热而无虚者，如枳壳汤、益母丸、黄芩散之类，皆可择用，清其火而胎自安矣。　　胎气有虚而不安者，最费调停。然有先天虚者，有后天虚者，胎元攸系，尽在于此。先天虚者，由于禀赋，当随其阴阳之偏，渐加培补，万毋欲速，以期保全。后天虚者，由于人事，凡色欲劳倦饮食七情之类，皆能伤及胎元。治此者，当察其所致之由因病而调，仍加戒慎可也。然总之不离于血气之虚，皆当以胎元饮为主。若心脾气虚于上者，宜逍遥饮、归脾汤、寿脾煎之类主之。肝肾不足于下者，宜左归饮、右归饮，因阴煎主之。气血俱虚者。宜五福饮、八珍汤，十全大补汤之类主之。脾肾气虚而兼带浊者，宜秘元煎、菟丝煎之类主之。多呕恶者，当随前证前方各加二陈汤之类以和之。凡治虚证，贵在随机应变，诚有不可以凿执言者。[107p]

For those with heat but not deficiency, remedies like Zhiqiao soup, Yimother pills, and Huangqin powder can be selected to clear the heat and stabilize the fetus. In cases where the fetal energy is deficient and unstable, it is particularly challenging to regulate. Here, there are congenital and acquired deficiencies, both of which are critical to the fetal essence. Congenital deficiencies are due to inherited constitution and should be gradually nurtured according to their Yin and Yang tendencies—one must not rush, seeking preservation. Acquired deficiencies arise from human affairs; all forms of desires, fatigue, dietary excesses, and emotional disturbances can harm the fetal essence. The treatment should focus on understanding the underlying causes and adjusting accordingly with caution. Nonetheless, overall, it pertains to the deficiency of blood and Qi, so the focus should be on the Fetal Essence Decoction. If there is deficiency in the heart and spleen Qi, remedies like Xiaoyao drink, Guizhi soup, and Shoupi decoction should be employed. If the liver and kidney are insufficient below, Left and Right Gui drinks should be used, adapting with Yin tonics. In cases where both Qi and blood are deficient, remedies like Wufu drink, Bachen soup, and Shiquan Dabu soup are appropriate. If there is a deficiency of spleen and kidney Qi accompanied by turbidity, remedies like Miyuan decoction and Tusi decoction should be applied. For excessive vomiting and nausea, it is advisable to combine the previously suggested formulas with Erchen decoction to harmonize. In general, when treating deficiency syndromes, flexibility in response is crucial, as there are no absolute rules.[107p]

　　胎气有实滞气滞，凡为恶阻为胀满而不安者，惟其素本不虚，而或多郁滞者乃有之。但察其所由而开之导之，诸治实者固无难也。呕吐不止者，二陈汤加枳壳、砂仁主之，或用人参橘皮汤亦妙。食滞胀满不安者，小和中饮加减主之。肝气滞逆胀满不安者，解肝煎主之。怒动肝气兼火者。化肝煎主之。脾肺气滞上攻作痛者，紫苏饮主之。气滞兼痰者，四七汤、二陈汤加当归主之。气滞兼火为胀为烦者，枳壳汤、束胎丸之类主之。　　王节斋曰：调理妊妇，在于清热养血。白朮补脾，为安胎君药，条实黄芩为安胎圣药，清热故也，暑月宜加用之。此一说者，虽若有理，而实有大病，不可不辨也。夫孕之胎气，必随母之脏气。[108p]

The presence of excess and stagnant qi can cause discomfort and fullness. This usually arises when the foundational energy is not deficient, but may be obstructed by stagnation. If one observes the causes and addresses them appropriately, treating these issues is not difficult. For persistent vomiting, the Er Chen Decoction with added bitter orange peel and cardamom is effective, or one can use the Ginseng and Tangerine Peel Decoction, which is also excellent. For food stagnation causing fullness and discomfort, the Xiao He Zhong Decoction with modifications is indicated. If liver qi is stagnant, causing reverse flow and discomfort, the Jie Gan Decoction is effective. If anger provokes liver qi along with heat, the Hua Gan Decoction should be used. For spleen and lung qi stagnation resulting in pain, the Zisu Decoction is advisable. If there is qi stagnation with phlegm, the Si Qi Decoction or Er Chen Decoction with added Angelica is suitable. If qi stagnation is accompanied by heat leading to fullness and agitation, the Bitter Orange Decoction or similar remedies should be prescribed. Wang Jiezai said: In caring for pregnant women, it is essential to clear heat and nourish the blood. White Atractylodes tonifies the spleen and is the chief herb for maintaining a stable pregnancy, while the combination with Huang Qin serves as a holy remedy due to its heat-clearing properties, especially during the hot months. This view, while seemingly rational, must be discerned in the face of significant illness. The qi of the fetus must align with the mother's organ qi.[108p]

大都阴虚者多热气；阳虚者多寒气；寒之则寒，热之则热者，是为平气。今以十人言之，则寒者居其三，热者居其三，平者居其四，此大较也。若谓受胎之后必增内热，自与常人不同，则何以治恶阻者，必用二陈、六君、生姜、半夏之属而后效，其果增热否乎？故治热宜黄芩，寒则不宜也。非惟寒者不宜也，即平气者亦不宜。盖凡今之胎妇，气实者少，气虚者多。气虚则阳虚而再用黄芩，有即受其损而病者，有用时虽或未觉，而阴损胎元，暗残母气，以致产妇羸困，或儿多脾病者，多由乎此。奈今人不能察理，但以圣药二字，认为胎家必用之药，无论人之阴阳强弱，凡属安胎无不用之，其害盖不少矣。至若白朮，虽善安胎，然或用不得善，则某性燥而气闭。故凡阴虚者非可独用，气滞者亦当权宜。是以用药之难，当如盘珠，有不可胶柱而鼓瑟也。[109p]

Generally, those with yin deficiency tend to have excess heat; those with yang deficiency tend to have excess cold. If they can feel cold, they are cold; if they can feel heat, they are hot—this is what we call balanced qi. Now, if we say among ten people, three are cold, three are hot, and four are balanced, this is the general comparison. If one claims that after conception internal heat must increase, differing from ordinary individuals, how can we treat those suffering from adverse conditions without using ingredients like Er Chen San, Liu Jun Zi, fresh ginger, and half summer, which undoubtedly increase heat? Therefore, for treating heat, Huangqin is appropriate, but it is not suitable for cold. Not only is it unsuitable for those who are cold, but also for those with balanced qi. Indeed, among today's pregnant women, there are few with abundant qi and many with qi deficiency. Qi deficiency leads to yang deficiency, and if Huangqin is used again, some may suffer from adverse effects, and even if they do not feel it at the time, it can harm the fetal essence and weaken the mother's qi, resulting in frailty after childbirth or an increase in the child’s spleen-related illnesses, often due to this. Yet, people today cannot perceive this principle but instead regard the phrase "sacred medicine" as essential to use for pregnant women, regardless of an individual's yin or yang strength, believing that all medicines for maintaining pregnancy must be used, which can indeed be quite harmful. As for Baizhu, while it is good for stabilizing pregnancy, it may not always work well if used improperly, due to its nature of being drying and qi-constricting. Therefore, for those with yin deficiency, it should not be used alone, and for those with qi stagnation, it should be used judiciously. Thus, the difficulty in prescribing medicine should be like arranging beads—one cannot be rigid in rules while playing music.[109p]

　　　　　恶阻

　　妊娠之妇，每多恶心呕吐，胀满不食，然亦虚实不同，所当辨而治之。　　凡恶阻多由胃虚气滞，然亦有素本不虚，而忽受胎妊，则冲任上壅，气不下行，故为呕逆等证，及三月余而呕吐渐止者，何也？盖胎元渐大，则脏气仅供胎气，故无暇上逆矣。凡治此者，宜以半夏茯苓汤、人参橘皮汤之类，随宜调理，使之渐安，必俟及期方得帖然也。若中脘多痰者，用二陈汤加枳壳，或用半夏茯苓汤。饮食停滞作胀者，宜小和中饮加减去之。气逆上作胀者，宜半夏茯苓汤加枳壳、苏梗、香附。脾胃气虚者，宜五味异功散、六君子汤、人参橘皮汤之类主之。胃虚兼寒多呕者，宜六味异功煎、温胃饮之类主之。肝肾阳虚作呕者，宜理阴前主之。[110p]

Aversion to Food

For pregnant women, it is common to experience nausea and vomiting, along with a feeling of fullness and inability to eat. However, the causes of these symptoms vary in nature and should be diagnosed and treated accordingly. Generally, aversion to food is often due to a deficiency in the stomach and qi stagnation. However, it can also occur in women who are not originally deficient but suddenly conceive, resulting in obstruction of the qi from ascending, leading to symptoms like nausea and vomiting. Furthermore, why do these symptoms gradually diminish after three months? This is because, as the fetus grows larger, the energy of the organs is primarily devoted to supporting the fetal energy, thus leaving little room for upward obstructions.

In treating this condition, it is advisable to use formulas like Banxia Fuling Decoction or Renshen Guo Pi Decoction to adjust and gradually calm the situation, ensuring treatment is maintained until the right time for recovery. If there is phlegm in the central abdomen, use Erchen Decoction with Zhike, or rely on Banxia Fuling Decoction. For dietary stagnation causing bloating, a mild Diarrhea Remedy should be modified accordingly. If qi rises and causes a feeling of fullness, use Banxia Fuling Decoction with Zhike, perilla stem, and xiangfu. For deficiency in spleen and stomach qi, utilize formulas such as Wuwei Yigong San, Liu Junzi Decoction, or Renshen Guo Pi Decoction. When there is significant vomiting due to stomach deficiency and cold, use Liuweidihuang Decoction or Warm Stomach Decoction. If vomiting is due to yang deficiency of the liver and kidneys, management should focus on addressing the underlying yin deficiency.[110p]

　　　　　胎气上逼

　　妊娠将理失宜，或七情郁怒，以致气逆，多有上逼之证。气逆气贵而胀逼者，宜解肝煎。胃寒气实而逼者，宜和胃饮，胃火兼滞者，宜枳壳汤。脾虚兼滞者，宜紫苏饮。脾虚而气不行者，宜四君子汤，甚者八珍汤。脾气虚而兼寒者。宜五君子煎。脾肾虚寒不行者，宜理阴煎。脾肾气虚兼火者，宜逍遥散，或加黄芩、枳壳、砂仁。胎死腹中，冷气上逼，呕恶面青者，治如后胎动欲堕条。[111p]

Fetal Energy Ascending

During pregnancy, if the proper conditions are lost, it may be caused by emotional disturbances like anger, leading to reversed qi and many signs of pressure upwards. If the qi is reversed and there is fullness and pressure, it's advisable to use the Liver-Relaxing Decoction. If there is cold in the stomach with fullness and pressure, one should use the Harmonizing Stomach Decoction. If there is stomach fire along with stagnation, the Orange Peel Decoction is recommended. For spleen deficiency with stagnation, the Perilla Decoction is suitable. If the spleen is deficient and qi is not flowing, the Four Gentlemen Decoction should be used, and in severe cases, the Eight Treasures Decoction. If there is spleen qi deficiency with cold, the Five Gentlemen Decoction is appropriate. For cases of both spleen and kidney deficiency with cold and poor circulation, the Regulating Yin Decoction should be used. If both the spleen and kidney qi are deficient with accompanying fire, the Relaxed Powder is recommended, possibly adding Huangqin, Orange Peel, or Sand Ginger. In cases of fetal demise in utero with cold qi pressing upwards, causing nausea and a pale face, treatment should be approached as if for the subsequent fetal movement wanting to abort.[111p]

　　　　　胎漏

　　妊妇经水不固者，谓之胎漏。而胎漏之由，有因胎气者，有因病气者，而胎气之由亦有二焉。余尝诊一妇人，脉见滑数而别无风热等病，问其经脉则如常不断，而但较前略少耳。余曰：此必受姙者也。因胎小血盛有余而然。后于三月之外，经脉方止，果产一男。故妊娠之妇，多有此类。今常见怀胎七八个月而生子者，但以血止为度，谓之不足月。然其受胎于未止之前，至此而足，而实人所不知也。但此等胎气，亦有阴阳盛衰之辨。如母气壮盛，阴胎有余而血之溢者，其血虽漏而生子仍不弱，此阴之强也，不必治之。[112p]

Fetal Leakage

When a pregnant woman experiences unstable menstrual flow, it is called fetal leakage. The causes of fetal leakage can arise from either fetal energy or pathological energy, and the influences on fetal energy can also be divided into two categories. I once diagnosed a woman whose pulse was slippery and rapid, without any signs of wind-heat or other illnesses. Upon inquiring about her menstrual flow, it appeared mostly normal but slightly reduced compared to before. I concluded that she must be pregnant, as the fetus was small while her blood volume was considerable. After three months, her menstrual flow ceased, and she successfully gave birth to a boy. Therefore, many pregnant women exhibit similar conditions. It is common to see women delivering babies after seven or eight months, but as long as the blood flow stops, it is deemed premature. However, the conception occurred before the flow ceased, which is something people generally do not understand. Even in cases of fetal energy, there are distinctions in the balance of Yin and Yang. If the mother’s energy is strong and the Yin of the fetus is abundant, leading to excess blood overflow, although the blood may leak, the child will not be weak; this illustrates the strength of Yin and does not necessarily require treatment.[112p]

若父气薄弱，胎有不能全受，而血之漏者，乃以精血俱亏，而生子必痿小，此阳之衰也，而亦人所不知也。凡此皆先天之由，若无可以为力者。然栽培根本，岂果无斡旋之道乎？但见有于无之日，及转强于弱之手为不易得，是乌可以寻常语也。至若因病而漏者，亦不过因病治之而已耳。如血热而漏者，保阴煎、清化饮择之而用。怒动肝火漏血者，保阴煎，甚者化肝煎主之。脾虚不能摄血者，寿脾煎、四君子之类主之。脾虚血热气滞者，四圣散主之。脾肾兼虚者，五阴煎主之。三焦气血俱虚者，五福饮、七福饮之类主之。劳倦伤而动血者，寿脾煎、归脾汤主之。偶因伤触动血者，五福饮、安胎散主之。冲任气虚，不能约制，血滑易动者，固阴煎、秘元煎主之。[113p]

If the paternal Qi is weak and the fetus cannot fully receive it, while there is a loss of blood, it results in both essence and blood being depleted, leading to a child that will inevitably be weak and small; this is a decline of Yang, which is also not well understood by people. All of this originates from the prenatal aspect, where there is nothing that can provide strength. However, nurturing the roots, can it truly have no method of adjustment? It can be seen that the transition from absence to presence and strengthening the weak hands is not easily achieved, making it not something to be discussed lightly. As for losses due to illness, they can only be treated by addressing the illness itself. For instance, if there is a loss from heat in the blood, one should use Baoyin Decoction or Qinghua Drink accordingly. If anger stirs liver fire causing blood loss, Baoyin Decoction should be used; for severe cases, Huagan Decoction is indicated. If the spleen is deficient and cannot hold the blood, then Shoupi Decoction or four gentlemen formula should be used. For spleen deficiency with blood heat and Qi stagnation, the Four Holy Powder is appropriate. If both the spleen and kidneys are deficient, then Wuyin Decoction is indicated. For simultaneous deficiency of Qi and blood in the Sanjiao, Wufu Drink or Qifu Drink may be used. If fatigue and labor cause blood movement, Shoupi Decoction or Guipi Decoction is advised. If blood loss occurs due to an accidental injury, Wufu Drink or An Tai Powder should be used. When there is Qi deficiency in the Chong and Ren Channels leading to blood being slippery and easily movable, Guding Decoction or Miyuan Decoction should be applied.[113p]

　　　　　卒然下血

　　妊娠忽然下血者，其证有四：或因火热迫血则妄行，或因郁怒气逆则动血，或因损触胎气胞宫受伤而下血，或因脾肾气陷命门不固而脱血。凡此皆动血之最者也，不速为调理，则必致堕胎矣。然治此者，必先察其血去之多少，及于血去之后。尤当察其邪之微甚。如火犹未清，仍当清火；气犹未顺，仍当顺气。若因邪而动血，血去而荣虚，则速当专顾元气以防脱陷，此中或当治标，或当救本，或当兼标本而调理之。倘不知先后缓急将恐治标未已，而救本无暇也，当详察之。若火盛迫血妄行者，当察其火之微甚，微者凉胎饮，稍甚者徙薪饮，甚极者保阴煎、子芩散。若肝经有风热而血下者，宜防风黄芩丸。若怒气伤肝，气逆血动而暴至者，宜保阴煎。[114p]

Sudden Blood Loss

When a woman experiences sudden blood loss during pregnancy, there are four possible conditions: it may be due to heat causing the blood to move abnormally, or due to anger obstructing the qi and stirring the blood, or due to trauma affecting the fetal energy and injuring the uterus, or due to the weakness of the spleen and kidneys leading to instability at the gate of life which causes blood loss. All of these are severe instances of blood movement; if not treated promptly, they will certainly lead to miscarriage.

In addressing this issue, one must first assess the quantity of blood lost and what happens afterward. It is particularly important to examine the severity of the pathological factors. If heat remains, one should still clear the heat; if the qi is not yet harmonized, one should also remedy the qi. If the blood moves due to pathogenic factors and the loss leads to a deficiency of vitality, one must prioritize nourishing the original qi to prevent further loss. Treatment may involve addressing either the symptoms or the root cause, or combining both approaches to restore balance.

If one is unclear about the order of treatment or the urgency, there is a risk that symptomatic treatment will be addressed before the root cause is attended to. Therefore, a thorough investigation is necessary. If the blood movement is caused by intense heat, one must evaluate the degree of heat; if mild, a cooling elixir for the fetus may be given, if slightly more severe, a warming decoction may be appropriate, and if extremely severe, one should use Baoyin Decoction or Ziqin Powder. If there is wind-heat in the liver channel causing blood loss, one should employ Fenghuangqing Pill for protection. If anger has harmed the liver, causing qi stagnation and sudden blood movement, then Baoyin Decoction is advisable.[114p]

气有未顺而胀满者，四七汤、二陈汤或加芎、归之类。兼肝火者，宜化肝煎。若触损胎气，胞宫受伤而血下者，宜安胎散、胶艾汤；去血多者，倍加人参。若从高堕下，伤动胎气而下血者，宜益母地黄汤、安胎散；因惊气虚而陷者，仍加人参。若脾胃素弱，或偶因伤脾下血者，宜寿脾煎、归脾汤；或中气下陷者，补中益气汤。若血虚微热，漏血尿血者，续断汤。以上诸动血证，若去血未多，血无所积，胎未至伤而不止者，宜凉则凉，宜补则补，惟以安之固之为主治。若血已离位，蓄积胞宫，为胀为痛，而余血未出者，欲与留之有不可得，欲去其血而不伤营气，则惟四物汤大加当归为最宜也。若察其胎气已动，势有难留，则五物煎、决津煎皆切要之药。[115p]

When there is Qi that is not yet smooth and feels distended and full, use Si Qi Decoction, Er Chen Decoction, or add herbs like Chuanxiong and Angelica. If there is accompanying liver fire, it is appropriate to use the Liver-Transforming Decoction. If there is trauma affecting the fetal Qi, causing injury to the womb and resulting in bleeding, use the Calming Fetus Powder or Jiao Ai Decoction; if there is significant bleeding, double the dose of ginseng. If the patient has fallen from a height, injuring the fetal Qi and causing bleeding, the Yi Mu Cao and Calming Fetus Powder should be used; if there is shock leading to Qi deficiency, ginseng should be added. If the spleen and stomach are inherently weak, or if there is occasional bleeding due to spleen injury, use the Shou Pi Decoction or Gui Pi Decoction; if there is middle Qi sinking, then use the Bu Zhong Yi Qi Decoction. If there is slight heat from blood deficiency and symptoms such as bleeding, use the Xu Duan Decoction. For the aforementioned bleeding conditions, if the amount of blood lost is not considerable, and there is no accumulation of blood, and the fetus is not yet harmed and does not stop moving, then it is crucial to stabilize and strengthen as needed. If the blood has already displaced, accumulating in the womb, causing distension and pain, and the remaining blood has not been expelled, wanting to preserve it becomes difficult, while wanting to remove the blood without harming the nutritive Qi requires using Si Wu Decoction with a large dose of Angelica as the most appropriate choice. If it is noted that the fetal Qi is already moving with a tendency to displace, then Wu Wu Decoction and Jue Jin Decoction are essential medicines.[115p]

　　　　　胎动欲堕

　　妊娠胎气伤动者，轻则转动不安，或微见血，察其不甚，速宜安之，用前安胎及卒然下血等法。若腹痛血多，腰酸下坠，势有难留者，无如决津煎、五物煎，助其血而落之，最为妥当。若其势甚而舌青面赤，胀满呕恶，或冷气上逼者，儿已死矣，当速去其胎以救其母。气血虚者，惟用决津煎最妙；如不应而胀痛上逼，势不容缓者，急用平胃散一两，酒水各半煎，投(石卜)硝五钱热服之；或用(石卜)硝一两以童便调服，则逐而下矣。下后随证调补之。如无腹急，则但用决津煎加(石卜)硝，则死胎自下。[116p]

Fetal Movement and Threat of Miscarriage

When the fetal energy during pregnancy is disturbed, the signs can range from slight restlessness in movement to minor bleeding. If the bleeding is not severe, it is advisable to calm the situation with methods for stabilizing the fetus and remedies for sudden bleeding. However, if there are abdominal pains with significant bleeding, and symptoms such as lower back pain and a feeling of heaviness indicate a serious risk of loss, using the Juejin decoction or Wuwu decoction to aid in expelling the blood is the most appropriate course of action.

If the situation is severe, with a blue tongue, red face, distention, nausea, or if cold air is pushing upwards, the fetus is already deceased, and it is crucial to expel it swiftly to save the mother. In cases of deficiency of vital energy and blood, the Juejin decoction is the best choice. If there is unresponsive distention and prompt action is necessary, urgently use Pingwei powder, one tael, with half a share of wine and water, decocted and taken hot with five qian of Glauber's salt; or take one tael of Glauber’s salt mixed with child's urine. This will aid in expelling the fetus.

After expulsion, promptly adjust and replenish based on accompanying symptoms. If there is no urgent abdominal pain, simply using the Juejin decoction with added Glauber’s salt will result in the expulsion of the dead fetus.[116p]

　　　　　数堕胎

　　夫胎以阳生阴长，气行血随，营卫调和，则及期而产，若或滋养之机，少有间断，则源流不继，而胎不固。譬之种植者，津液一有不到，则枯槁而剥落矣。故五常政大论曰：根于中者命曰神机，神去则机息；根于外者命曰气立，气止则化绝。正此谓也。凡妊娠之数见堕胎者，必以气脉亏损而然。而亏损之由。有禀质之素弱者，有年力之衰残者，有忧怒劳苦而困其精力者，有色欲不慎而损其生气者。此外如跌扑饮食，皆能伤其气脉，气脉有伤而胎可无恙者，非先天之最完固者不能，而常人则未之有也。且怀胎十月，经养各有所主，所以屡见小产堕胎者，多在三个月及五月七月之间，而下次之堕，必如期复然，正以先次伤此一经，再值此经，则遇阙不能过矣。[117p]

Miscarriage

A fetus is conceived through the union of the male and female principles, with vital energy flowing and blood following. If nourishment is administered smoothly and in harmony, a birth will occur at the proper time. However, if there are interruptions in this nourishing process, the continuity of its source is disrupted, and the fetus cannot remain secure. This can be likened to someone planting seeds: if the necessary moisture is insufficient, they will wither and fall away. Thus, it is said in the Great Treatise on the Five Constants: what is rooted internally is termed the "spiritual mechanism"; when the spirit departs, the mechanism ceases. What is rooted externally is termed "established energy"; when energy halts, transformation ceases. This is exactly what is meant.

Whenever there are cases of miscarriage during pregnancy, it is always due to the depletion of energy channels. The reasons for this depletion can vary: some individuals may be naturally weak, some may be advanced in age and debilitated, some may suffer from worry, anger, or fatigue that exhausts their vitality, and some may recklessly indulge in desires that harm their life force. Furthermore, external factors like falls or improper diet can also injure these energy channels. If the energy channels are damaged, it is unlikely for a fetus to survive unless it possesses an exceptionally strong and resilient constitution. The average person does not have this capacity.

Moreover, a pregnancy lasts ten months and requires careful nurturing; hence, those who frequently experience miscarriages often do so between the third and fifth or seventh months. Subsequent miscarriages will likely happen similarly at the same intervals because the previous injury to the energy channels renders them incapable of sustaining the pregnancy again at the subsequent time.[117p]

况妇人肾以系胞，而腰为肾之腑，故胎孕之妇，最虑腰痛，痛甚则坠，不可不防。故凡畏堕胎者，必当察此所伤之由，而切为戒慎。凡治堕胎者，必当察此养胎之源，而预培其损。保胎之法，无出于此，若待临期，恐无及也。　　凡胎不固，无非气血损伤之病。盖气虚则提摄不固，血虚则灌溉不周，所以多致小产。故善保胎者，必当专顾血虚，宜以胎元饮为主而加减用之；其次则芍药芎归汤；再次则泰山盘石散，或千金保孕丸，皆有夺造化之功，所当酌用者也。　　又凡胎热者血易动。血动者胎不安，故堕于内热而虚者，亦常有之。若脾气虚而血热者，宜四圣散。肝肾虚而血热者，宜凉胎饮。肝脾虚而血热者，宜固胎煎。此外凡有他证而胎不安者，当于安胎条中酌而治之。[118p]

Moreover, a woman’s kidneys are connected to the womb, and the waist is considered the organ of the kidneys. Therefore, pregnant women are particularly prone to back pain; if the pain is severe, it may lead to miscarriage, which cannot be ignored. Thus, those who fear miscarriage must understand the reasons for such injuries and take careful precautions. In treating miscarriages, one must understand the source of nourishing the fetus and proactively compensate for any losses. The methods for preserving pregnancy are fundamentally based on this; waiting until the time is near might leave one without recourse.

In general, an unstable pregnancy stems from damage to the vital energy (qi) and blood. When qi is deficient, it cannot uphold the pregnancy, and when blood is deficient, it fails to nourish properly, often resulting in miscarriages. Therefore, those skilled in preserving pregnancies must focus on addressing blood deficiency, primarily using the Fetal Vitality Decoction and adjusting its components; next is the Peony and Chuanxiong Decoction; then there is the Mount Tai Stone Powder, or the Qianjin Fetal Preservation Pills, both of which have the power to assist natural processes and should be used judiciously.

Additionally, whenever there is heat in the pregnancy, the blood easily becomes agitated. When the blood is in motion, the fetus is unstable, thus it is common for those with internal heat and deficiency to experience this. If one has spleen deficiency and heat in the blood, the Four Saints Powder is recommended. If there is liver and kidney deficiency with blood heat, a Cooling Fetal Drink is suggested. If there is liver and spleen deficiency with blood heat, a Stabilizing Fetus Decoction should be used. Furthermore, if there are other conditions leading to fetal instability, one should refer to the guidelines for pregnancy preservation and treat accordingly.[118p]

　　　　　小产

　　小产之证，有轻重，有远近，有禀赋，有人事。由禀赋者多以虚弱，由人事者多以损伤。凡正产者出于熟落之自然，小产者由于损折之勉强，此小产之所以不可忽也。若其年力已衰，产育已多，欲其再娠且固，自所难能。凡见此者，但得保其母气则为善矣。若少年不慎以致小产，此则最宜调理。否则下次临期，仍然复坠，以至二次三次，终难子嗣，所系不小矣。[119p]

Miscarriage

The signs of miscarriage have varying degrees of severity, distance, innate factors, and human circumstances. Those who have innate weaknesses often suffer from miscarriage, while those affected by human circumstances usually experience it due to injury. Natural childbirth arises from the proper readiness of the body, whereas miscarriage results from forced circumstances. This is why miscarriage should not be taken lightly. If a woman is already aging, having borne many children, desiring another pregnancy becomes difficult. In such cases, the priority should be to ensure the mother's health. If a young woman experiences a miscarriage due to carelessness, it is crucial to provide proper care and recovery. Otherwise, if she becomes pregnant again, she may face repeated miscarriages, leading to difficulties in having children, which is a serious concern.[119p]

　　凡妇人年及中衰，胎元无力，则常有胎不能长，及多小产昏运之患，此气血衰败而然。气血既衰，则凡于小产之后，多有胎既落而复下坠，如更有一胎欲产者，此非胎也，乃因气虚而胞宫随胎下陷也。产母不知，必至惊慌。此无足虑，但一以寿脾煎或八珍、十全大补、芎归补中汤之类主之，则自安矣。　　凡小产有远近，其在二月、三月产者为近，五月、六月产者为远。新受而产者其势轻，怀久而产者其势重，此皆人之所知也。至若犹有近者，则随孕随产矣。凡今艰嗣之家，犯此者十居五六，其为故也，总由纵欲而然。[120p]

When women reach middle age and their reproductive energy weakens, they often experience difficulties in carrying a fetus to term and are prone to multiple miscarriages; this occurs due to the deficiency of vital energy and blood. When the vital energy and blood are weakened, after a miscarriage, it is common for the uterus to continue to descend as if there is another fetus wanting to be delivered; this is not actually another fetus but a result of qi deficiency causing the uterus to sag. If the mother is unaware, she will be greatly alarmed. This is not a matter of serious concern; simply using formulas like Shoupi Decoction or Eight Treasures, Ten Fully Nourishing, or Xiong Gui Bu Zhong Decoction will suffice to provide reassurance.

In terms of miscarriages, those occurring in the second or third month are considered close, while those in the fifth or sixth month are seen as distant. Early miscarriages are lighter in impact, while those after a longer duration are heavier; this is well-known. If there are still close cases, they will result in concurrent pregnancies and miscarriages. Among families currently facing difficulties in conceiving, it is estimated that five or six out of ten encounter these issues, primarily due to indulgence in desires.[120p]

但自来人所不知，亦所不信，兹谨以笔代灯，用指迷者，倘济后人，实深愿也，请详言之！盖胎元始肇，一月如珠露，二月如桃花，三月、四月而后血脉形体具，五月、六月而后筋骨毛发生。方其初受，亦不过一滴之元精耳，此其橐钥正无依，根荄尚无地，巩之则固，决之则流。故凡受胎之后，极宜节欲，以防泛溢。而少年纵情，罔知忌惮。虽胎固欲轻者，保全亦多。[121p]

However, what has been unknown and disbelieved by people since ancient times, I now cautiously use my pen instead of a lamp to guide those who are lost. If this can benefit future generations, it is my deep wish, so let me explain in detail!

The origin of life begins with the unborn: in the first month, it is like dew on a pearl; in the second month, it resembles peach blossoms. By the third and fourth months, the blood vessels and physical body are formed; in the fifth and sixth months, muscles, bones, and hair begin to grow. At the very beginning, it is merely a drop of original essence — this key to life has no dependency yet, and its roots have no ground. If it is nurtured, it becomes solid; if disturbed, it flows away. Therefore, after conception, it is essential to practice restraint, to prevent overflow. Yet the youth, indulging in their desires, are unaware of taking precautions. Even if the fetus desires to be light and carefree, preserving it remains crucial.[121p]

其有兼人有勇者，或恃强而不败，或既败而复战，当此时也，主方欲静，客不肯休，无奈狂徒敲门撞户，顾彼水性热肠，有不启扉而从随流而逝者乎？斯时也，落花与粉蝶齐飞，火枣共交梨并逸，合污同流，已莫知其昨日孕而今日产矣，朔日孕而望日产矣。随孕随产，本无形迹。盖明产者，胎已成形，小产必觉。暗产者，胎仍似水，直溜何知。故凡今之娼妓，则多无大产，以小产之多化。娶娼妓者，多少子息，以其子宫滑而惯于小产也。今尝见艰嗣求方者，问其阳事，则曰能战；问其功夫，则曰尽通；问其意况，则怨叹曰人皆有子我独无。亦岂知人之明产而尔之暗产也？此外如受胎三月五月而每有堕者，虽衰薄之妇常有之，然必由纵欲不节，致伤母气而堕者为尤多也。故凡恃强过勇者多无子，以强弱之自相残也；纵肆不节者多不育，以盗损胎元之气也。岂悉由妇人之罪哉？[122p]

Some have both courage and strength, relying on their might without defeat, while others, having been defeated, engage in battle again. At such a time, the ruler wishes for tranquility, but the visitor insists on continuing. What can be done about the reckless who pound on doors and walls? Consider the nature of waters that flow with warmth—are there those who do not open the door and instead drift away with the current? At this time, fallen blossoms and powdery butterflies fly together, while fire jujubes and pears intertwine and drift, all merging into the flow, unaware of yesterday's conception and today's birth, as the new moon conceives and the full moon delivers. The process of conception and birth is inherently without visible traces. Indeed, when a birth is evident, the fetus has already taken shape, and a miscarriage must be felt. In contrast, when the birth is obscure, the fetus remains like water, slipping away unnoticed. Thus, among today’s courtesans, many do not have substantial offspring; instead, their many small births become the norm. Those who marry courtesans often have few children, as their wombs are slippery and accustomed to small births. I have seen those who struggle for descendants, when asked about their manly skills, reply that they can battle; when asked about their techniques, they say they excel; but when questioned about their situation, they lament, "Everyone has children but me." Do they not realize that while others bear children clearly, they bear them in secret? Furthermore, for those who conceive and miscarry at three or five months, though this may happen to weak women, it often results from excessive desire and indulgence, which harms the mother’s vitality and leads to miscarriage. Therefore, those who rely on brute strength and excessive bravery often have no children, due to mutual harm between strength and weakness. Likewise, those who indulge without restraint often remain childless, as they deplete the vital energy of the fetus. Can this truly all be blamed on the women?[122p]

　　　　　胎不长

　　妊娠胎气本乎血气，胎不长者，血气之不足耳。故受胎后而漏血不止者有之，血不归胎也。妇人中年血气衰败者有之，泉源日涸也。妇人多脾胃病者有之，仓廪薄则化源亏而冲任穷也。妇人多郁怒者有之，肝气逆则血有不调而胎失所养也。或以血气寒而不长者，阳气衰则生气少也。或以血热而不长者，火邪盛则真阴损也。凡诸病此者，则宜补宜固，宜温宜清，但因其病而随机应之，则或以及期，或以过期，胎气渐充，自无不长。惟是年迈血衰而然者，数在天也，有非可以人力为也。[123p]

The Failure of Fetal Growth

The essence of a fetus during pregnancy fundamentally relies on the qualities of blood and qi. If the fetus does not grow, it is simply due to a deficiency of blood and qi. Thus, those who experience continuous bleeding after conception do so because blood does not return to nourish the fetus. Some women in middle age find their blood and qi weakening, akin to a spring that gradually runs dry. Women suffering from numerous digestive issues will have a diminished source of nourishment, leading to insufficient support for the channels. Women who often experience frustration and anger may have their liver qi in rebellion, resulting in an improper balance of blood that fails to adequately support the fetus. Occasionally, insufficient growth may stem from cold blood and qi, indicating weakened yang, which results in a lack of vitality. Conversely, overheating blood may impede growth, as excessive fire harms the true yin. For all these conditions, nourishment and strengthening, warmth and clarity should be considered, responding appropriately to the specific ailment; thus, if timed well, growth may occur, or even if delayed, as the fetal essence gradually accumulates, growth will naturally resume. However, when advanced age leads to blood deficiency, such circumstances are often beyond human control.[123p]

　　　　　鬼胎

　　妇人有鬼胎之说，岂虚无之鬼气，果能袭人胞宫，而遂得成形者乎？此不过由本妇之气质弱，或以邪思蓄注，血随气结而不散，或以冲任滞逆，脉道壅瘀而不行，是皆内因之病，而必非外来之邪，盖即血症气瘕之类耳，当即以症瘕之法治之。此外如狐魅异类之遇者，则实有所受，而又非鬼胎之谓，亦当于症瘕类求法下之。　　又凡鬼胎之病，必以血气不足而兼凝滞者多有之，但见经候不调，而预为调补，则必无是病。若其既病，则亦当以调补元气为主，而继以去积之药乃可也。然用补之外，而欲于补中兼行者，无如决津煎。欲去其滞而不至猛峻者，无如通瘀煎。既加调补而欲直攻其病者，则夺命丹、回生丹，皆可酌用。或以当归红花煎浓汤送赤金豆亦妙。[124p]

Ghostly Fetus

The notion of a ghostly fetus among women is not simply an empty illusion; can it truly invade a person's womb and take shape? This phenomenon arises primarily from the woman's own weakness in constitution or from accumulated unhealthy thoughts, leading to blood stagnation. When there is an obstruction in the channels, the flow of qi and blood is hindered, representing an internal ailment rather than an external evil influence. It pertains more to symptoms of blood stagnation and qi blockage, which should be treated accordingly. Additionally, encounters with fox spirits or similar entities do have an impact, but they should not be confused with the concept of a ghostly fetus; instead, they too must be addressed through methods related to stagnation.

Furthermore, cases of ghostly fetus illness typically involve insufficient blood and qi compounded by stagnation. If one finds their menstrual cycle irregular and begins to nourish and rectify, they are unlikely to suffer this ailment. However, if they are already afflicted, treatment should focus on restoring the fundamental qi first, followed by remedies to eliminate stagnation. For gentle assistance alongside nourishment, there is nothing better than the Juejin Decoction. If one wishes to remove blockage without harshness, the Tongyu Decoction is most suitable. When one aims to address the ailment directly after supplementary treatment, both the Duoming Dan and the Huisheng Dan are worth considering. Alternatively, a concentrated broth of Angelica and safflower with red gold beans also works remarkably well.[124p]

　　　　　妊娠宜寡欲

　　妊娠之妇大宜寡欲，其在妇人多所不知，其在男子而亦多有不知者，近乎愚矣。凡胎元之强弱，产育之难易，及产后崩淋经脉之病，无不悉由乎此。其为故也，盖以胎神巩固之日，极宜保护宫城，使不知慎而多动欲火，盗泄阴精，则藩篱由不固而伤，血气由不聚而乱，子女由元亏而夭，而阴分之病，亦无不由此而百出矣。此妇人之最宜慎者，知者不可不察。
　　　　　药食

　　妇人血气俱虚，经脉不调，不受孕者，惟毓麟珠随宜加减用之为最妙；其次则八珍益母丸亦佳。若脏寒气滞之甚者，用续嗣降生丹亦妙。
　　　　　用药法[125p]

On Pregnancy and Moderation of Desires

Pregnant women should greatly limit their desires. There is much that women may not know, and men also may be ignorant, bordering on foolishness. The strength or weakness of the fetus, the ease or difficulty of childbirth, and the post-natal issues such as hemorrhage and irregularities in the menstrual cycle—all are fundamentally influenced by this. The reason is that during the time of fetal development, it is essential to protect the womb and refrain from excessive desires, which can cause the loss of vital energy. If the defenses are weak, injuries can occur; if the blood and energy do not coalesce properly, chaos ensues; and if the vital essence is depleted, the offspring may perish prematurely, and ailments of the reproductive system will also arise from this. This is paramount for women to exercise caution; those who are wise must take heed.

Medicine and Nutrition

For women with both blood and energy deficiency, irregular menstrual flow, and who are unable to conceive, the most effective remedy is to appropriately regulate the use of Yu Lin Zhi (a traditional tonic). Following that, Ba Zhen Yi Mu Wan (Eight Treasures and Nourishing Mother Pills) is also good. If there is severe stagnation due to coldness in the organs, using Xu Si Jiang Sheng Dan (a tonic for fertility) is also effective.[125p]

　　凡男女胎孕所由，总在血气。若血气和平壮盛者，无不孕育，育亦无不长。其有不能孕者，无非气血薄弱；育而不长者，无非根本不固。即如诸病相加，无非伤损血气。如果邪逆未除，但当以煎剂略为拨正，拨正之后，则必以调和气血为主，斯为万全之策。所以凡用种子丸散，切不可杂以散风消导，及败血苦寒峻利等药。盖凡久服之药，而加以此类，则久而增气，未有不反伤气血而难于孕者也。至若香附一物，自王好古曰：乃妇人之仙药，多服亦能走气。而后世不言走气，但相传曰香附为妇人之要药，由是但治妇人则不论虚实，无弗用之。不知香附气香味辛性燥，惟开郁散气，行血导滞，乃其所长，若气虚用之，大能泄气，血虚用之，大能耗血。如古方之女金丹，及四制香附丸之类，惟气实血滞者用之为宜。凡今妇人十有九虚，顾可以要药二字，而一概用之乎？用之不当，则渐耗渐弱，而胎元之气，必反将杳然矣。
　　　　石室秘录 【清　陈士铎】[126p]

All conception in men and women ultimately depends on the state of blood and qi. When blood and qi are harmonious and abundant, there is no case of inability to conceive; those conceived will grow without exception. Those unable to conceive are simply weak in qi and blood; those that do not thrive are due to unstable foundations. Just as various illnesses compound, it all stems from damage to blood and qi. If any evil or countercurrent remains, one should simply use decoctions to slightly correct the imbalance. After correcting, the primary focus must be on harmonizing qi and blood, which is the best approach for a complete remedy.

Thus, in using seeds, pills, or powders, one must not mix them with drugs that disperse wind, eliminate phlegm, or any cold and harsh medicines. For any long-term medications, if combined with such types, over time they will increase qi but ultimately injure qi and blood, making conception difficult. As for Xiangfu (Cyperus rotundus), it is said by Wang Haogu to be an elixir for women, and frequent use can move qi. However, in later generations, it is not discussed in terms of regulating qi, but rather is passed down as an essential medicine for women, applied indiscriminately without consideration for deficiency or excess.

What is overlooked is that Xiangfu, being aromatic with a pungent and dry nature, is primarily for relieving stagnation, dispersing qi, moving blood, and guiding away obstructions. If used for qi deficiency, it can greatly deplete qi; if used for blood deficiency, it can significantly deplete blood. Like the ancient formula for the Ladies’ Golden Pill and the various Xiangfu pills, they should only be used when there is substantial qi and stagnant blood. Yet, among contemporary women, nine out of ten are deficient—can such an important medicine be used indiscriminately? Improper use will gradually weaken them, and the vital force for conception will inevitably fade away.[126p]

　　　　　子悬

　　子悬之证，乃胎热而子不安，身欲起立于胞中，故若悬起之象，其实非子能悬挂也。若作气盛下之，立死矣。方用人参、茯苓各二钱，白朮、白芍各五钱，黄芩、生地各三钱，杜仲一钱、熟地一两，归身二钱，水煎服。此方纯是利腰脐之圣药，少加黄芩清之则胎得寒自定。况方中滋补有余，而寒凉不足，定变扶危，中藏深意。盖胎系于腰肾之间，而胞又结于任冲之际，今药皆直入于内经之中，则深根固蒂，子即欲动而不能；况又用清热之药，有不泰然于下者乎？
　　　　　漏胎

　　漏胎乃气血不足之故，急宜以峻补之则胎不漏，方用人参、山茱萸、山药、茯苓各二钱，白朮、熟地各五钱，杜仲、枸杞子、当归身、甘草各一钱，麦冬三钱，北五味五分，水煎服。此方不寒不热，安胎之圣药也。凡有胎不安者，此方安之神效。胎之动也，由于男女之颠狂。今补其气血，自然镇定，又何至漏胎哉！或用黑白安胎散方可。[127p]

Zihuan

The condition of "Zihuan" (suspended fetus) is characterized by heat in the womb, causing the fetus to be restless and attempting to rise within the amniotic sac, resembling a suspended state; in reality, it is not the fetus that can hang. If one uses strong qi to push downward, it could lead to death. The prescription consists of two qian of ginseng and poria, five qian of white atractylodes and white peony, three qian of yellow quino and raw earth, one qian of eucommia, one liang of cooked earth, and two qian of angelica, all boiled in water for consumption. This formula is solely a divine medicine for benefiting the waist and navel; if one adds a bit of yellow quino to clear it, the fetus will stabilize with the cold. Moreover, the formula is rich in nourishment while lacking excessive coldness, ensuring stability in crisis, with profound meaning within. The fetus is connected between the waist and kidneys, while the amniotic sac is tied at the ren and chong points; hence, the herbs directly enter the internal meridians, solidifying the foundation, causing the fetus to desire movement yet unable to. Especially with the use of heat-clearing herbs, could there be instability below?

Loutai

"Loutai" (threatened miscarriage) is due to insufficient qi and blood. It is urgent to use strong supplements to prevent miscarriage. The formula consists of two qian of ginseng, cornelian cherry, yam, and poria; five qian of white atractylodes and cooked earth; one qian of eucommia, goji berries, angelica, and licorice; three qian of ophiopogon; and five fen of northern five-flavor fruit, all boiled in water for consumption. This formula is neither cold nor hot, a divine medicine for stabilizing the fetus. For anyone experiencing instability in pregnancy, this formula has miraculous effects in calming it. The movements of the fetus are influenced by the exuberance of the parents. Now, by supplementing qi and blood, it naturally stabilizes, so how could there be a risk of miscarriage? Alternatively, one may use the black and white formula for stabilizing the fetus.[127p]

　　　　　胎动

　　胎动则漏胎之兆、以前漏胎方治之，无不神效。或用止漏绝神丹，较胜安胎之药。要而论之，胎动是热，不动是寒。热用黄芩，寒用砂仁，寒热相兼，并用砂仁、黄芩。世不察其寒热，专以黄芩、砂仁为安胎圣药亦谬矣。
　　　　　小产

　　小产之证，非产前也，然非正产之证，方可作产前治。如人不正产而先产者，名曰小产。虽无大产之虚，而气血亦大伤矣。宜急补之，则日后坐胎，不至再有崩漏。用人参、当归、白朮各五钱，茯苓三钱，熟地一两，杜仲二钱，炮姜五分，水煎服。此方乃补气补血之圣方。胞动而下，必损带脉，补其气血，则带脉损处可以重生，他日受孕，不致有再损之虞矣。[128p]

Fetal Movement

Fetal movement indicates the risk of miscarriage. It should be treated beforehand, and the results are invariably remarkable. Some use the Stop Miscarriage Elixir, which is often more effective than the medicinal herbs meant to stabilize pregnancy. In discussing this, it is said that fetal movement signifies heat, while lack of movement signifies cold. For heat, one should use Huangqin; for cold, Sha Ren. If both heat and cold are present, both Sha Ren and Huangqin should be used. The world does not recognize the balance of heat and cold, mistakenly considering Huangqin and Sha Ren as the only sacred medicines for stabilizing pregnancy.

Miscarriage

The signs of miscarriage do not occur before delivery, yet they do not align with regular childbirth signs, and should therefore be treated as pre-delivery complications. If someone miscarries without a full delivery, it is termed a miscarriage. Even though there may not be the significant void of a complete delivery, both Qi and blood are still greatly harmed. It is urgent to replenish them to prevent future miscarriages. Use five qian of Ren Shen, Dang Gui, and Bai Zhu; three qian of Fu Ling; one liang of Shu Di; two qian of Du Zhong; and five fen of Pao Jiang, decocted in water for consumption. This formula is indeed a sacred recipe for replenishing Qi and blood. As the fetus moves downward, it will inevitably harm the Dai Mai (a type of meridian), but by replenishing the Qi and blood, the damage to this meridian can regenerate. Consequently, in future pregnancies, there should be no risk of further harm.[128p]

　　　　　产前白带

　　产前无白带也。有则难产之兆，即幸而顺生，产后亦有血运之事。方用黑豆三合，煎汤二碗，先用一碗，入白果十个，红枣二十个，熟地一两，山茱萸、薏苡仁、山药各四钱，茯苓三钱，泽泻、丹皮各二钱，加水二碗，煎服，一剂止，二剂永不白带。亦通治妇人之诸带，无不神效。
　　　　　妊娠少阴伤寒

　　妊妇临月，忽感少阴经风邪，恶寒蜷卧手足冷者，不治证也。少阴，肾经也。无论传经至少阴，与直中入少阴，苟得此证，多不能治。盖少阴肾经，宜温而不宜寒，今风寒入之，则命门之火微，而肾宫无非寒气，势必子宫亦寒。手足冷者，脾胃寒极之兆也。脾胃至于寒极，不死何待？而吾以为可生者，以胎之未下也，急以温热药救之。方名散寒救胎汤，人参一两，白朮二两，肉桂、干姜、甘草各一钱，水煎服。[129p]

Prepartum Discharge

There should be no discharge before childbirth. If there is, it indicates a sign of difficult labor; even if fortunate enough for a smooth delivery, there can still be issues with bleeding afterward. One should use three portions of black beans to brew two bowls of soup. First, take one bowl, add ten ginkgo nuts, twenty red dates, one tael of cooked rehmannia, and four qian each of cornelian cherries, coix seeds, and Chinese yam, along with three qian of poria and two qian each of alisma and moutan root. Add two bowls of water and decoct it for consumption. One dose is sufficient, and two doses will prevent white discharge permanently. This can also treat various women's discharges, all with remarkable efficacy.

Pregnancy and Cold from the Shaoyin

When a pregnant woman is nearing her term and suddenly feels cold due to wind evil affecting the Shaoyin channel, curling up with cold hands and feet, this is not a treatable condition. The Shaoyin is associated with the kidney channel. Whether the evil affects the channel from the Shaoyin or goes directly into the Shaoyin, if it gives this indication, it is often hard to treat. The Shaoyin kidney channel should be warm and not cold; if wind and cold enter, the fire of the life gate is diminished, and the kidney palace becomes entirely cold, which inevitably causes the uterus to be cold as well. Cold hands and feet indicate extreme cold in the spleen and stomach. When the spleen and stomach are extremely cold, how can one survive? Yet, I believe life is still possible as the fetus has not yet descended. One should urgently use warming herbs to rescue it. The prescription is named "Wind Dispelling and Fetus Rescuing Decoction," consisting of one tael of ginseng, two taels of atractylodes, and one qian each of cinnamon, dried ginger, and licorice, boiled with water for consumption.[129p]

一剂而寒散，不恶寒矣；再剂而手足温，不蜷卧矣；三剂痊愈。夫人参、白朮所以固气。肉桂、干姜，虽是散寒，用之于临月之时，何愁胎堕？然毕竟二味性甚猛烈，得甘草以和之，则二味单去袪腹中之寒，而不去催胎中之子，助人参、白朮以扫除，更有殊功耳，岂漫然而多用之哉？　　妊妇临明感少阴经证，恶心腹痛，手足厥逆者不治。亦以寒入肾官，上侵于心，不独下侵于腹已也，较上证更重。夫肾水滋心，何以反至克心？盖肾之真水，心借之养；肾之邪水，心得之亡。[130p]

One dose disperses the cold, and the patient no longer fears the cold; a second dose warms the hands and feet, and the patient no longer curls up in bed; a third dose leads to recovery. Ginseng and white atractylodes are used to stabilize the Qi. Cinnamon and dried ginger, though they disperse the cold, are best used during pregnancy without concern for miscarriage. However, these two flavors are quite potent, thus licorice is used to harmonize them. This way, they simply expel the cold from the abdomen without affecting the fetus, assisting ginseng and white atractylodes in purging and bringing about exceptional results. Is it not hasty to use them excessively?

Pregnant women experiencing symptoms of the Shao Yin channel such as nausea, abdominal pain, and cold extremities should not be treated. This is due to cold entering the kidney, ascending to the heart, and not merely descending to the abdomen, which presents a more severe condition. The water of the kidneys nourishes the heart; how can it simultaneously harm the heart? The true water of the kidneys nourishes the heart, while the pathogenic water from the kidneys harms it.[130p]

今肾感寒邪，挟肾水而上凌于心，故心腹两相作痛，手足一齐厥逆，此候至急至危，将何术以救之？亦驱其少阴之邪而已。方用回阳救产汤，人参、当归各一两，肉桂、干姜、甘草各一钱，白朮五钱，水煎服。此方妙在加当归。盖少阴之邪，敢上侵于心者，欺心中之无血也。用当归以补血，助人参之力以援心，则心中有养，而肉桂、干姜，无非袪寒荡邪之品；况又有白朮、甘草之利腰脐而调心腹乎？自然痛止而逆除矣。[131p]

Now the kidneys are affected by cold pathogens, causing kidney water to rise and invade the heart, resulting in pain in both the heart and abdomen and simultaneous reversal in the hands and feet. This condition is urgent and critical; what method shall we use to save it? It is merely to drive away the evil of the Lesser Yin.

The formula is "Returning Yang to Rescue the Birth Decoction," consisting of one tael each of ginseng and angelica, one qian each of cinnamon, dried ginger, and licorice, and five qians of white atractylodes, to be decocted in water and taken.

The cleverness of this formula lies in the addition of angelica. Indeed, the evil of the Lesser Yin dares to invade the heart by taking advantage of the lack of blood within it. Using angelica to tonify the blood supports the strength of ginseng to aid the heart, allowing the heart to be nourished. Meanwhile, cinnamon and dried ginger are simply used to dispel cold and eliminate pathogens. Furthermore, with the benefits of white atractylodes and licorice to regulate the heart and abdomen, this naturally stops the pain and resolves the reversal.[131p]

仲景谓子生则可治，用独参汤以救之，亦救之于生子之后，而非救之于未生子之前也。子未生之前，当急用回阳救产汤；子既生之后，当急用仲景方。　　妊娠临月，忽感少阴证者，急以人参、白朮大剂温之，不应则死，此仲景之文也。似乎舍人参、白朮无可救之药矣。吾以为单用人参、白朮，尚非万全。苟用人参、白朮不应，急加入附子、肉桂、干姜，未必不应如响也。今定一方名全生救难汤，人参、白朮各乙两，附子一钱，甘草五分，水煎服。凡感少阴经之邪者，用此神效。[132p]

Zhongjing said that if a child is born, it can be treated with the Ren Shen Decoction to save it, but it is also effective after the child is born, not before the child is born. Prior to the child's birth, one should urgently use the Revival of Yang Decoction; after the child is born, one should urgently use Zhongjing's formula.

If a pregnant woman is about to give birth and suddenly feels symptoms of the Shaoyin channel, she should urgently use a large dose of Ren Shen and Bai Zhu to warm her; if it does not respond, it may lead to death, as stated in Zhongjing's texts. It seems that without Ren Shen and Bai Zhu, there are no other effective medicines. I believe that using only Ren Shen and Bai Zhu may not be completely reliable. If they do not respond, one should urgently add Fu Zi, Rou Gui, and Gan Jiang; it may well respond immediately.

Now, I have established a formula called the Complete Lifesaving Decoction: 2 taels of Ren Shen, 2 taels of Bai Zhu, 1 qian of Fu Zi, 5 fen of Gan Cao, brewed in water for consumption. For any illness caused by the Shaoyin channel, this formula has miraculous effects.[132p]

　　　　方

　　四物汤　治妇人胎产诸疾，多用此汤加减。　　熟地　川芎　芍药　当归分两加减法详后　　右(口父)咀水煎服。加减法，妊娠腹痛下血，胎动不安，或半产恶露过多，或停留不出，四物汤加茱萸煎服。若人阳脏，少使茱萸；阴脏，多使茱萸。妊娠胎动不安，下血不止者，四物汤加艾十叶、阿胶一片，或加葱白、黄芪，或每服加艾叶五七片，更加葱白、阿胶末减四味之半，当归用小半。如疾势甚者，以四味各半两细銼，以水四盏，熟艾一块如鸡子大，阿胶五七片，煎至二盏半，分作四服，一日令尽。或加粉甘草、干姜、黄芪，日二三服，至二腊。以一七日为一腊。妊娠心烦，四物汤加竹茹一块。[133p]

Fang

Four Substance Decoction: This is used to treat various ailments in women related to pregnancy and childbirth. Frequently, this decoction is adjusted based on individual needs. The ingredients include Rehmannia, Chuanxiong, Peony, and Dong Quai, with specifics on adding and reducing later.

The right side (口父) indicates to take it as a decoction after grinding. For adjustments: if there is abdominal pain during pregnancy with bleeding, fetal movement is unsettled, or postpartum issues such as excessive lochia or retention, the Four Substance Decoction should be supplemented with dried evodia. If the patient has excess Yang, use less dried evodia; if Yang is deficient, use more.

For unsettled fetal movement with persistent bleeding during pregnancy, the Four Substance Decoction should be combined with ten leaves of mugwort, one slice of donkey-hide gelatin, or include scallions and astragalus. Alternatively, add five to seven leaves of mugwort during each dose, along with scallions and half the amount of donkey-hide gelatin, using a smaller half dose of Dong Quai.

In severe cases, grind all four ingredients down to evenly sized pieces, using four cups of water, a piece of dried mugwort the size of a chicken egg, and five to seven slices of donkey-hide gelatin. Boil until down to two and a half cups, dividing it into four doses to be taken within a day. You can also add powdered licorice, dried ginger, and astragalus, taking two to three doses daily, until the second lunar month, treating one week as a lunar period.

If there is restlessness during pregnancy, add a piece of bamboo shavings to the Four Substance Decoction.[133p]

妊娠作恶，生寒面青，不思饮食，憔悴，四物汤加陈皮、枳壳、白朮、茯苓、甘草。损胎下血不止，头痛寒热耳鸣，气血劳伤所致，四物汤加黄芩、荆芥、生地黄、赤芍药、生姜。胎动漏血不止，四物汤加黄芪、侧柏、阿胶、甘草、续断。安胎及胎漏下血，四物汤加阿胶、大艾、甘草、蒲黄炒过。受胎小肠气痛，四物汤加木香、茴香。妊娠咳嗽，四物汤加枳壳、甘草、(艹款)冬花、知母、马兜铃、半夏、木通、葶藤、人参、桔梗、麦门冬。胎气冲肝，腰脚痹软，行步艰难，四物汤加枳壳，木通、甘草、连翘、荆芥、地黄、羌活、独活、山栀子、灯心，空心服。妇人胎前，四物汤每日可一二服。胎前痢后风，四物汤加乳香、龙骨、茱萸、木香、肉桂、苍朮、牡丹皮、白薇、人参，甘草、泽兰、大椒、茴香。[134p]

During pregnancy, if there is a tendency for evil influences, causing a cold face and a pallor, with no desire for food, resulting in emaciation, one may take a decoction of Four Substance Soup with dried tangerine peel, bitter orange, white atractylodes, poria, and licorice.

If there is damage to the fetus leading to persistent bleeding, headache, alternating chills and fever, and tinnitus due to exhaustion of qi and blood, one should take Four Substance Soup with scutellaria, schizonepeta, raw rehmannia, red peony, and ginger.

If fetal movement is accompanied by continuous bleeding, one can take Four Substance Soup with astragalus, cedar, ejiao, licorice, and dang gui.

For calming the fetus and managing bleeding, add ejiao, mugwort, licorice, and prepared pollen to Four Substance Soup.

In cases of small intestine qi pain during conception, Four Substance Soup can be supplemented with musk and fennel.

For coughing during pregnancy, add bitter orange, licorice, winter flower, anemarrhena, aristolochia, pinellia, mutong, vine, ginseng, platycodon, and ophiopogon to Four Substance Soup.

If fetal qi conflicts with the liver, causing weakness in the waist and legs, making movement difficult, use Four Substance Soup with bitter orange, mutong, licorice, forsythia, schizonepeta, rehmannia, dhaturo, and gardenia, to be taken on an empty stomach.

For women before giving birth, Four Substance Soup can be taken once or twice daily.

If there is dysentery after labor, accompanied by wind, one can use Four Substance Soup with frankincense, dragon bone, evodia, musk, cinnamon, white atractylodes, peony bark, white snail, ginseng, licorice, saussurea, and fennel.[134p]

　　胶艾汤　一名芎归胶艾汤。治妊娠腹痛，胞阻胎漏，半产后下血不绝，及八九月内胎动下血。　　芎藭　炒阿胶　炙甘草各二两　炒艾叶　当归各三两　白芍药四两　干地黄　　右七味，以水五升，清酒三升，合煮取三升，去滓，内胶令消尽，温服一升，日三服。或每服半两，水煎方可。一方加干姜一两。胡洽治妇人胎动，无干姜。一方有黄芪。
　　当归散　妊娠常服即易产。胎无苦疾，产后百病，气血虚弱，恶露内停，憎寒发热悉主之。素惯半产者，宜服以清其源，斯无后患。　　当归身　黄芩酒炒　白芍药　芎藭各一斤　白朮半斤　　右杵为散，酒饮服方寸匕，日再服。或酒糊和丸，米饮下五七十丸。一方当归、白芍、川芎、黄芩各一两，白朮五钱为末，童便调下二钱。[135p]

Jiao Ai Decoction, also known as Qiong Gui Jiao Ai Decoction. It is used to treat abdominal pain during pregnancy, obstruction of the womb and fetal leakage, continued bleeding after childbirth, and hemorrhage in the eighth or ninth month. The ingredients are:

  • Chuanxiong
  • Fried Ejiao
  • Honey-fried Licorice, each 2 taels
  • Fried Ai Ye
  • Dang Gui, each 3 taels
  • Bai Shao Yao, 4 taels
  • Dry Di Huang.

Combine these seven ingredients with 5 sheng of water and 3 sheng of clear rice wine, boil down to 3 sheng, strain out the dregs, and dissolve the Ejiao in the mixture. Warm the decoction and take 1 sheng, three times a day. Alternatively, take half a tael each time, boiled in water. One variation adds 1 tael of dried ginger. Hu Qia suggests a formula for fetal movement in women without dried ginger. Another variation includes Huang Qi.

Dang Gui Powder is taken regularly during pregnancy to facilitate childbirth. It addresses any pain in the fetus, postpartum ailments, weakened qi and blood, stagnant lochia, and symptoms of cold and fever. For those who are prone to complications during childbirth, regular consumption is advisable to clear the source of these issues, preventing future problems.

The ingredients consist of:

  • Dang Gui (main)
  • Huang Qin, stir-fried with wine
  • Bai Shao Yao
  • Chuanxiong, each 1 jin
  • Bai Zhu, 0.5 jin.

Crush these into a powder, mix with wine, and take a spoonful twice daily. Alternatively, mix with wine to form pills, taking 50 to 70 pills with rice drink. Another version includes 1 tael each of Dang Gui, Bai Shao, Chuanxiong, and Huang Qin, with 5 qian of Bai Zhu, ground into a powder, and mixed with 2 qian of child's urine for ingestion.[135p]

　　白朮散　妊娠养胎。
　　白朮　芎藭各一两　蜀椒七钱，去汗　牡蛎半两　　右杵为散，酒服一钱匕，日三服，夜一服。但苦痛，加芍药；心下毒痛，倍加芎藭；心烦吐痛不能食饮，加细辛一两，半夏大者二十枚服之。后更以酢浆水服之，若以酢浆服之复不解者，小麦汁服之。已后渴者，大麦粥服之。病虽愈，服之勿置。
　　桂枝茯苓丸　治妇人宿有症病，而孕胎及三月，而漏血不止，胎动在脐上者。　　桂枝　茯苓　牡丹　桃仁去皮尖熬　芍药　　右五味各等分末之，炼蜜和丸如兔屎大，每日食前服一丸。不知，加至三丸。此方丹溪极称妙。
　　旋覆花汤 【《千金方》，下同】 　治妇人见革脉，半产漏下。　　旋覆花三两　葱十四茎　新绛少许
　　右三味，以水三升，煮取一升，顿服之。[136p]

Bai Zhu Powder: For nourishing the fetus during pregnancy.
Bai Zhu and Xiong Huang, each one liang; Shu Jiao, seven qian, remove sweat; Mu Li, half a liang. Grind these into a powder. Take one qian with wine, three times a day, and once at night. If there is bitter pain, add Shao Yao; if there is toxic pain under the heart, double the amount of Xiong Huang; if there is irritability with vomiting and inability to eat or drink, add one liang of Xi Xin and twenty large Ban Xia. Afterward, take it with vinegar water. If the vinegar water does not resolve the issue, take with wheat juice. If you feel thirsty afterward, take barley porridge. Even after recovery, continue taking.
