Gui Zhi Fu Ling Pill: For women with lingering symptoms during pregnancy, particularly those experiencing continuous bleeding and fetal movement above the navel within the first three months.
Gui Zhi, Fu Ling, Mu Dan, peach kernel (skin and tip removed), and Shao Yao—grind these five ingredients into equal portions. Refine with honey to form pills the size of rabbit droppings. Take one pill before each meal. If the condition is unknown, increase to three pills. This prescription is highly praised by Dan Xi.

Xuan Fu Hua Decoction (from the "Thousand Gold Formula", same hereafter): For women who experience abnormal pulses and leaking after childbirth.
Three liang of Xuan Fu Hua, fourteen stalks of scallion, and a small amount of Xin Jiang.
Boil these three ingredients in three sheng of water to reduce it to one sheng, and take it in one dose.[136p]

　　丹参圆　治妇人始觉有娠，养胎并转女为男。　　丹参　续断　芍药　白胶　白朮　柏子仁　甘草各二两　人参　川芎　干姜各三十铢　吴茱萸　橘皮　当归各一两十八铢　白芷　冠缨灰各一两　干地黄一两半　芜荑十八铢　犬卵一具，干　东门上雄鸡头一枚　　右为细末，炼蜜丸如梧子大，酒服十丸，日再服，稍加至二十丸。
　　橘皮汤　治妊娠呕吐不下食。
　　橘皮　竹茹　人参　白朮土炒，各十八铢　生姜一两　厚朴十二铢　　右(口父)咀，以水七升，煮取二升半，分三服，不瘥重作。
　　乌雌鸡汤　治妊娠一月，寒多为痛，热多卒惊，举重腰痛，腹满胞急，卒有所下。　　乌雌鸡一只，治如食法　茯苓　阿胶各二两　吴茱萸一升　麦门冬五合　人参　芍药　白朮各三两　甘草　生姜各一两　　右(口父)咀，以水一斗二升煮鸡，取汁六升，去鸡下药，煎取三升，内酒三升，并胶烊尽，取三升放温，每服一升，日三服。[137p]

Dan Shen Yuan: This treats women who begin to feel pregnant, nurturing the fetus and transforming a female child into a male. Ingredients: Dan Shen, Xu Duan, Shao Yao, Bai Jiao, Bai Zhu, Bai Zi Ren, Gan Cao - each 2 taels; Ren Shen, Chuan Xiong, Gan Jiang - each 30 zhú; Wu Zhu Yu, Ju Pi, Dang Gui - each 1 tael 18 zhús; Bai Zhi, Guan Ying Hui - each 1 tael; Gan Di Huang 1.5 taels; Wu Yi 18 zhús; a dog’s egg one; a male chicken head from the east gate one. Grind to a fine powder, mix with honey to form pills the size of a walnut. Take 10 pills with wine, twice daily, gradually increasing to 20 pills.

Ju Pi Tang: This treats vomiting during pregnancy that prevents eating. Ingredients: Ju Pi, Zhu Ru, Ren Shen, Bai Zhu (stir-fried), each 18 zhús; Sheng Jiang 1 tael; Hou Po 12 zhús. Grind, take 7 sheng of water, boil to get 2.5 sheng, divide into three doses; if it does not improve, repeat.

Wu Ci Ji Tang: This treats abdominal pain from cold during the first month of pregnancy, severe heat causing sudden shock, heavy lifting causing lower back pain, abdominal fullness, and urgent contractions. Ingredients: One female black chicken treated as food; Fu Ling, E Jiao - each 2 taels; Wu Zhu Yu 1 sheng; Mai Men Dong 5 he; Ren Shen, Shao Yao, Bai Zhu - each 3 taels; Gan Cao, Sheng Jiang - each 1 tael. Grind, use 12 sheng of water to boil the chicken, extract 6 sheng of liquid, remove the chicken, add the herbs, boil to obtain 3 sheng, dissolve 3 sheng of wine and E Jiao, and take 3 sheng warm, 1 sheng three times a day.[137p]

　　补胎汤　妊娠曾伤一月胎者，当预服此药。　　细辛一两　防风二两　干地黄　白朮各二两　生姜四两　吴茱萸　大麦各五合　乌梅一升　　右(口父)咀，以水七升，煮取二升，分三服，先食后服。右方寒多者，倍细辛、茱萸；热多渴者去之，加(艹舌)蒌根二两。若有所思，去大麦加柏子仁三合。一方有人参一两。
　　艾叶汤　治妊娠二月，阴阳踞经，有寒多胚不成，有热即萎，卒中风寒，有所动摇，心满脐下悬急，腰背强痛，卒有所下，乍寒乍热。　　艾叶　丹参　当归　麻黄各二两　生姜六两　人参　阿胶各三两　甘草四分　大枣十二枚　　右(口父)咀，以酒三升，水一斗，煮减半去滓，内胶煎取三升，分三服。[138p]

Bump Tire Decoction: For those who have experienced a miscarriage in the first month of pregnancy, this medicine should be taken in advance.

  • Xi Xin (Asarum) 1 tael
  • Fang Feng (Siler) 2 taels
  • Gan Di Huang (Rehmannia) 2 taels
  • Bai Zhu (Atractylodes) 2 taels
  • Sheng Jiang (Fresh Ginger) 4 taels
  • Wu Zhu Yu (Evodia) 5 hyoscyamus
  • Da Mai (Barley) 5 hyoscyamus
  • Wu Mei (Mume) 1 sheng

Prepare by grinding the above ingredients and boil with 7 sheng of water to obtain 2 sheng. Divide into three doses, taking it after eating. If there is excess cold, double the Xi Xin and Wu Zhu Yu; if there is a lot of heat or thirst, omit them and add 2 taels of Lu Gen (Reed Root). If there is any concern, remove the barley and add 3 hyoscyamus of Bai Zi Ren (Platycladus Seed). One recipe includes 1 tael of Ren Shen (Ginseng).

Mugwort Decoction: Treats those in the second month of pregnancy where there is a blockage of Yin and Yang, with significant cold leading to miscarriage, or heat causing withering; sudden onset of wind-cold can lead to movement, causing fullness in the heart with urgent pain below the navel, strong pain in the waist and back, sudden chills and heat.

  • Ai Ye (Mugwort) 2 taels
  • Dan Shen (Salvia) 2 taels
  • Dang Gui (Angelica) 2 taels
  • Ma Huang (Ephedra) 2 taels
  • Sheng Jiang (Fresh Ginger) 6 taels
  • Ren Shen (Ginseng) 3 taels
  • E Jiao (Donkey-hide Gelatin) 3 taels
  • Gan Cao (Licorice) 4 fen
  • Da Zao (Jujube) 12 pieces

Prepare by grinding the ingredients, then boil with 3 sheng of wine and 1 dou of water, reducing to half and straining. Dissolve the gelatin and take the remaining 3 sheng divided into three doses.[138p]

　　黄连汤　妊娠曾伤二月胎者，当预服此药。　　黄连　人参各一两　吴茱萸五合　生姜三两　生地黄五两　　右(口父)咀，以酢浆七升，煮取三升，分四服，日三夜一，十日一修合。若颇觉不安，加乌梅一升，则不用浆，直用水煎服。一方用当归半两。一方用阿胶。
　　雄鸡方　治妊娠三月为定形，有寒大便青，有热小便难，不赤即黄，卒惊恐忧愁嗔怒喜顿仆，动于经脉，腹满绕脐苦痛，或腰背痛，卒有所下。　　雄鸡一只，治如食法　芍药四两　黄芩　白朮　生姜各一两　麦冬五合　大枣十二枚　甘草　人参　茯苓　阿胶各二两　　右(口父)咀，以水一斗三升煮鸡，减半出鸡，内药煮取半，内清酒三升，并胶煎取三升，分三服，一日令尽，当温卧。一方用当归、川芎各二两，无黄芩、生姜。[139p]

Huanglian Decoction
For those who have previously hurt a two-month fetus during pregnancy, this medicine should be taken in advance.
Huanglian: 1 liang
Ren Shen: 1 liang
Wuzhuyu: 5 he
Shengjiang: 3 liang
Sheng Dihuang: 5 liang
Mince the above (all ingredients), use 7 sheng of vinegar to boil and extract 3 sheng, divide into four doses, taking three times a day and once at night, for ten days for continuous use. If feeling unsettled, add 1 sheng of Wumei, then do not use vinegar but simply boil with water. An alternative prescription uses 0.5 liang of Donggui, and another uses Ejiao.

Rooster Decoction
For stabilizing a pregnancy at three months, it treats cold with dark stools and heat with difficult urination; if not red then yellow, sudden fright, anxiety, anger, happiness, and fainting; moving within the meridians, fullness in the abdomen with pain around the navel, or back pain with sudden expulsion.
One rooster, prepared like food,
Shaoyao: 4 liang
Huangqin, Baizhu, Shengjiang: each 1 liang
Maidong: 5 he
Dazao: 12 pieces
Gancao, Ren Shen, Fuling, Ejiao: each 2 liang
Mince the above, boil the chicken in 13 sheng of water, reduce by half, extract half the liquid with the medicine, add 3 sheng of clear wine, and simmer to extract another 3 sheng, divide into three doses to finish in one day, and rest warmly. One alternative uses 2 liang each of Donggui and Chuanxiong, omitting Huangqin and Shengjiang.[139p]

　　茯神汤　妊娠曾伤三月胎者，当预服此药。　　茯神　丹参　龙骨各一两　阿胶　当归　甘草　人参各二两　大枣　赤小豆各二十一枚　　右(口父)咀，以酢浆一斗，煮取三升，分四服，先食服，七日后服一剂。一方有薤白二两，麻子一升。若腰痛者，如桑寄生二两。
　　菊花汤　治妊娠四月有寒，心下温温欲呕，胸膈满不欲食，有热小便难，数数如淋状，脐下苦急，卒风寒，颈项强痛，寒热，或惊动身躯，腰背腹痛，往来有时，胎上迫胸，心烦不得安，卒有所下。　　菊花鸡子大一枚　麦门冬一升　大枣十二枚　人参一两半　甘草　当归各二两　麻黄　阿胶各三两　半夏四两　生姜五两　　右(口父)咀，以水八升，煮减半，内清酒三升，并胶煎取三升，分二服，温卧。当汗，以粉粉之，护风寒四五日。一方用乌雌鸡一只，煮水煎药。[140p]

Fuzhen Decoction: For those who have previously suffered a miscarriage at three months during pregnancy, this medicine should be taken in advance. Ingredients: Fuzhen (1 tael), Danshen (1 tael), Longgu (1 tael) each, Ejiao (2 taels), Danggui (2 taels), Gancao (2 taels), Renshen (2 taels), Dazao (21 pieces), Chixiaodou (21 pieces). Prepare by grinding, using one dou of vinegar, boil down to three sheng, divide into four doses, take before meals, and after seven days, take one dose. Another formula includes 2 taels of Xiebai and 1 sheng of Mazi. If there is lower back pain, add 2 taels of Sangjisheng.

Chrysanthemum Decoction: Treats cold in the fourth month of pregnancy, with a warm feeling under the heart, a desire to vomit, fullness in the chest with no appetite, difficulty urinating with heat, frequent discomfort resembling painful urination, bitterness and urgency below the navel, sudden wind-cold with stiff neck and pain, alternating chills and fever, or unexpected bodily agitation, along with back and abdominal pain at times, and pressure from the fetus on the chest, causing anxiety without rest. Ingredients: One large egg of chrysanthemum, 1 sheng of Mai Men Dong, 12 Dazao, 1.5 taels of Renshen, 2 taels each of Gancao and Danggui, 3 taels each of Mahuang and Ejiao, 4 taels of Banxia, 5 taels of fresh ginger. Prepare by grinding and using 8 sheng of water, boil down to half, add 3 sheng of clear wine and extract 3 sheng with the gelatin, divide into two doses, and take warm. If sweating, dust with powder to ward off wind and cold for four to five days. Another formula includes one black hen, boil it to prepare the medicine.[140p]

　　调中汤　妊娠曾伤四月胎者，当预服此药。　　白芍药　生姜各四两　厚朴　枳实　白朮　生李根白皮　柴胡各二两　续断　芎藭　甘草各一两　当归一两半　乌梅一升　　右(口父)咀，以水一斗，煮取三升，分四服，日三夜一。八日后，复服一剂。
　　阿胶汤　治妊娠五月有热苦头眩心乱呕吐，有寒苦腹满痛小便数，卒有恐怖，四肢疼痛，寒热，胎动无常处，腹痛闷顿欲仆，卒有所下。　　阿胶四两　人参一两　生姜六两　当归　芍药　甘草　黄芩各二两　旋覆花二合　吴茱萸七合　麦门冬二升　　右(口父)咀，以水九升煮药，减半内清酒三升，并胶微火煎取三升半，分四服，日三夜一。先食服便愈。不瘥再服。[141p]

Tiaozhong Decoction: For those who have had a miscarriage in the fourth month of pregnancy, this medicine should be taken in advance. Ingredients include: four liang each of white peony and fresh ginger; two liang each of magnolia bark, bitter orange, white atractylodes, and fresh plum root white skin; two liang of bupleurum; one liang each of china root, angelica, and licorice; one and a half liang of angelica; and one sheng of black plum. Chop the ingredients, boil with ten dou of water until reduced to three sheng, and divide into four doses, to be taken three times during the day and once at night. After eight days, take another dose.

Ejiao Decoction: For treating symptoms in the fifth month of pregnancy including heat, bitter headaches, dizziness, chaotic heart, nausea, abdominal fullness and pain, frequent urination, sudden fear, limb pain, alternating cold and heat, foetal movement abnormalities, abdominal pain leading to collapse, and sudden discharge. Ingredients include: four liang of ejiao, one liang of ginseng, six liang of fresh ginger, two liang each of angelica, white peony, licorice, and scutellaria; two he of reversed flower; seven he of evodia; and two sheng of ophiopogon. Chop the ingredients, boil with nine sheng of water, reduce by half, add three sheng of clear wine, and simmer ejiao over low heat to yield three and a half sheng. Divide this into four doses, to be taken three times during the day and once at night. Take this after food for recovery. If not healed, take again.[141p]

　　安中汤　妊娠曾伤五月胎者，当预服此药。　　生姜六两　黄芩一两　当归　芎藭　干地黄　人参各二两　甘草　芍药各三两　五味子　大麻仁各五合　麦门冬一升　大枣三十五枚　　右(口父)咀，以水七升，清酒五升，煮取三升半，分四服，日三夜一。七日复服一剂。
　　麦门冬汤　治妊娠六月，卒有所动不安，寒热往来，腹内胀满，身体肿惊怖，忽有所下，腹痛如欲产，手足烦疼。　　麦门冬二升　人参　甘草　黄芩各二两　生地三两　阿胶四两　生姜六两　大枣十五枚　　右(口父)咀，以水七升，煮减半，内清酒二升，并胶煎取三升，分三服，中间进糜粥。一方用乌雌鸡一只，煮水以煎药。[142p]

Anzhong Decoction
For those who have suffered an injury to the fetus during the fifth month of pregnancy, this medicine should be prepared in advance.

  • Ginger: 6 taels
  • Huangqin (Scutellaria): 1 tael
  • Danggui (Angelica): 2 taels
  • Chuanxiong (Szechuan Lovage): 2 taels
  • Gan dihuang (Rehmannia): 2 taels
  • Ren Shen (Ginseng): 2 taels
  • Gan Cao (Licorice): 3 taels
  • Shaoyao (Paeonia): 3 taels
  • Wumeizi (Schisandra): 5 he
  • Dama Ren (Hemp seed): 5 he
  • Maidong (Ophiopogon): 1 sheng
  • Da Zao (Jujube): 35 pieces

Crush the ingredients above and add 7 sheng of water and 5 sheng of clear wine. Boil to obtain 3.5 sheng, dividing into four doses, taking three during the day and one at night. Repeat after seven days.

Maidong Decoction
For treating pregnancy at six months, when there is sudden anxiety due to movement, alternating cold and heat, abdominal distension, body swelling with fright, sudden discharge, abdominal pain as if about to give birth, and pain in hands and feet.

  • Maidong (Ophiopogon): 2 sheng
  • Ren Shen (Ginseng): 2 taels
  • Gan Cao (Licorice): 2 taels
  • Huangqin (Scutellaria): 2 taels
  • Sheng di (Raw Rehmannia): 3 taels
  • Ejiao (Donkey-hide gelatin): 4 taels
  • Ginger: 6 taels
  • Da Zao (Jujube): 15 pieces

Crush these ingredients and add 7 sheng of water, boil down to half, then add 2 sheng of clear wine and decoct the gelatin to obtain 3 sheng, dividing into three doses, taking porridge in between. Alternatively, use one black hen to boil water for decocting the medicine.[142p]

　　柴胡汤　妊娠曾伤六月胎者，当预服此药。　　柴胡四两　苁蓉一两　白朮　芍药一作紫葳　甘草　麦门冬　芎藭各二两　生姜六两　干地黄五两　大枣三十枚　　右(口父)咀，以水一斗，煮取三升，分四服，日三夜一，中间进糜粥。勿食生冷及坚鞕之物。七日更服一剂。
　　葱白汤　治妊娠七月，忽惊恐摇动腹痛，卒有所下，手足厥冷，脉若微寒，烦热腹满短气，常苦颈项及腰背强。　　葱白长三四寸，十四茎　半夏　麦门冬各一升　旋覆花二合　黄芩一两　人参一两半　甘草　当归　黄芪各三两　坷胶四两　生姜八两　　右十一味，以水二升，煮减半，内清酒三升及胶，煎取四升，每服一升，日三夜一。温卧当汗出，若不出者，加麻黄一两，煮服如前法。若秋后勿强渍汗。一方以黄雌鸡一只割咽取血内酒中，煮鸡取汁以煎药。[143p]

Chai Hu Decoction: For those who have suffered injury to a six-month fetus during pregnancy, this medicine should be taken in advance.

  • Chai Hu: 4 taels
  • Cistanche: 1 tael
  • Bai Zhu: 2 taels
  • Shao Yao (or Ziwai): 2 taels
  • Gan Cao: 2 taels
  • Mai Men Dong: 2 taels
  • Xiong Huang: 2 taels
  • Sheng Jiang: 6 taels
  • Gan Di Huang: 5 taels
  • Da Zao: 30 pieces

Mix the above ingredients and grind, using 10 liters of water, boil to obtain 3 sheng, divide into four doses, take three times during the day and once at night, and in between consume millet porridge. Avoid eating raw, cold, or hard foods. After seven days, take another dose.

Scallion White Decoction: Treats sudden scares, shaking, abdominal pain, unexpected discharge, cold hands and feet, weak pulse, feelings of heat and abdominal fullness, shortness of breath, often suffering from stiff neck and lower back during the seventh month of pregnancy.

  • Scallion white (3-4 inches long): 14 stalks
  • Ban Xia: 1 sheng
  • Mai Men Dong: 1 sheng
  • Xuan Fu Hua: 2 he
  • Huang Qin: 1 tael
  • Ren Shen: 1.5 taels
  • Gan Cao: 3 taels
  • Dang Gui: 3 taels
  • Huang Qi: 3 taels
  • Ke Jiao: 4 taels
  • Sheng Jiang: 8 taels

Combine the eleven ingredients with 2 sheng of water, boil down to half, add 3 sheng of clear wine and gelatin, decoct to obtain 4 sheng, each dose is 1 sheng, taken three times during the day and once at night. Stay warm and allow sweating; if sweating does not occur, add 1 tael of Ma Huang and cook as previously directed. Avoid forcing sweat in autumn. Another method involves taking the blood of a yellow hen after slicing its throat, putting it in wine, then cooking the hen to extract the juice for decoction.[143p]

　　杏仁汤　妊娠曾伤七月胎者，当预服此药。　　杏仁　甘草各二两　麦门冬　吴茱萸各一升　紫菀一两　锺乳　干姜各二两　粳米五合　五味子三合　　右(口父)咀，以水八升，煮取三升半，分四服，日三夜一。中间进食，七日服一剂。一方用白鸡一只，煮汁煎药。
　　芍药汤　治妊娠八月中风寒，有所犯触，身体尽痛，乍寒乍热，动不安常，苦头眩痛绕脐下寒，时时小便白如米汁，或青或黄，或作寒栗，腰背苦冷而痛，目(目巟)(目巟)。　　芍药四两　生姜六两　厚朴二两　甘草　当归　白朮　人参各三两　薤白切，一升　　右(口父)咀，以水五升，清酒四升合煮，取三升，分作三服，日再夜一。一方用乌雌鸡煮汁以煎药。[144p]

Almond Soup: For those who have had a miscarriage at seven months, this medicine should be taken in advance. Ingredients: Almonds and Licorice, each 2 taels; Ophiopogon and Evodia, each 1 sheng; Aster, 1 tael; Cow Milk, Ginger, each 2 taels; Long-grain Rice, 5 he; Schisandra, 3 he. Prepare by grinding the above, boil with 8 sheng of water until you obtain 3.5 sheng, divided into four doses, three times a day and one at night. Take between meals, for seven days one dose. One alternative method is to boil the juice of one white chicken to prepare the medicine.

Peony Soup: For treating wind-cold in the eighth month of pregnancy, after an incident, with the whole body in pain, alternating between cold and heat, unable to be still, bitter head pain circling below the navel, frequent urination that is white like rice juice, or blue or yellow, or experiencing chills, with low back pain and cold, distorted vision. Ingredients: Peony 4 taels, Fresh Ginger 6 taels, Magnolia Bark 2 taels, Licorice, Angelica, Atractylodes, Ginseng, each 3 taels, Chives cut, 1 sheng. Prepare by grinding the above, boil with 5 sheng of water and 4 sheng of clear wine, obtaining 3 sheng, divided into three doses, twice a day and once at night. One alternative method is to boil the juice of one black hen to prepare the medicine.[144p]

　　葵子汤　妊娠曾伤八月胎者，当预服此药。　　葵子二升　大枣二十枚　甘草　厚朴各二两　白朮　柴胡各三两　芍药四两　生姜六两　　右八味，以水九升，煮取三升，分三服，日三，凡十日一剂。一方用乌雌鸡一只，煮水以煎药。
　　半夏汤　治妊娠九月，卒得下痢，腹满悬急，胎上冲心，腰背痛，不可转侧，短气。　　半夏三两　大枣二十枚　麦门冬　吴茱萸　当归　阿胶各二两　干姜一两　　右(口父)咀，以水九升，煮取三升，去滓，内白蜜八合，微火上温服，四服痢即止。一方用乌雌鸡一只，煮汁煎药。

Kuaizi Decoction: For those who have suffered from an injury to the fetus at eight months of pregnancy, this medicine should be taken as a precaution.

Ingredients:

  • Kuaizi (Sunflower seeds) 2 sheng
  • Red dates 20 pieces
  • Licorice, Magnolia bark each 2 liang
  • White Atractylodes, Bupleurum each 3 liang
  • Peony 4 liang
  • Fresh ginger 6 liang

Preparation: Combine the above eight ingredients with 9 sheng of water, boil down to 3 sheng, and divide into three doses to be taken three times a day for a total of ten days. One variation includes using a black hen, boiling it to prepare the medicine.

Banxia Decoction: Treats nine months of pregnancy, when suddenly experiencing diarrhea, a feeling of fullness and urgency in the abdomen, the fetus pushing upwards against the heart, back pain, difficulty turning, and shortness of breath.

Ingredients:

  • Banxia 3 liang
  • Red dates 20 pieces
  • Ophiopogon, Wu Zhu Yu, Dong Quai, and Ejiao each 2 liang
  • Dried ginger 1 liang

Preparation: Crush the above ingredients, combine with 9 sheng of water, boil down to 3 sheng, remove the dregs, add 8 he of white honey, and warm gently; take four doses and the diarrhea will stop. One variation includes using a black hen to prepare the broth for the medicine.

Pig Kidney Decoction: For those who have suffered from an injury to the fetus at nine months of pregnancy, this medicine should be taken as a precaution.

Ingredients:

  • One pig kidney
  • Poria, Mulberry parasite, dried ginger, dried Rehmannia, and Chuanxiong each 3 liang
  • White Atractylodes 4 liang
  • One piece of prepared Aconite
  • 3 he of soybeans
  • 2 sheng of Ophiopogon

Preparation: Crush the above ingredients and boil the kidney in 10 dou of water until cooked. Remove the kidney and all drugs inside, then simmer to obtain 3.5 sheng, and divide into four doses to be taken three times day and once at night. Prepare another dose every ten days.[145p]

　　丹参膏　此膏养胎，临月服之，滑而易产。　　丹参半斤　芎藭　当归各二两　蜀椒五合　　右四味，以清酒溲湿，停一宿，以煎成猪膏四升，微火煎，膏色赤如血，膏成新布绞去滓，每日取枣许，内酒中服之。不可逆服，至临月乃可服，旧用常验。一方：有热者，以大麻仁五合代蜀椒。
　　甘草散　令子易生，母无疾病。未生一月日预服，过三十日，行步动作如故，儿生堕地，皆不自觉。　　甘草一两　黄芩　干姜　吴茱萸　大豆黄卷　麻子仁　桂心　大麦芽各三两　　右为细末，酒服方寸匕，日三服；暖水服亦得。一方用糯米不用麦芽，一方用茯苓不用黄芩。
　　阿胶散 【《准绳》，下同】 　治妊娠或因顿仆胎动不安，腰痛腹满，或有所下，或胎上抢心。　　熟地黄二两　白芍药　艾叶　当归　甘草　阿胶　黄芪各一两　　右(口父)咀，每服半两，姜三片，枣一枚，水煎。一方有川芎。[146p]

Dan Shen Paste: This paste nurtures the fetus. It is taken in the last month of pregnancy, facilitating smooth delivery. Ingredients: 0.5 jin of Dan Shen, 0.2 jin each of Chuanxiong and Danggui, 0.5 sheng of Shu Pepper. Prepare the four ingredients by soaking them in clear wine overnight, then boil them down to yield four sheng of pig fat over low heat. The fat should be a deep red color. Once it is done, strain it through a new cloth; take a portion daily the size of a jujube and mix it with wine to consume. It should not be taken backwards, only during the last month, as has been traditionally verified. An alternative: for those with heat, use 0.5 sheng of hemp seeds instead of Shu Pepper.

Licorice Powder: Facilitates childbirth and ensures the mother remains healthy. Begin taking it one month prior to the expected delivery date. After thirty days, continue regular activities; when the child is born, it will happen without any awareness. Ingredients: 1 liang of licorice, 3 liang each of Huangqin, dried ginger, Wuzhuyu, yellow soybean skin, hemp seeds, cassia, and barley malt. Grind them to a fine powder, take a teaspoon with wine three times a day; warm water is also acceptable. One recipe uses glutinous rice instead of barley malt; another uses Poria instead of Huangqin.

Ejiao Powder: Used to treat discomfort during pregnancy due to falls, fetal restlessness, lower back pain, abdominal fullness, or heart palpitations associated with the fetus. Ingredients: 2 liang of cooked Rehmannia, and 1 liang each of White Peony Root, mugwort leaves, Danggui, licorice, Ejiao, and Huangqi. Grind them, and for each dose, take 0.5 liang along with 3 slices of ginger and 1 jujube in water to decoct. One recipe includes Chuanxiong.[146p]

　　产宝方　治妊娠无故胎动不安，腹内绞痛烦闷。　　当归　桑寄生各一两　川芎七钱半　豉八合　阿胶五钱　葱十四茎　　右以水二升，煮取八合，下胶烊，分温二服，空心服。一方无豉，用银器煎。一方无寄生、豉，有续断七钱半。银不拘多少，先煎，后入药。
　　养生必用方　疗胎动去血腰腹痛。
　　阿胶　川芎　当归　青竹茹各二钱
　　右以水十盏，内银一斤，煮取五盏，去银入上件药三味，煮至二盏半，去滓，入胶再煎胶烊，分温三服，空心自早至夕尽，未效再作。
　　寄生汤　治胎气常不安，及五个月已后胎不安。　　桑寄生洗　秦艽　阿胶　糯米粉各半两　　右以新汲水三升，先下寄生、秦艽，煮至二升，去滓；次入阿胶糯米，再煮，约一升止；分三服，空心食前日午服之。忌酒酢三五日。妊妇胎气至五月已后常不安者，服之必效。顷见妊妇好饮酒，食酸咸五辛，胎必动，不可不知。[147p]

Recipe for Producing Treasures: To treat unprovoked fetal movements and abdominal cramping during pregnancy.

Ingredients:

  • 1 tael of Angelica
  • 1 tael of Mulberry Mistletoe
  • 7.5 qian of Ligusticum
  • 8 he of Fermented Soybeans
  • 5 qian of Ejiao (Donkey-hide Gelatin)
  • 14 stalks of Green Onion

Preparation:

  1. Use 2 sheng of water to boil down to 8 he, then add the gelatin and dissolve it.
  2. Divide into two warm doses to be taken on an empty stomach.

Alternative recipes:

  • One formula omits the fermented soybeans and should be boiled in silver.
  • Another formula omits mulberry mistletoe and fermented soybeans, substituting with 7.5 qian of Dipsacus.

Essential Recipe for Nurturing Life: To treat pain in the lower back and abdomen caused by fetal movement.

Ingredients:

  • 2 qian of Ejiao
  • 2 qian of Ligusticum
  • 2 qian of Angelica
  • 2 qian of Green Bamboo Shoots

Preparation:

  1. Boil with 10 cups of water and 1 jin of silver until 5 cups remain.
  2. Remove the silver, add the three medicinal ingredients, and boil until 2.5 cups remain.
  3. Strain, add the gelatin, and reboil until dissolved.
  4. Divide into three warm doses to be taken on an empty stomach from morning until evening. If ineffective, prepare again.

Mistletoe Decoction: To treat unsettled fetal energy, especially after five months of pregnancy.

Ingredients:

  • 0.5 tael of washed Mulberry Mistletoe
  • 0.5 tael of Gentian
  • 0.5 tael of Ejiao
  • 0.5 tael of Glutinous Rice Flour

Preparation:

  1. Use 3 sheng of fresh spring water, first adding mistletoe and gentian, and boil down to 2 sheng; then strain.
  2. Next, add the Ejiao and glutinous rice flour, boiling until about 1 sheng remains.
  3. Divide into three doses to be taken on an empty stomach before meals, particularly at noon.

Avoid alcohol and vinegar for three to five days. Pregnant women with unstable fetal energy after five months will find this effective. If a pregnant woman craves alcohol or eats sour, salty, or pungent foods, fetal movement will surely occur, which should be duly noted.[147p]

Shunqi Drink: Take before childbirth to calm the fetus.
Ingredients:

  • Suye (Perilla leaf)
  • Muxiang (Saussurea)
  • Renshen (Ginseng)

  • Baifuling (Poria)

An胎 Jisheng Decoction: Treats blood flow issues.
Ingredients:

  • Sangjisheng (Mulberry mistletoe)

  • Fuling (Poria) - 1 tael

Qin Jiao Decoction: Treats restless fetal movement.
Qin Jiao, stir-fried Ejiao, and mugwort leaves, all equal parts to be ground into a coarse powder. Take five qian each time, with two cups of water and one hundred grains of glutinous rice, boil until reduced to one cup, then strain and take warm.

Minor Pain Relief Decoction: Treats heavy sensations in pregnancy, pain radiating to the lower back, and stabilizes the fetus.
Angelica, stir-fried Ejiao, dried Rehmannia, Coptis, and Peony, each one liang; one egg; one sheng of Job's tears. Mix these seven ingredients with seven sheng of water, beat the egg to mix well, boil the Job's tears until it bubbles like crab eyes, strain, then add the herbs and boil down to three sheng. Divide into four doses. Avoid food with Chinese black mustard.

Effective Huangqin Decoction: Treats anxiety in women during pregnancy.
Huangqin and Bai Zhu, each half liang, Angelica two qian. Add water to two sheng and decoct to one sheng, taken at any time. One version includes cardamom, all equal parts.

Diao Teng Decoction: For restless fetal movement during the eighth or ninth month of pregnancy, abdominal pain, pale face, cold sweat, and near fainting; this is due to labor straining the fetal womb and should be treated urgently.
Bitter stem one and a half liang, half a liang of Sang Ji Sheng, Diao Teng hook, Angelica, Fu Shen, and Ginseng, each one liang. Grind these to a coarse powder, take five large qian with two cups of water, boil down to one cup, strain and take warm at any time. Avoid pork and kale. If there’s heat, add two and a half liang of gypsum; if in the month before childbirth, add one liang of cinnamon heart.[149p]

Fetal Protection Formula
For treating unstable fetal movements during pregnancy.
Two pounds of carp, one liter of glutinous rice, one handful of scallions, some fermented soybeans, fresh ginger. Prepare as soup and consume once a month.

Iron Cover Powder for Fetal Stability
Highly effective for stabilizing pregnancy.
One tael of white peony root, half a tael of white atractylodes. Grind into fine powder. Take two qian with a decoction of purple perilla. If there is heart heat and restlessness, add a little sand sugar while boiling.
Also, there is a formula for treating inability to turn during pregnancy.
One tael of processed donkey-hide gelatin, half a tael of mulberry mistletoe. Grind into powder, then use one liter of wine, boil five times, add one raw chicken egg into the wine, divide into two warm doses before meals. The "Minor Prescription" does not include mistletoe, only uses mugwort leaves and is boiled with water.

Carp Soup Formula
For treating unstable fetal movements and heartburn during pregnancy.
One pound of carp, trimmed and finely chopped, one tael of donkey-hide gelatin, crushed and roasted until yellow, two he of glutinous rice. Combine these with two liters of water, add the fish, gelatin, and rice, cook until done, then add scallion whites, fresh ginger, tangerine peel, and a little salt, boil for an additional five to seven times before eating. For injuries, consume for five to seven days before seeing effects.

Complete Formula
For treating sudden appearance of yellow juice like glue or bean juice, fetal movement and abdominal pain during pregnancy.
Five he of glutinous rice, six taels of astragalus root.[150p]

Another formula treats pain all over during pregnancy, or if there is a sensation of impending death, with inability to eat or drink.

Five taels of white atractylodes, two taels of huangqin, and four taels of peony.

Take six sheng of water, boil down to two and a half sheng, and divide into three doses. This is because pain during pregnancy can be caused by water, which also facilitates childbirth.

Danggui Decoction, also known as Baoan Powder, treats restlessness of the fetus, severe anguish in the heart, irritability, dry mouth, abnormal fetal positioning leading to distress, with lips and mouth appearing dark blue, and cold extremities.

One tael each of danggui, fried ejiao, and licorice; one and a half taels of ginseng; and a handful of green onion roots.

Grind these ingredients, use two sheng of water, and decoct them until reduced to one and a half sheng. Strain, add the green onion again, and decoct a second time until reduced to three he, and serve warm in two or three doses. There is a variant without licorice, using川芎 (Chuanxiong) and houpo instead.

For leakage during pregnancy, treat with yellow juice leakage, or like bean juice.

Two cups of fresh mugwort juice, one tael each of ejiao and white honey; decoct to seven-tenths and serve warm. If fresh mugwort is unavailable, use concentrated juice from dried mugwort instead. There is a variant that adds bamboo shavings. Another variant uses wine without honey.

Another formula for abdominal pain and occasional bleeding during the third or fourth month of pregnancy consists of:

Two taels of xu duan, six taels each of mugwort leaves, danggui, and dried rehmannia root; one tael each of bamboo shavings, ejiao, and chicken's foot.

Use one sheng of water and decoct to six he, then take it on an empty stomach.[151p]

Jishengru Shengtang is used to treat fetal movement and abdominal pain, which may indicate fetal flooding. The ingredients are as follows: carp fish skin, soaked in Angelica wine; cooked Rehmannia, steamed with wine; white peony; and fried Ejiao with clam powder; Chuanxiong; and Du Huo, soaked in wine; and licorice, toasted, all in equal parts. Take four qian per dose, simmered in one cup of water with a small amount of ramie root and five slices of ginger, and take it warm. Another formula includes dried ginger and bamboo shavings.

Sangjisheng San is used to treat fetal flooding with irregular bleeding, continuing unabated. The ingredients include: Sangjisheng, Angelica (removed from its leaves) soaked in wine; Chuanxiong; Du Huo soaked in wine; fried Ejiao with clam powder; fried Xiangfuzi (fennel) after removing the hairs; foxtail, from which wood is removed; and Bai Zhu (white atractylodes), each one qian; Ren Shen (ginseng) and ginger, each five fen. Combine these to make one dose, boil in two cups of water with five slices of ginger until reduced to one cup, and can be taken any time.

Zheng's Ginseng Powder treats fetal flooding with blood stasis in the heart, gradually leading to a dry fetus, putting both mother and child in danger. The ingredients include: ginseng, toasted Huangqi (astragalus); fried Ejiao with clam powder, each five qian; bamboo shavings; wood incense; roasted licorice; and Fuzi (aconite), prepared by removing skin and navel, each half a qian; Chuanxiong, Chen Pi (tangerine peel), and ramie root, each two and a half qian; fresh ginger, three qian, roasted dark. Take four qian per dose, mixed with thirty glutinous rice grains, and boil in water to drink hot. Avoid raw, cold, chicken, duck, fish, and noodles.[152p]

Er Huang San: For treating fetal movement.
Mix raw and cooked Rehmannia in equal parts, grind. Add three cups of water, decoct until half dry, strain and take.

Dan Xi Fang: For blood clots like a disc; during pregnancy, strong agents are difficult to take. This formula is for that.
Cook Xiangfuzi in vinegar, four taels; Bai Zhu, Tao Ren (peeled and pointed), each one tael; Hai Fen cooked in vinegar, two taels. Grind into a powder and form into pills with flour.

Bu Yi An Tai San: For sudden lower back pain and continuous bleeding.
Combine cooked Rehmannia, Ai Ye (mugwort), Bai Shao (white peony), Chuan Xiong, Huang Qi (astragalus), Dong Gui (angelica), stir-fried E Jiao (donkey-hide gelatin), Gan Cao (licorice), and Di Yu (sanguisorba), all in equal parts. Each dose is four qian, with five slices of ginger and one jujube, decoct and take while warm.

Xiong Gui Tang: For dealing with cold symptoms during pregnancy, sudden abdominal pain like a knife.
Combine Chuan Xiong, Ren Shen (ginseng), Bai Fu Ling (white poria), Wu Zhu Yu (evodia), Ku Guo (bitter orange), and Dong Gui, each three taels; Hou Po (magnolia bark) and Shao Yao (peony), each two taels. Grind together, use nine sheng (liters) of water, boil down to three sheng, divide into three doses; if qi descends, relief is achieved.

Cao Dou Kou San: For pregnant women with constant abdominal pain, reduced appetite, and limbs feeling weak, unable to eat.
Combine Cao Dou Kou, Ju Pi (tangerine peel), raw Rehmannia, Bai Zhu, each one tael; stir-fried Dong Gui, Gui Xin (cinnamon), Gan Jiang (dried ginger), and Mu Xiang (aurantium wood), each half a tael; Chuan Xiong seven qian and five fen. Grind into a fine powder; for each dose, four qian mixed with one cup of water and two jujubes, decoct until six portions remain, take hot.[153p]

Da Di Huang Wan treats pre- and postpartum lower back and abdominal pain, and all kinds of pain related to the blood; it also addresses blood and Qi deficiency, weakness in the limbs, and bone marrow heat pain.

Shu Di Huang (2 liang), Wu Mei flesh, Dang Gui (each 1 liang).

The above should be ground into a fine powder, refined into honey to make pills the size of ball bearings, and each time, one pill should be chewed and swallowed with warm white soup on an empty stomach.

Xiao Pin Zhu Gen Tang treats damage to the fetus, lower back and abdominal pain, and expels blood leading to downward fetal movement.

Sheng Gan Di Huang, Zhu Gen (each 2 liang), Dang Gui, Shao Yao, A Jiao, and Gan Cao (each 1 liang).

Cut finely, use 6 sheng of water, boil to obtain 2 sheng, discard the dregs, add the gelatin, and dissolve. Divide into three warm doses. Avoid seaweed and bitter herbs.

Cang Gong Xia Qi Tang treats pregnancy-related abdominal distension, obstruction in the sides, inability to eat, and weakness in the limbs.

Qiang Huo, Chi Shao Yao, Gan Cao, Bin Lang, Qing Pi, Da Fu Pi, Chen Pi, Chi Fu Ling, Ban Xia, Sang Bai Pi, Gui Xin (each 0.5 liang), Zi Su stem (2 liang).

The above should be chewed, and each dose (3 qian) should be prepared with 1 cup of water, 5 slices of ginger, and 1 jujube, boiled until reduced by half, then dregged and consumed whenever needed. For certain syndromes, the formula may vary slightly, adding Deng Xin decoction.[155p]

An Tai He Qi Decoction treats cold in the womb causing abdominal distension, pain radiating to both sides, frequent urination, and loose stools.

Ingredients:

  • 3 pieces of baked hawthorn (without seeds)
  • 6 grams of white atractylodes
  • Dried tangerine peel (white part removed)
  • 3 grams of high-quality ginger (stir-fried)
  • 3 grams of honey-fried licorice

Preparation: Combine the above ingredients to make one dose, add two cups of water and five slices of fresh ginger, and simmer until it reduces to one cup. Take at any time, avoiding raw and cold foods.

Zhi Ke Decoction treats abdominal distension in pregnant women.

Ingredients:

  • 180 grams of bitter orange
  • 60 grams of scutellaria

Preparation: Grind into a coarse powder, take 15 grams each time, simmer with half a cup of water and consume warm. If there is excessive fullness in the abdomen and heaviness, add 30 grams of white atractylodes.

Tian Xian Teng Powder treats swelling and fullness during pregnancy.

Ingredients:

  • Tian Xian Teng (Chinese climbing fern), slightly washed and stir-fried
  • Cyperus rotundus (stir-fried)
  • Dried tangerine peel
  • Licorice
  • Lindera aggregata

Preparation: Mix these in equal parts to a fine powder, take 9 grams each time, simmer with one large cup of water, three slices of ginger, three slices of papaya, and three leaves of perilla until reduced to seven-tenths, cool and strain. Consume on an empty stomach three times a day. It helps relieve urination, unblocks qi pathways, and reduces swelling gradually.

Qian Jin Li Yu Soup treats abdominal swelling with water accumulation during pregnancy.

Ingredients:

  • 250 grams of white atractylodes
  • 160 grams of poria
  • 90 grams of angelica
  • 90 grams of peony

Preparation: Chop finely and prepare one whole carp as per the cooking method, extract the juice and discard the fish. Take 15 grams each time and mix with one and a half cups of fish juice, seven slices of fresh ginger, and a small amount of dried tangerine peel, simmer until reduced to seven-tenths, strain and consume on an empty stomach.[156p]

Collection of Medical Works, Volume 387 - Treatise on Women's Pre-pregnancy

Formulas

Muxiang Pills: For treating pregnant women with food-related injuries.

  • Ingredients: 2 qian of Muxiang, 3 qian each of Sanleng, Ginseng, and Bai Fuling.
  • Preparation: Grind finely and form into pills the size of a broad bean. Swallow 30-40 pills with warm water.

Baizhu Powder: For regulating stomach qi in pregnant women, where diet is easily affected.

  • Ingredients: 1 liang of fried Baizhu, 1 liang of Zi Su, 7.5 qian each of Ginseng and Bai Zhi, 0.5 liang each of Chuanxiong, Hezi peel, and Qingpi, and 2.5 qian of Licorice.
  • Preparation: Grind into powder, and take 2 qian with a cup of water, and 3 slices of ginger, decoct until reduced to 70%, and consume warm.

Zhengshi Shengjin Powder: For pregnant women suffering from the effects of food, leading to spleen and stomach issues, with qi deficiency causing coldness, resulting in lower abdominal distension and pain, or heavy waist, and constipation.

  • Ingredients: 1.5 qian each of Wu Zhu Yu soaked in wine, Chen Pi, dried Ginger pounded, sliced and toasted Ginger, and Chuanxiong, and 3 qian each of honey-fried Licorice and thick skin prepared with ginger.
  • Preparation: Grind finely and take 3 qian, consuming with Chen rice drink. It is particularly effective when simmered with salt. “Jisheng Fang” adds sand cardamom.[157p]

　　生犀角散　治妊娠卒中风不语。四肢强直，心神惛愦。　　生犀角屑　麻黄去节，各一两　防风　赤箭　羌活　当归　人参　葛根　赤芍药各七钱半　甘草炙　秦艽各半两　石膏一两半　　右(口父)咀，每服八钱，煎服法如前。

　　白朮酒　治妊娠中风口噤，语言不得。　　白朮一两半　独活一两　黑豆一合，炒　　右细銼，以酒三升，煎取一升半，去滓，温分四服。口噤者拗口灌之，得汗即愈。

Bai Zhu Wine: Treats gestational stroke causing mouth tightness and inability to speak. Use one and a half taels of Bai Zhu, one tael of Du Huo, and one handful of black beans, stir-fried. Grind fine, add three sheng of wine, decoct to one and a half sheng, strain, and divide into four doses. For those with a tight mouth, force-feed it; sweating will lead to recovery.

Ling Yang Jiao San: Treats gestational anxiety and confusion, with a condition referred to as fetal convulsion. Use ground antelope horn, Du Huo, stir-fried sour jujube seed, Wu Jia Pi, Fang Feng, stir-fried Coix seed, Angelica soaked in wine, Chuan Xiong, peeled apricot kernel, and Fu Ling, each five fen; and Mu Xiang and honey-fried Licorice, each two fen. Decoct with ginger water.

Qiang Huo Wine: Treats gestational stroke symptoms including mouth tightness, strong limbs, and arched back. Use one and a half taels of Qiang Huo, one tael of Fang Feng, and one handful of black beans, stir-fried to remove the skin. Mix these three ingredients, steep in five sheng of fine wine overnight. For each dose, use one handful of black beans, stir-fry until cooked, add to a large cup of medicinal wine, bring to a boil, remove the dregs, and divide into two doses for administration.

Da Sheng San: Treats gestational palpitations, frequent fright during sleep, abdominal and lateral swelling, and discomfort in sitting or lying down. Use one and a half qian each of white Fu Ling, Mai Men Dong, honey-fried Huang Qi, Angelica soaked in wine, and Chuan Xiong; and one qian each of Mu Xiang, Ren Shen, and honey-fried Licorice. Prepare as a single dose, using two sheng of water and five slices of fresh ginger, decoct until reduced to one sheng, to be taken at any time.[159p]

Mai Men Dong Decoction: Treats anxiety during pregnancy, fear, and irritability, known as "Zi Fan."
Ingredients: Mai Men Dong, Bai Fu Ling, Fang Feng, each 9 grams; Ren Shen, 4.5 grams.
Preparation: Combine and boil with 480 ml of water, add 5 slices of fresh ginger and 10 leaves of thin bamboo. Simmer until reduced to 240 ml. Strain and consume at any time.

Mai Men Dong Powder: Treats irritability during pregnancy, mental confusion, restlessness, vomiting, aversion to food smells, dizziness, heaviness in limbs, joint pain, and reduced movement.
Ingredients: Mai Men Dong, Zi QIn, Chi Fu Ling, each 30 grams; Sheng Di, 22.5 grams; Ren Shen, Fu Shen, Chi Shao Yao, Chen Pi, Ku Geng, Sang Ji Sheng, Gan Cao, Xuan Fu Hua, each 15 grams.
Preparation: Grind into a coarse powder. Take 12 grams each time, boil with 240 ml of water and 3 grams of ginger until reduced to 180 ml. Strain and drink warm at any time.

Ren Shen Powder: Treats heat from pregnancy affecting the heart and spleen, with dry and sparse fluids, irritability, and excessive heat and thirst.
Ingredients: Ren Shen, Mai Men Dong, Chi Fu Ling, Di Gu Pi, Jia Gan Ge, Huang Qin, Xi Jiao Xie, each 22.5 grams; Gan Cao, 15 grams.
Preparation: Chop and grind. Take 9 grams each time, boil with 240 ml of water until reduced to 180 ml. Strain and drink warm.[160p]

Yimu Wan
Treats discomfort in pregnancy caused by medication leading to fetal anxiety, resembling restlessness and inability to sleep, known as "zi fan."
Ingredients: 2 taels of Zhimu.
Grind finely and form into pills the size of a small ball using jujube flesh. Take one pill each time, accompanied by a decoction of ginseng.

Ren Shen Huang Qi San
Treats heat and restlessness during pregnancy, along with dry mouth and decreased appetite.
Ingredients: 1 tael each of Ginseng, Astragalus, Kudzu root, Ophiopogon, Red Poria, and Gentian; 7.5 qian of Zhimu; 5 qian of Licorice.
Take 4 qian each time, decocted with ginger water and bamboo leaves.

Ma Dou Ling San
Treats stagnation of fetal energy during pregnancy, causing cough and urgent breathing.
Ingredients: 5 qian each of Aristolochia, Platycodon, Ginseng, Licorice, and Fritillaria; 1 tael each of aged tangerine peel (white removed), Large belly peel, Morus bark, and Perilla; 2.5 qian of Schisandra.
Take 4 qian each time, chewing (as required), with 3 slices of ginger, decocted in water.

Zi Wan Tang
Treats incessant cough during pregnancy and fetal instability.
Ingredients: 5 qian of Platycodon; 2.5 qian each of Licorice, Apricot kernel, and Morus bark; 1 tael each of Asparagus and Aster;
Take 3 qian each time, decoct with a bunch of bamboo shavings, strain, add half a spoon of honey, and decoct again until boiling, then take warm.[161p]

Ping'an San: Treats pregnancy-related coughing, constipation, vomiting, and abdominal or flank pain.
Ingredients: Chuanxiong, Mu Xiang 1.5 qian each; Chen Pi, Shu Di Huang, Sheng Jiang, Gan Jiang (prepared), Hou Po (rough skin removed), and Gan Cao 1 qian each.
Preparation: Combine and simmer with 2 sheng of water, adding a pinch of burnt salt, until reduced to 1 sheng. Take as needed.

Chai Hu Yin: Treats malaria during pregnancy.
Ingredients: Chai Hu, Sheng Da Huang 2 qian each; Sheng Huang Qin 1.5 qian; Gan Cao 1 qian.
Preparation: Chew and prepare as one dose, simmer with water. On the day of onset, take warm in the early morning to ensure relief. Avoid oily, spicy, or hot foods. If there is pressure on the heart from the fetus, Zhi Ke San can be used.

Jia Wei Li Zhong Tang: Treats deficiency cold diarrhea.
Ingredients: Ren Shen, Bai Zhu, Bai Shao Yao, Bai Fu Ling, Gan Jiang, Huang Lian, Huo Xiang Ye, Mu Xiang, He Zi Rou, Rou Guo, and Gan Cao 1 qian each.
Preparation: Simmer with 2 sheng of water, adding 3 slices of Sheng Jiang and 2 Da Zao, until reduced to 1 sheng. Take when hungry.

Zhu Ling San: Treats painful urination in pregnancy and related water retention.
Ingredients: Zhu Ling 5 liang, peel removed.
Preparation: Grind into powder, mix with white water using 2 dabs, take 3 times a day and 2 times at night. If not cured, a downward movement with a previous herb may be necessary.[162p]

Sunflower Seed Soup: For treating pregnancy-related illnesses lasting over six or seven days, with body heat entering the organs, and difficulty in urination and defecation. It calms the fetus and eliminates heat.

Take two sheng of sunflower seeds and four ounces of talcum, crushed. Boil these with five sheng of water until one sheng remains, strain, and take it all at once; immediate relief will follow.

Another Recipe: For addressing difficulty in urination and defecation during pregnancy, along with abdominal distension causing discomfort, lack of appetite, and hot hands and feet.

Ingredients: Areca nut, red Poria, large abdominal peel, and Mu Tong, each one ounce; peeled black plums, and five-flavor fruit from the north, each half an ounce; mulberry mistletoe, licorice, and bitter stems, each half an ounce.

Grind these into a coarse powder. Each dose is three qian, boiled in one cup of water until reduced to six parts, taken warm.

Large Abdominal Peel Soup: For treating difficulty in urination and defecation during pregnancy or red stool.

Ingredients: Bitter orange peel, large abdominal peel, and red Poria, each one ounce; licorice two qian.

Grind these into a powder, and take two qian mixed with scallion white broth.

Danxi's Formula: For treating pregnancy at four months with constipation. Having used laxatives like winter sunflower seeds, though they have worked, the energy remains unbalanced due to impatience and blood depleting the energy. It’s necessary to harmonize the energy and nourish the blood for stability.

Ingredients: Dried orange peel, green orange peel, and peony root, each one qian; ginseng, Angelica sinensis, Chuanxiong, fresh Rehmannia, and white atractylodes, each half an ounce; Poria, Mu Tong, and licorice, each two fen.

Prepare with water.

Dusheng Powder: For treating difficulty in urination during pregnancy.

Ingredients: Vine flower seeds.

Grind into a powder. Each dose is two qian, mixed with a concentrated broth of scallion white before meals.[163p]

Duzheng Decoction: Treats abdominal pain in pregnant women.

  • 3 qian of Angelica sinensis
  • Grind into a powder, decoct with water and take.

Difu Dahuang Decoction (from "External Treatises"):
Treats urinary issues in pregnancy, suitable for purging.

  • 3 liang each of Rhubarb and Difu grass,
  • 2 liang each of Anemarrhena, Scutellaria, Polyporus, Red peony, Tongcao, Chuan Shengma, Zhiqiao, and Licorice.
  • Grind together, take 4 qian with one cup of water, decoct to 70% remaining, remove the dregs and take warm.

Another Prescription (from "Standards"):
For urinary problems in pregnancy, difficulty and pain in urination and lower abdominal heat.

  • 1 sheng of Malva seed,
  • 2 liang of Peony,
  • 3 liang each of Scutellaria, Red poria, and Plantago seed.
  • Grind together, use 7 sheng of water, decoct until 2 sheng remains, divide into three warm doses.

Another Prescription:
For pregnancy of a few months with painful and dripping urination, anxiety, and lack of appetite.

  • 1 liang each of Cornus fruit, Red poria, Mulberry bark, Akebia stem, and Malva seed,
  • 0.5 liang each of Scutellaria, Peony, Zhiqiao, and Plantago seed.
  • Grind into a coarse powder, take 4 qian with one cup of water, decoct to 60%, and take warm.

Anrong Powder: Treats scanty urination in pregnancy leading to dripping.

  • 2 qian each of Ophiopogon, Tongcao, Talc, Ginseng, and Asarum,
  • 0.5 liang each of soaked Angelica in wine, Lantern heart, and Licorice.
  • Grind into a fine powder, take 2 qian at any time, controlling the dose with a decoction of Ophiopogon.[164p]

Sang Piao Xiao Powder: Treats pregnancy-related urinary incontinence. Use twenty pieces of Sang Piao Xiao, roasted with wine until golden, then grind into a fine powder. Take two qian each time, mixed with warm rice water, or ginger soup.

Xu Duan Decoction: Treats bleeding during pregnancy and blood in the urine. Ingredients: Dang Gui, Sheng Di (each one liang), Xu Duan (half a liang), Chi Shao Yao (two and a half qian). Grind into a powder, take two qian on an empty stomach, mixed with a broth made from scallion whites.

Licorice, Wheat, and Jujube Decoction [from "Jin Gui"]: Treats dryness in women’s organs, feelings of sadness and desire to cry, as if affected by a spiritual being, and frequent yawning. Ingredients: Licorice (three liang), Wheat (one sheng), Jujube (ten pieces). Boil these three ingredients in six sheng of water until three sheng is left, and divide into three warm doses. It also tonifies spleen qi. One prescription says it can be used before and after childbirth.

Bamboo Shoot Decoction [from "Zhun Sheng"]: Treats heart deficiency with palpitations in pregnant women, continuous dryness, and sadness. Also very effective for severe anxiety. Ingredients: Mai Men Dong (with hearts removed), Wheat, and Ban Xia, each (two and a half liang), Ren Shen and Bai Fu Ling, each (one and a half liang), and Licorice (one liang). Grind these finely, take four qian each time, combined with five slices of ginger, one jujube, and a section of dried bamboo shoot the size of a finger, and decoct to drink warm.[165p]

　　芎藭补中汤 【《济生方》】 　治怀妊血气虚弱，不能卫养，以致胎漏，每四五月而堕，名曰半产。　　芎藭　五味子　阿胶蛤粉炒　干姜炮，各一钱　黄芪炙　当归酒浸　白芍药　白朮各一钱半　杜仲炒去丝　人参　木香　甘草炙，各五分　　右，水二锺，煎至一锺，不拘时服。一方无木香。

Xiong Huang Bu Zhong Decoction [from "Ji Sheng Fang"]

This is used to treat weak blood and qi during pregnancy, unable to nourish and protect, leading to fetal instability, resulting in miscarriage every four to five months, termed "half birth."

Ingredients:

  • Xiong Huang (Sichuan Pepper)
  • Wu Wei Zi (Schisandra)
  • Ejiao (Donkey-hide Gelatin) and fried conch powder, each 1 qian (3 grams)
  • Gan Jiang (Dried Ginger), roasted
  • Huang Qi (Astragalus), roasted
  • Dang Gui (Angelica), soaked in wine
  • Bai Shao (White Peony), Bai Zhu (Atractylodes), each 1.5 qian
  • Du Zhong (Eucommia), stir-fried and stripped of fibers
  • Ren Shen (Ginseng), Mu Xiang (Costus), Gan Cao (Licorice), each 5 fen (1.5 grams)

Prepare with 2 sheng (600 ml) of water, simmer until 1 sheng remains, and consume at any time. If a formula lacks Mu Xiang, it still works.

Du Zhong Pill, also called "Du Xu Pill."

This treats instability of the fetus after two to three months of pregnancy, with back pain, preventing miscarriage; it is recommended to take it in advance.

Ingredients:

  • Du Zhong, processed with ginger and strip removed, 2 liang (approximately 60 grams)
  • Xu Duan (Teasel), soaked in wine, 2 liang

Grind into powder, boil jujube flesh, make pills the size of walnuts, take 70 pills with rice drink.

Four-Form Xiang Fu Pills

This treats women with repeated miscarriages due to improper qi movement, thus preventing strong fetal energy. It is advisable to take this.

Ingredients:

  • Xiang Fu (Cyperus), pounded and cleaned, 1 jin (approximately 600 grams), divided into four parts: one part soaked in wine, one part in vinegar, two parts in children's urine, one part in saltwater, each soaked for seven days, then dried.

Grind to a fine powder, boil with vinegar into a paste, and form pills the size of walnuts. Take 70 pills on an empty stomach with warm wine. If the person is overweight, follow the basic formula; if thin, add 2 liang each of Zexlan leaves and red Poria. Another formula uses 1 jin of Xiang Fu, 4 liang of Ai Ye (Mugwort), and 1 liang of Dang Gui, all boiled in vinegar.[166p]

Anxiety-relieving white atractylodes powder is used to treat pregnancy complications such as coldness, underdeveloped fetus, or loss of management, which can lead to miscarriage. This medicine nourishes the vital essence and supports the fetus's energy.

Ingredients:

  • Fried Atractylodes (1 tael)
  • Chuanxiong (1 tael)

  • Honey-fried Licorice (1.5 taels)

　　知母丸 【《集验》】 　治日月未足而痛如欲产者，兼治产难及子烦。　　知母不拘多少
　　右为细末，炼蜜丸如鸡头大，温酒嚼下，日三服。一方丸如悟子大，粥饮下二十丸或三五十丸。
　　雄黄丸　治妊娠是鬼胎，致腹申黑血散下，腹痛。　　雄黄细研　鬼臼去毛　莽草　丹砂细研　巴豆去皮心油　獭肝各半两　蜥蜴一枚　蜈蚣一条，并炙黄　　右为细末，蜜丸如梧子大，空心温酒下二丸，日两服，后当利。如不利，加至三丸。初下清水，次下虫如马尾状无数。病极者，下蛇虫，或如虾蟆卵鸡子，或如白膏，或如豆汁，其病即除。

Zhi Mu Pill: Treats pain resembling childbirth when the moon and sun have not yet fully risen, also helps with difficult childbirth and child-related troubles. Zhi Mu is not confined to a specific amount. Grind finely and form into pills the size of a chicken's head, chew with warm wine, take three times a day. A variant of the pill is the size of a walnut, take 20 pills with congee or 30 to 50 at a time.

Xiong Huang Pill: Treats pregnancies with ghost fetuses, resulting in abdominal pain and the discharge of dark blood. Finely grind Xiong Huang, hairless Gui Jiu, Mang Cao, Dan Sha, Bai Dou with skin and heart oil, half a tael each; one lizard and one centipede, both roasted until yellow. Grind finely and form into pills the size of a jujube, take two pills with warm wine on an empty stomach, twice a day, should provoke discharge. If not effective, increase to three pills. First, discharge clear water, then numerous worm-like creatures resembling horse tails may be expelled. For severe cases, snake-shaped worms, or things resembling frog eggs, chicken eggs, white paste, or bean juice may come out, after which the ailment will be resolved.

Fu Yuan Decoction: Treats constant vomiting in pregnancy, or headaches with complete loss of appetite, left pulse weak. Each: Dang Gui, Chuan Xiong, Bai Shao, Ren Shen, and Gan Cao (roasted), five qian each; Bai Zhu, Fu Ling, Chen Pi, one and a half tael each; three qian of Ding Xiang; Half Xie soaked in ginger soup, one tael; two qian of Jie Geng and Zhi Qiao. Prepare a total of ten doses, boiling with ginger and dates for consumption.[168p]

Zisu and Qi San: This remedy disperses Qi and regulates pregnancy, helping with any discomfort before delivery, such as distress, obstructed Qi, and various ailments before childbirth. Jihuang San: For treating children's dysentery with both red and white, accompanied by painful cramping. 　　鸭子煎，治胎前产后赤白痢。
　　生姜年少者百钱，年老者二百钱，捣取自然汁　鸭子一个，打破入姜汁内搅匀　　右同煎至八分，入蒲黄三钱，再煎五七沸，空心温服，立效。
　　诃朮散 【《正传》，下同】 　治妊娠泄泻，由食坐冷当风取凉所致。　　诃子皮　白朮各一钱半　陈皮　良姜　木香　白芍药酒炒　肉豆蔻煨　甘草炙，各一钱　　右銼，作一贴，姜五片，水煎服。

　　醒脾饮子　治子疟寒疟。
　　厚朴　草豆蔻研，各五钱　干姜三分　甘草二分　　右銼，作一贴，入姜五片，枣二枚，同煎，空心服。
　　济生石膏汤 【丹溪】 　治妊娠热疟，汤饮无度。　　石膏二钱　生地黄一钱　半夏　黄芩　人参　麦门冬　知母　干葛各一钱　甘草五分　　右銼，作一贴，入乌梅一个，同煎服。[175p]

Duck broth is used to treat red and white dysentery before childbirth and after delivery. Use fresh ginger, costing 100 coins for the young and 200 coins for the old, and extract its juice. Take one duck, break it into the ginger juice and stir well. Cook until it’s 80% done, then add three coins of cattail pollen and simmer for another 5 to 7 boils. Consume warm on an empty stomach for immediate effect.

Hezi powder treats diarrhea during pregnancy caused by eating cold food or exposure to wind. Use 1.5 coins each of hezi peel and white atractylodes, and 1 coin each of dried tangerine peel, galanga, wood fragrance, fried white peony, cooked nutmeg, and roasted licorice. Crush these to make one dose, adding five slices of ginger, then boil with water to drink.

Xingpi drink is used to treat childhood malaria and cold malaria. Use 5 coins each of magnolia bark and cardamom, 3 fen of dried ginger, and 2 fen of licorice. Crush these to make one dose, adding five slices of ginger and two jujubes, then boil and consume on an empty stomach.

Jisheng gypsum soup is used to treat febrile malaria during pregnancy when there is excessive drinking. Use 2 coins of gypsum, 1 coin of raw rehmannia, and 1 coin each of pinellia, skullcap, ginseng, ophiopogon, anemarrhena, and dried kudzu; 5 fen of licorice. Crush these to make one dose, adding one black plum, then boil and consume.[175p]

　　栀子大青汤 【《纲目》】 　治妊妇热病发狂变黑。　　黄芩　升麻　栀子各一钱　大青　杏仁各五分　　右銼，作一贴，葱白三茎，同煎服。
　　神方验胎散海藏方　验胎如神。
　　真雀脑川芎一两　当归全用，重一两者只用七钱　　右二味细末，分作二服，浓煎好艾汤一盏调下，二三时间，觉腹脐微动仍频，即有胎也。动罢即愈。如不是胎，即不动。如不觉效，再煎红花汤调下，必有神效。
　　艾醋汤 【《医鉴》，下同】 　验胎有无如见。　　好醋　艾叶
　　右二味煮汁，服半盏，腹中大痛是孕，不痛无孕。
　　参橘散　一名人参橘皮汤。治恶阻病，呕吐痰水，口不入食。　　橘皮　赤茯苓各一钱半　麦门冬　白朮　厚朴　人参　甘草各一钱　　右銼作一站，入姜十片，青竹茹鸡子大，同煎服。一方用白茯苓、橘红，无赤茯、橘皮。[176p]

Gardenia and Big Blue Decoction
Treats heat illness in pregnant women causing madness and darkening.
Huangqin, Shengma, and Gardenia, each 1 qian; Big Blue and apricot kernels, each 0.5 qian.
Grind the above ingredients together, make one application, and cook with three scallion whites to take as a decoction.

Divine Formula for Fetal Examination
This formula is effective for confirming pregnancy.
True Sparrow Brain and Chuanxiong, 1 liang; Danggui, for those weighing 1 liang, only use 7 qian.
Grind these two ingredients finely, divide into two doses, steep in a strong decoction of moxa for one cup and take it down. If, after two or three times, you feel slight movements in the belly button, then there is indeed a fetus. If no movement occurs, then there is none. If you still don't feel it, boil with safflower and take down; it will surely be effective.

Moxa Vinegar Decoction
This formula can determine presence or absence of pregnancy.
Good vinegar and moxa leaves.
Boil these two ingredients for their juice, take half a cup; if there is significant pain in the abdomen, there is pregnancy; if not, there is none.

Ginseng and Tangerine Peel Powder
Also known as Ginseng Tangerine Peel Decoction; treats severe nausea, vomiting of phlegm and water, and inability to eat.
Tangerine peel, red poria, each 1.5 qian; Ophiopogon, Bai Zhu, Hou Pu, Ginseng, and licorice, each 1 qian.
Grind together to make one application, add 10 slices of ginger and a piece of green bamboo as big as a chicken egg, and decoct to take.
Another formula uses white poria and tangerine peel instead of red poria and tangerine peel.[176p]

Baosheng Decoction
For treating women's menstrual disorders where the symptoms appear as if sick but are not, with a normal spirit, aversion to food odors, and possibly either a single craving or vomiting, this condition is termed "evil stasis." It is suitable to take this.
Ingredients:

  • Bai Zhu (Atractylodes Macrocephala) 2 qian
  • Xiang Fu (Cyperus Rotundus) 2 qian
  • Wu Yao (Lindera Aggregate) 2 qian
  • Ju Hong (Citrus Reticulata) 2 qian
  • Ren Shen (Ginseng) 1 qian
  • Gan Cao (Licorice) 1 qian
    Preparation: Grind the ingredients into a paste, add three slices of ginger, and decoct for consumption.

Di Fu Zi Decoction: Treats painful urination.
Ingredients: Di Fu Zi (1.5 qian), Che Qian Zi (1.5 qian), Zhi Mu (1 qian), Bai Shao Yao (1 qian), Chi Fu Ling (1 qian), Huang Qin (1 qian), Zhi Ke (1 qian), Sheng Ma (0.7 qian), Tong Cao (0.7 qian), Gan Cao (0.7 qian).

Wang You San: Treats painful urination.
Ingredients: Powdered Amber (0.5 qian).
Instructions: Take one handful of Huan Cao root, boil in soup and mix it with the powder.

Wen Wei San: Treats women with cold in the organs, nausea, and unstable fetal energy. Also treats postpartum weak cold spleen energy, nausea, lack of appetite, and abdominal pain.
Ingredients: Ren Shen, Bai Zhu (each 1-2 qian or 1 two), Bian Dou (2 qian), Chen Pi (optional), Zhi Gan Cao (1 qian), Dang Gui (1-2 qian, avoid slippery types), Gan Jiang (1-3 qian, roast until brown).
Instructions: Use 2 sheng of water, boil down to 7 parts, and take warm far from meals.

Li Yin Jian: Treats the same condition as above. Also treats postpartum Yang deficiency with internal cold or external cold pathogens leading to abdominal pain, vomiting, and cold extremities.
Ingredients: Shu Di (3-7 qian or 1-2 two), Zhi Gan Cao (1-2 qian), Dang Gui (2-3 qian or 5-7 qian), Gan Jiang (1-3 qian, roasted yellow).
Instructions: Use 2 sheng of water, boil down to 7 parts, and take hot. Optionally add Rou Gui (1-2 qian).[179p]

　　保阴煎　治胎气热而不安。亦治产后血热，淋沥不止。　　生地　熟地　芍药各二钱　山药　川续断　黄芩　黄蘗　生甘草各一钱　　水二锺，煎七分，食远温服。

Zhiqiao Decoction: Treats fetal leakage, or bleeding due to circumstances. It also addresses adverse pregnancy symptoms, aids digestion, and treats heat combined with blood deficiency and restless fetal movements.

Fetal Source Drink: Treats women whose Chong and Ren meridians are unbalanced, resulting in an unstable pregnancy, modifying based on specific symptoms. Can be taken every other day or every two to three days for one or two doses.

  • Water 2 zhong, decoct to 7 parts, take warm away from meals.[181p]

　　五福饮　治气血俱虚，胎动不安
　　人参　熟地各随宜　当归二三钱　炙草一钱　白朮炒，一钱半　　右，水二锺，煎七分，食远温服。

　　秘元煎　治脾肾气虚，胎动不安，兼带浊。亦治冲任气虚而胎漏者。　　人参　金樱子各一二钱　五味子十四粒　甘草炙，一钱　远志炒，八分　山药炒　芡实炒　枣仁炒捣碎，各二钱　白朮炒　茯苓各钱半　　水二锺，煎七分，食远服。

　　菟丝煎　治同上。
　　人参二三钱　山药炒，二钱　菟丝子炒，四五钱　当归　枣仁炒　茯苓各钱半　远志肉制，四分　炙甘草一钱或五分　鹿角霜为末，四五匙　　右用水一锺半，煎成加鹿角霜末调匀，食前服。
　　小和中饮　治妊娠食滞胀满。

Five Blessings Decoction: For treating deficiency of both Qi and blood, and restlessness during pregnancy.
Ingredients:

  • Ginseng: suitable amount
  • Cooked Rehmannia: suitable amount
  • Angelica (Dang Gui): 2-3 qian
  • Prepared Licorice: 1 qian
  • Fried Atractylodes (Bai Zhu): 1.5 qian
    Combine above in two sheng of water, decoct until reduced to seven parts, and take warm on an empty stomach.

Secret Yuan Decoction: For treating deficiency of spleen and kidney Qi, restlessness during pregnancy, accompanied by dampness. Also addresses deficient Chong and Ren vessels and cases of potential miscarriage.
Ingredients:

  • Ginseng: 1-2 qian
  • Jin Ying Zi (Gold Cherry): 1-2 qian
  • Wu Wei Zi (Schisandra): 14 berries
  • Prepared Licorice: 1 qian
  • Fried Yuan Zhi (Polygala): 8 fen
  • Fried Chinese Yam: 2 qian
  • Fried Euryale Seeds: 2 qian
  • Fried Jujube Seeds (Da Zao Ren), smashed: 2 qian
  • Fried Atractylodes (Bai Zhu): 0.5 qian
  • Fried Poria (Fu Ling): 0.5 qian
    Combine in two sheng of water, decoct until reduced to seven parts, and take on an empty stomach.

Cuscuta Decoction: For treating the same conditions as above.
Ingredients:

  • Ginseng: 2-3 qian
  • Fried Chinese Yam: 2 qian
  • Fried Cuscuta Seeds: 4-5 qian
  • Angelica (Dang Gui): 0.5 qian
  • Fried Jujube Seeds (Da Zao Ren): 0.5 qian
  • Fried Poria (Fu Ling): 0.5 qian
  • Prepared Licorice: 1 qian or 5 fen
  • Antler gelatin powder: 4-5 spoonfuls
    Combine all with 1.5 sheng of water, decoct, mix in antler gelatin powder, and take before meals.

Xiao He Zhong Decoction: For treating food stagnation and bloating during pregnancy.

  • Fried Hyacinth Beans: 2 qian

    Combine all with 1.5 sheng of water, add 3-5 slices of fresh ginger, and decoct for consumption.[182p]

　　解肝煎　治妊娠肝气滞逆，胀满不安。　　陈皮　半夏　厚朴　茯苓各钱半　砂仁七分　苏叶　芍药各一钱　　水一锺半，加生姜三五片，煎服。

　　化肝煎　治妊娠怒动肝气兼火，胎气不安。　　青皮　陈皮　芍药各二钱　栀子炒　丹皮　泽泻各钱半　土贝母二三钱　　水一锺半，煎七八分，食远温服。如血见下部者，以甘草代泽泻。
　　紫苏饮　治妊娠失调，胎气不安，上攻作痛，名曰子悬。或临产气结不下等证。　　人参　甘草各半两　大腹皮　川芎　白芍　陈皮　苏叶　当归各一两　　右，每服一两，姜葱水煎服。一方有香附，无人参。一方无川芎，名七宝散。若肝脾气血虚而有火不安者，宜兼逍遥散。若脾气虚弱而不安者，宜用四君芎归汤。
　　五味异功散　治妊娠脾胃气虚而恶阻者。　　人参　白朮炒　茯苓　炙甘草　陈皮各一钱　　右，加姜枣，水煎服。[183p]

Jie Gan Decoction: Used to treat stagnant liver qi during pregnancy, with symptoms of bloating and discomfort. Ingredients include half a qian of Chenpi (dried tangerine peel), Banxia (Pinellia tuber), Houpu (magnolia bark), and Fuling (Poria), seven fen of Sharen (cardamom), and one qian each of Suye (perilla leaf) and Shaoyao (peony root). Add one and a half sheng of water and three to five slices of fresh ginger, then decoct and take.

Hua Gan Decoction: Used to treat anger and liver qi combined with heat during pregnancy, causing fetal unease. Ingredients include two qian each of Qingpi (green tangerine peel), Chenpi, and Shaoyao, half a qian each of Zhi Zhi (fruits of Gardenia) and Danpi (Moutan root), two to three qian of Tu Beimu (bulb of Fritillaria), and one and a half sheng of water. Decoct to seven or eight parts, and take warm after meals. If there is blood seen in the lower part, substitute licorice for Ze Xie (Alisma).

Zi Su Drink: Used to treat pregnancy imbalance, fetal unease, and upper abdominal pain, referred to as "the child hanging." It may also address issues of energy stagnation near labor. Ingredients include half a liang each of Ren Shen (ginseng) and Gan Cao (licorice), and one liang each of Dabu Pi (large abdomen peel), Chuan Xiong (Sichuan lovage), Bai Shao (white peony), Chen Pi, Su Ye, and Dang Gui (Angelica). Each serving consists of one liang, decocted in ginger and scallion water. There is a variation with Xiangfu (Cyperus) instead of ginseng, and another without Chuan Xiong, known as Qibao Powder. If there is liver and spleen qi and blood deficiency with heat and unease, combine with Xiao Yao Powder. If there is spleen qi deficiency and unease, use Si Jun Qiung Gui Decoction.

Wu Wei Yi Gong Powder: Used to treat spleen and stomach qi deficiency with nausea during pregnancy. Ingredients include one qian each of Ren Shen, Bai Zhu (Atractylodes), Fuling, Zhi Gan Cao, and Chenpi, with ginger and jujube added, decocted and taken.[183p]

　　六味异功散　治妊娠胃虚，兼寒多呕。　　人参二三钱　白朮　茯苓各二钱　陈皮　炙甘草各一钱　干姜炒，一二钱　　水一锺半，煎服。

　　和胃饮　治妊娠胃寒气实，胎气上逼者。　　陈皮　厚朴姜制，各一钱半　干姜炮，一二钱　炙甘草一钱　　水锺半，煎七分，温服。

Liuwèi Yìgōng San: Treats gastrointestinal deficiency during pregnancy, especially with excessive vomiting due to cold. Ingredients: 2-3 qian of ginseng, 2 qian each of white atractylodes and poria, 1 qian each of dried tangerine peel and roasted licorice, and 1-2 qian of stir-fried dried ginger. Boil with 1.5 zhōng of water and take as a decoction.

Héwèi Yǐn: Treats cold and excess qi in the stomach during pregnancy, with the fetus exerting pressure upwards. Ingredients: 1.5 qian each of dried tangerine peel, magnolia bark, and ginger, 1-2 qian of stir-fried dried ginger, and 1 qian of roasted licorice. Boil with 0.5 zhōng of water, reduce to seven parts, and take warm.

Wǔ Jūnzǐ Jiān: Treats spleen deficiency with cold during pregnancy, also with the fetus exerting pressure upwards. Ingredients: ginseng as needed, 2 qian each of white atractylodes and poria, 1 qian of roasted licorice, and 1-2 qian of stir-fried ginger. Boil with 1.5 zhōng of water and take as a decoction.

Qīng Huà Yǐn: Treats postpartum heat due to fire, as well as chaotic blood heat, yin deficiency, and other symptoms related to unclear fire. Also treats blood heat and leakage during pregnancy. Ingredients: 2 qian each of peony and ophiopogon, 2-3 qian each of moutan root, poria, and scutellaria, and 1 qian of dendrobium. Boil with 1.5 zhōng of water, reduce to seven parts, and take warm away from meals.

Sì Shèng Sǎn: Treats bleeding during miscarriage. Ingredients: equal parts of scutellaria, white atractylodes, sand ginger, and gelatin. Grind to a fine powder; take 2 qian each time, mixed with moxibustion broth. One variation includes peony and omits gelatin. If made into a decoction, reduce the amount of sand ginger by half.[184p]

　　五阴煎　治妊娠脾肾兼虚而漏血者。亦治产后阴虚。　　熟地五七钱或一两　山药炒　芍药炒，各二钱　扁豆炒，二三钱　茯苓一钱半　五味子二十粒　人参随宜　白朮炒　炙甘草各一二钱　　水二锺，加莲肉去心二十粒，煎服。

Xu Duan Decoction: Treats mild heat from blood deficiency during pregnancy, with bleeding in urine.

Wuwu Decoction: Treats difficult labor or misaligned fetus, indicating imminent difficulty in retention.

　　决津煎　治同上。
　　当归三五钱或一两　泽泻一钱半　牛膝二钱　肉桂一二钱　乌药一钱　熟地二三钱或五七钱　　水二锺，煎七分，食前服。如气血虚，不必用乌药。

　　赤金豆　一名八仙丹。治鬼胎。
　　巴霜去皮膜，略去油，一钱半　皂角炒微焦，二钱　生附子切略炒燥　朱砂各二钱　轻粉一钱　丁香　木香　天竺黄各三钱　　右为末，酢浸蒸饼，为丸萝卜子大，以为朱砂为衣，欲渐去者每服五七丸，欲骤行者每服一二十丸，用滚水，或煎药，或姜、酢、茶、蜜、茴香、史君煎汤为引送下。若下多不止，可饮冷水一二口即止。盖此药得热则行，得冷则止也。

　　安胎顺气：香附子炒为末，浓煎紫苏汤，服一二钱。或加砂仁。 【华佗】[186p]

Jue Jin Jian: This remedy is prepared as previously instructed.
Ingredients:

  • 3 to 5 qian (or 1 liang) of Angelica (Dang Gui)

Gu Tai Jian: This remedy treats frequent miscarriages due to excessive liver and spleen heat and stagnation.
Ingredients:

  • 2 qian of Huang Qin (Scutellaria)
  • 1 to 2 qian of Bai Zhu (Atractylodes)

Chi Jin Dou: Also known as Ba Xian Dan. Used to treat ghost pregnancy.
Ingredients:

  • 1.5 qian of Ba Shuang (removed from the skin, slightly defatted)
  • 2 qian of Fried Soap Pod (Zao Jiao) until slightly charred
  • 2 qian each of Raw Aconite (Sheng Fu Zi, cut and slightly roasted) and Cinnabar (Zhu Sha)
  • 1 qian of Light Powder (Qing Fen)
  • 3 qian each of Clove (Ding Xiang), Aromatic Wood (Mu Xiang), and Yellow Turmeric (Tian Zhu Huang)
  • Grind the above into a fine powder, soak in vinegar and steam into pills the size of radish seeds, coated with Cinnabar. For gradual effect, take 5 to 7 pills each time; for immediate effect, take 10 to 20 pills. Use boiling water, or decoct with ginger, vinegar, tea, honey, anise, or herbal decoction as a guide for ingestion. If it flows excessively, drink a couple of sips of cold water to stop. This medicine acts in heat and stops in cold.

Single Formula:
To calm the fetus and regulate Qi: Grind fried Cyperus (Xiang Fu Zi) into powder and decoct a strong infusion of Perilla (Zi Su), taking 1 to 2 qian. May also add Sha Ren (Amomum). 【Hua Tuo】[186p]

　　妊妇胎动：朱砂末一钱，和鸡子白三枚，搅匀顿服，胎死即出，未死即安。
　　胎气不安，气不升降，呕血酸水：香附、藿香、甘草各一钱为末，每服二钱，入盐少许，沸汤服之。【《圣惠》】
　　胎动不安，或腰痛胎转抢心，下血不止，或日月未足而欲产，并以菖蒲根捣汁一二升服之。【《千金》】
　　妊娠胎动或腰痛，或抢心，或下血不止，或倒产子死腹中：艾叶一鸡子大，酒四升，煮二升，分二服。【《肘后方》】
　　胎动迫心作痛：艾叶鸡子大，以头酢四升，煎二升，分温服。 【《子母秘录》】
　　姙娠疾病，胎不能安，可下之：取七月七日法曲四两，水二大盏，煎取一盏三分，绵滤去滓，分温三服，立下。　　又方：用大曲五升，清酒一斗，煮二沸，去滓，分五服，隔宿勿食，但再服即下如糜，母无疾苦。
　　胎痛欲产，日月未足者：以全蛇蜕一条，绢袋盛繞腰系之。 【《千金》，下同】[187p]

Movements of the fetus during pregnancy: One penny of powdered vermilion, mixed with the whites of three eggs, stir evenly and take at once; if the fetus is dead, it will be expelled; if not, it will be settled.

For fetal distress, gas not rising or falling, and vomiting blood and sour liquid: One penny each of cyperus, patchouli, and licorice, powdered; take two pennies each time, add a little salt, and take with boiling water.

For unstable fetal movements, back pain, fetal turning causing heart distress, continuous bleeding, or premature labor: Use one to two liters of juice from the root of sweet flag.

For abdominal pain during pregnancy, back pain, heart distress, continuous bleeding, or a dead fetus in the womb: One size of mugwort leaves, four liters of wine; boil down to two liters, and take in two doses.

For painful fetal movements pressing against the heart: One size of mugwort leaves, four liters of vinegar; boil down to two liters, and take warm in divided doses.

For pregnancy-related illnesses where the fetus cannot settle: Take four taels of special yeast from the seventh day of the seventh month, two large cups of water, boil down to one cup and three parts, strain out the residue, and take warm in three doses to induce expulsion.

Another formula: Use five liters of major yeast and one斗 of clear wine, boil and skim, divide into five doses, avoid eating until the next evening, but upon taking again, it will be expelled like porridge, with no suffering for the mother.

For fetal pain wanting to be delivered when the due date has not yet arrived: Use one whole snake skin, place it in a silk bag and tie it around the waist.[187p]

　　胎动不安，腰痛或胎上抢心烦闷，或下血：葱白大者二十茎，浓煮汁饮之，胎未死即安，已死即出，神效。
　　妊娠胎动：豉绞汁温服，华陀方也。 【《本草》】　　又方：生曲饼研末，水和绞汁，温服三升。 【《肘后方》，下同】
　　妊娠胎动欲堕，腹痛不可忍：苎根二两銼，银石器酒水相半煎服妙。　　又方：干荷蒂一枚炙研，糯米泔一锺，调服即安。 【《经验方》】
　　妊妇腹痛：烧车缸脂末，纳酒中随意饮。 【《千金》】
　　胎动腹痛，或下黄汁如漆如豆汁者：野苎根、金银花根各五钱，水酒相半煎服。 【《入门》，下同】　　又方：鹿角胶炒成珠作末，以米饮调下二钱。　　又方：用好银煮取水，着葱油食之佳。　　又方：用苎根如足指大者一尺，(口父)咀，以水五升，煮取三升，去滓服。或加生姜五片亦可。丹溪云：苎根大能补阴而行滞血。[188p]

When fetal movements are restless, accompanied by back pain or discomfort in the chest, or if there is bleeding: Use twenty stalks of white scallion, boil them in strong juice and drink. If the fetus is not dead, it will stabilize; if it is dead, it will be expelled—an effective remedy.

For excessive fetal movement during pregnancy: Warmly take the juice from fermented soybeans; this is from the Hua Tuo recipe. Another method: Grind fresh wheat cakes into powder, mix with water to extract juice, and take three sheng warm.

If the fetus is about to fall with unbearable abdominal pain: Use two liang of ramie root, cut finely, and decoct with equal parts of wine and water. Another method: Take one dried lotus stalk, roast and grind it, mix with a bowl of glutinous rice wash, and take it to settle the condition.

For abdominal pain in a pregnant woman: Burn car oil powder and mix it into wine to drink at will.

If fetal movement causes abdominal pain or leads to yellow fluid discharge resembling lacquer or bean juice: Use five qian each of wild ramie root and honeysuckle root, decoct with equal parts of water and wine. Another method: Use two qian of processed deer antler glue powdered into beads, and mix with rice drink.

Another method: Use good silver to boil and take the water, adding scallion oil for consumption is good. Another method: Use ramie root, one foot long, about the size of a finger, chew it, and boil in five liters of water to yield three liters, then remove the residue to drink. Adding five slices of fresh ginger is also acceptable. Danxi stated that ramie root can greatly nourish Yin and promote blood circulation.[188p]

　　妊娠胎动，昼夜叫呼，口喋唇搴，及下重痢不息：用艾叶五两，以好酒五升同煮，取四升，去滓，更煎取一升。口闭者，开口灌之，药下即瘥。
　　妊娠无故下血不止：阿胶三两炙捣末，酒一升半，煎令消，一服愈。　　又方：阿胶二两捣末，生地半斤捣取汁，以清酒三升绞汁，分三服。
　　闪颠胎动欲漏：砂仁皮炒令热透为末一钱，或酒或盐汤下。
　　胎漏下血不止：用桃树上干不落桃子烧灰和水服瘥。《本草》云：桃奴破血，又治伏梁积气。
　　姙娠心痛：用青竹茹一升，酒二升，煮取一升，去滓，分温顿服。　　又方：用破鸡子一枚，酒调服之。

　　妊娠胎动欲落，腹中痛不可忍：用上等银一斤，茅根二两去黑皮，以水九升，煮银五升，入清酒一升，同煎茅根，取三升，分三服，立安。[189p]

During pregnancy, if there is fetal movement accompanied by persistent crying, mouth and lips twitching, and relentless severe diarrhea: use five taels of mugwort leaves, boil them together with five sheng of good wine, take four sheng, strain, and further decoct to obtain one sheng. For those unable to open their mouths, administer orally, and healing will occur immediately.

If there is unexplained bleeding during pregnancy that does not stop: take three taels of donkey-hide gelatin, roast and crush into powder, mix with one and a half sheng of wine, decoct until dissolved, and one dose will heal. Another method: take two taels of donkey-hide gelatin powdered, half a jin of fresh rehmannia to extract juice, and mix with three sheng of clear wine, strain the juice, and divide into three doses.

For fetal movement accompanied by a sensation of impending miscarriage: take one qian of fried cardamom seeds powdered, and administer with wine or salt water.

For persistent bleeding associated with a threatened miscarriage: use ashes from dried peach fruit that has not fallen from the tree, mix with water and ingest for healing. The "Bencao" states that peach kernels break blood and also treat accumulations from stagnated qi.

For heart pain during pregnancy: use one sheng of young bamboo shoots, two sheng of wine, boil to obtain one sheng, strain, and take warm in divided doses. Another method: use one broken chicken egg mixed with wine and take.

For fetal movement threatening to miscarry, with unbearable abdominal pain: use one jin of high-quality silver, two taels of sedge roots (discarding the black skin), boil in nine sheng of water to obtain five sheng of silver solution, add one sheng of clear wine, continue to decoct with sedge roots, take three sheng, divided into three doses, and stability will be achieved immediately.[189p]

　　妊娠腰背痛，反复不得：用鹿角长六寸，烧令赤，酒中淬，再烧再淬。以角碎为度，取所淬酒饮之。
　　孕妇腹内钟鸣：用鼠窟前后土为细末，研麝香，酒调下二钱，立愈。或不用酒亦可。
